loans.name: Isis Flora

texts.es:
Isis  tiene 24 años, es unida con el padre de hijo, y  tiene un hijo.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Isis trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

En su tiempo libre comparte con la familia. El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, herbicidas y parala balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos

Su meta es que los cultivos salgan bien para vender en buen precio y tener mejores ganancias.

En los tiempos libres les gustaria viajar a la playa.
texts.en:
Isis, who is 24, is married and has one son.  She lives in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos Province.  

She is a member of the Aso 10 de Septiembre rural communal bank which is located in Lechugalito, an area which belongs to Ventanas canton in Los Ríos Province.

Isis works in farming, growing corn and breeding chickens to boost her family's budget.  Her most successful crop is corn and she sells her products at Ventanas market.

She sends her free time with her family.

Isis is applying for the loan for her farming - to buy urea, seeds, weed killer and for balanced fattening products and farming chickens.

Her ambition is for her crops to grow well so she can sell them for a good price and boost her profits.

In he free time she likes going to the beach.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, weed killer and for balanced fattening products and farming chickens

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru:
Зариф активный мужчина из района Шахритус. Ему 33 года и он женатый мужчина. Зариф хочет в своей жизни успеть во всем и попробовать все. Зариф живет в одном из сел района Шахритус. Там он занимался животноводством и растениеводством. Причина, по которой он выбрал эти деятельности, является чистый, свежий воздух и климат, который благоприятно влияет на такие деятельности. Земля, на которой он работал, сейчас принадлежит не ему. И он решился начать новый бизнес.
   Зариф решил заняться торговлей. Он хочет начать свой бизнес по продаже грецких орехов и миндаля. На сумму от кредита он намерен купить грецкие орехи и миндаль. На всю сумму кредита он купит товар и надеется успешно его продать.
texts.en:
Zarif is an energetic man from the Shahritus district. He is 33 years old and married. He wants to have a chance to do and try everything in life. Zarif lives in a village, where he raises livestock and plants crops. He chose this kind of work because of the fresh, clean air and climate that has a positive effect on farming activities. The land he works does not belong to him, so he has decided to start his own business.

Zarif has decided to start a business selling walnuts and almonds, and has taken out a loan to buy them. He is using the full amount of the loan to buy the goods and hopes to sell them successfully.

loans.use: to purchase almonds and walnuts

loans.name: Wang'ae Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his late 30s, is married, with two children who are still going to school.  He has been running several businesses, selling cooking oil called alizeti, and running a general store. He has been in his business for seven months only.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salum's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to start selling cooking oil and he bought items for the general store.  He has successfully paid back his loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees and he covered household expenses.  He is grateful for the loan.  

Salum will use this loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, beans, backing flour, maize flour, salt, etc. He dreams of buying and preparing a big farm and planting alizet seeds to be able to get more cooking oil.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group, Wang'ae Group, which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, beans, backing flour, maize flour, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ngamba 11 Kweyamba Group

texts.en: Bosi, whose hand is raised in the photo, is a thirty-one-year-old farmer living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has four children, but only two go to school. He sells cocoa to one of the major dealers, ESCO Uganda, which has its factory setup in the district. He uses the income to improve and meet some of his basic needs and supplements it with income from his retail shop. He wishes to build a permanent building and educate his children to reach a higher level of understanding. His is challenged by seasonality changes and price fluctuation, while his dream is to become a leading cocoa grower. Bosi intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 36 years old and married. He is from the village of Gurjaani, in the Kakheti Region, which is famous for its ancient grape growing traditions and hospitality. Gela lives in his own house with his wife, two school-age children and his retired mother. Gela is a police patrol officer and gets a monthly salary. Besides his main job, Gela leads the family agricultural business and grows peaches on his own piece of land. Seasonally, in summer, Gela sells the fruit at the open market. 

In order to meet his increasing household expenses, Gela plans to buy a vineyard and a small piece of land near his house. He will start growing grapes and plant additional peach trees. Gela will pick the grapes in September and squeeze them to make Georgian wine. He will sell his produce locally for a good price and increase his family's income. Gela will work hard and hopes that his initiative will give him a chance to improve his standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy a vineyard and a piece of land.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 40 years old. She is married, with 7 children ages between 4 and 17. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 35-year-old married woman who lives In Telavi, east Georgia with her husband and three children. She has her own business, selling some products from her house. Her husband works at a government institution, and his income is 400 Gel monthly. Nowadays the income isn’t enough for a big family, so she requested a loan. 

The start up loan, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 2500 to open a bakery.

Natia decided to diversify her business and open a bakery, as she already has an oven. She finds it easy to get orders and bakes Georgian food, such as Khachapuri (cheese pie), etc. 

She is a very hardworking woman, and she will do her best to improve family conditions.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 65 años de edad, no estudio desde niña, pero es una persona luchadora porque ya adulta aprendió un programa de alfabetización llego hasta su casa y aprendió a escribir y poner la firma.

Es viuda desde hace  18 años, con el que era su esposo tuvieron en común 5 hijos los cuales todos son hogares a parte ningún hijo vive con ella solamente viven con ella dos nietos,  los cuales ella los cuida y ellos  se dedican a estudiar  educación básica.

Ella posee una tienda en la comunidad donde vive, tiene 12 años de dedicarse al comercio,  decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque cuando inicio  su tienda no había ninguna en la comunidad  y observo una buena oportunidad para hacer negocio y además ella se dedicaba a la agricultura,  pero eso no era suficiente para solventar las necesidades que tenía en su hogar, la cliente va a comprar 2 veces por semana a la ciudad y recorre 23 kilómetros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar productos para la tienda como golosinas, refrescos, jugos, gaseosas, pan y productos de primera necesidad, como Jabón, pasta dental, papel higiénico entre otras. 

El préstamo mejorara la vida del  cliente, porque mejorara los ingresos y tendrá la oportunidad de vender más y cubrir las necesidades  puntuales que tiene la necesidad a satisfacer será la de proveerse de mercadería para cubrir la demanda que tiene.

Sus sueños son abrir un puesto de negocio en la ciudad, tener un espacio donde su negocio crezca y desearía convertirse en una empresaria, para su familia su deseo es que ellos se superen trabajando y esforzándose y ella colaborarles en lo que se pueda, el préstamo le ayudara a comprar más productos para la venta y tener una mejor ganancia.

La ganancia la utilizare para el otro año ampliar su negocio y lo realizara de dos formas posibles una es que pueda llevar su puesto de trabajo hasta la ciudad u otra poniendo otro puesto de venta en la comunidad  para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old and did not attend school, but is a hardworking person because she learned to read, write, and sign her name as an adult.

She has been a widow for 18 years and she and her husband had 5 children who are now adults, but two grandchildren live with her.  She cares for them and they attend elementary school.

She has had a neighborhood store for 12 years.  When she started her store there wasn’t one in the community and she says its a good opportunity.  She is also a farmer but this was not enough to pay the household expenses.  She makes her purchases twice a week in town, 23 km away. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy products for her store, such as snacks, soft drinks, juices, soft drinks, bread, and personal products such as soap, toothpaste, bathroom tissue, and other things.

This loan will improve her quality of life because her income will improve and she will have the opportunity to sell and cover more needs by stocking up to cover her customer demand.

She wants to open a branch of her business in the city and have a place where her business will grow and she can become an entrepreneur.  Her desire for her family is for them to succeed working and striving with her help.  This loan will help her buy more products and have better earrings.

She will use her earnings to expand her business next year in two forms; one by setting up in the city and the other by setting up another one in her community so she can have better earnings.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa es una joven universitaria de 18 años de edad, emprendedora y dinámica. Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de helados y ensaladas de frutas, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado que le colabora en las mañanas mientras ella asiste a sus clases de odontología y, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante un año que lleva funcionando su negocio.
El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de surtido al por mayor (helados, frutas, salsas dulces, galletas dulces, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer más variedad de productos y sabores que satisfagan los gustos de sus clientes, abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe.
Luisa, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, adquirir más mesas y sillas para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de comensales, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento, además desea culminar sus estudios universitarios y ser una profesional, alternando ambas actividades, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 18-year-old Luisa is a young, enterprising and dynamic university student.  Wanting to contribute to the family budget, she decided to set up her own business selling ice cream and fruit salads.  She has an employee who works in the morning while Luisa attends her dentistry classes.  In this way, she has managed to cover her family and personal expenses during the year she has been running her business.  The loan she is seeking will be used to buy supplies in bulk (ice cream, fruit, sweet sauces, sweet biscuits, among other things).  This will enable her to continue her work and offer a wider range of products and flavours to satisfy her customers' tastes. This will enable her to boost her sales and, in turn, increase her income.  Such is Luisa's determination to succeed and achieve her ambitions that she has now set herself the goal of extending her premises and acquiring more tables and chairs so she can serve larger numbers of diners and, thereby, improve profitability. However, she also wants to complete her university studies and have a professional career.  By alternating her two activities she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk (ice cream, fruit, sweet sauces, sweet biscuits, among other things)

loans.name: Indira Gandhi Group

texts.en:
The name of this Joint Liability Group is Indira Gandhi, located at Khariar town of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. This group was formed in the year 2010 comprising four active and able women. Tabasum is one of the members of this group. She is standing in front with raised hand inside her poultry farm in the photo. She is a very confident lady of a minority community and she possesses a strong determination for the development of her family. She is 34 years old, living with her husband, two daughters of 18 and 16 years, and a son of 14 years.
 
Tabasum has been running a poultry/chicken farm for the last eight years with the help of her husband, who looks after it. She herself is running a tailoring center in her house with two sewing machines where she takes orders of stitching of ladies garments. Tabasum earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR from the above two businesses, and with this it is very hard to manage both the family and the educational expenses of the children. So Tabasum is planning to expand the chicken farm business to get some extra income. As her farm has a reputation for supplying quality chicken, customers from far and near villages like to deal with her farm. 

This is the fourth loan for Tabasum and from this loan she wants to purchase chickens in bulk from the nearest wholesale market to save transportation cost and loss due to rate fluctuation. She is very hopeful that this investment will be helping her. She hopes to give better education to her children and marriage for her elder daughter. 
  
The other three members of this group are Husna Ara, Sukrubari and Jarina, running procurement of seasonal products, photo framing center and general grocery shop, respectively.

loans.use: to pay for bulk purchasing of chickens for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a married woman and has six children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and she has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area of high population and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Israr Ahmed

texts.en:
Israr Ahmed, from the beautiful city of Lahore, Pakistan, is 57 and has a partner and six children. A friendly, hard working and honorable person, he owns a construction material shop where he sells cement, bricks, sand and concrete, and provides sheltering services also. 

Recently Isar Ahmed purchased a large quantity of bricks and has also been spending his savings to meet household expenses. Now he does not have sufficient money to buy other materials such as cement and sand. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy the required construction materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for resale.

loans.name: Shodi

texts.ru:
Шоди 55 лет. Он живет со своей семьей в маленьком городке Вахдат. Шоди пожилой человек и уже не может заниматься тяжелой работой. Он работает наемным рабочим и его получаемый доход маленький и не стабильный. Шоди решил заняться животноводством, потому что он не требует тяжелой работы и приносит хорошую прибыль. У Шоди при дворе его дома имеется сарай размером 7х5 метра. Он хочет использовать его в качестве коровника для скота. Но сарай очень старый и сперва его необходимо слегка отремонтировать. Шоди имеет сбережение в размере 600 долларов. Но эта маленькая сумма, чтобы начать такой бизнес. Он обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита и сбережения Шоди планирует купить четыре голов бычков и сделать ремонт в сарае для содержания в нем скота.
Кредит поможет Шоди открыть собственный прибыльный и стабильный бизнес и ему больше не придется выполнять тяжелую работу во вред своему здоровью, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Он с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Shodi is 55 years old.  He lives with his family in a small town Vahdat.  Shodi is an elderly person and can no longer do hard labor.  He works as a contractor and his income is small and unstable.  Shodi decided to get involved in animal husbandry because it does not require hard labor and yields a good profit.  Shodi has a 7x5 meter barn in the yard of his home.  He wants to use it as a cowshed for livestock.  But the barn is very old and needs to be repaired slightly.  Shodi has savings in the amount of 600 dollars.  But this is a small sum to start this business.  He requested a loan.  Shodi will use the loan and his savings to buy four heads of bulls and make repairs in the barn for keeping livestock there.  The loan will help Shodi to open his own profitable business, which will allow him to stop doing hard work, detrimental to his health, to provide for his family.  He is awaiting support with hope.

loans.use: to buy four bulls and repair an old barn for keeping livestock there

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1966 à Bougouni, Mamadou est une homme marié et père de 5 enfants. Il vit chez son père dans le quartier Medine de Bougouni.  
Mamadou est un frigoriste de profession. Dans le souci de renforcer son secteur d’activité, il décide d’associer l’activité d’achat et de vente de pièces détachées (Frigo) Il y a environ 10 ans. Il jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commande surtout à l’approche de la saison chaude car c’est en ce moment que les détenteurs de réfrigérateur ont assez de problème. Ainsi, il décida d’adhérer au programme de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son 1 er prêt individuel. il compte acheter avec ce prêt  5 bouteille de gaz de 12 kilo et 20 ventilateurs. Il les revendra dans son atelier à une clientèle composée généralement des chefs de famille qui dispose d’un ou plusieurs congélateurs et ses collègue frigoristes de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1966 in Bougouni, Mamadou is a married man and father of five children. He lives in his father's home in the  Medine district of Bougouni.  

Mamadou is a refrigeration expert by trade. Wishing to expand the scope of his business, he decided to add on the purchase and resale of spare parts for refrigerators about 10 years ago. He has a good reputation in this business and gets lots of orders, especially when the hot season is approaching, for this is the moment when those who own refrigerators have a lot of problems. 

Thus, Mamadou decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso program with which he is presently on his first individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy five bottles of gas of 12 kilograms each and 20 fans.  He will resell them in his workshop to a clientele composed mainly of heads of family who have one or more freezers as well as to his local colleagues in the cooling business.

Based on this loan, Mamadou expects to make a monthly profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to share in covering family expenses and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder in his activity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for refrigerators

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 5enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Koulikoro, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, d’arachide et d’habillements.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente MINATA, la première personne à droite est vendeuse d’arachide. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt,  dix sacs d’arachide non décortiqués auprès des producteurs, qui seront ensuite décortiqués pour être vendu à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femme. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA par mois. Une partie du bénéfice sera réinvesti dans l’activité et l’autre est faite pour couvrir les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The DJANTOYERELA group consists of married women who average 47 years of age, and five children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Fala Koulikoro, located in the commune of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know one another as neighbors, friends, and through ties of kinship. 

The group members sell cereals, groundnuts and clothing. This is their 24th loan cycle. MINATA, first on the right, is a reseller of groundnuts. She will use her loan to buy ten sacks of groundnuts from farmers. These groundnuts will then be shelled and sold to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Minata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA. She will use part of her profits to reinvest in her activity and the remainder to help cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en: Sobir was born in 1962, has a college degree and is a teacher in a secondary school. Sobir likes his job. He earns additional income from animal husbandry. His wife is housewife. He is the only income provider in his family as his son doesn’t work because he is student. Sobir’s son studies at the Khujand State University. Sobir must pay for his son's education at the university and is asking for a loan to cover those costs. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his son's education expenses

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1966 and is married with two children. Zamira is a sewer. She learned how to sew women's clothes a year ago. Now, Zamira is going to open her workshop. She plans to teach girls how to sew and also serve as a sewer to local people. She completed the course ‘To Get Ahead,’ through a women's organization, and developed her skills. Her daughter will help her manage the business. Zamira is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine and to pay for rental placement. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to pay for rental placement for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila agradece los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y desea continuar participando de este proyecto, ella sigue radicando en la ciudad de Paucartambo y donde continua vendiendo granos secos como por ejemplo habas, trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas más por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos como maíz, trigo y otras cosas. 

Ella nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 60 años de edad, ella es viuda pero tiene seis hijos y pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a native of Paucartambo. She is 60 years old, is a widow and has six children. She still lives in the city of Paucartambo where she sells dried grains like broad beans, wheat, barley, corn, etc.

Therefore she wants a loan to buy dried grains like corn, wheat, etc. She belongs to the “San Martincito” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Paucartambo. Luzmila thanks the lenders for the support offered and wishes to continue participating in this project.

loans.use: to buy dried grains such as corn and wheat.

loans.name: Maritza Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas desde hace 10 años en  su comunidad el cual es muy conocido y visitado. 
Doña Maritza el crédito lo necesita para la compra de más materia prima como ser: carne, maíz, pollo, pan, mantequilla, aceite, leña, harina, etc. que necesita para la elaboración de sus golosinas.
Doña Maritza espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto, además que sus ventas aumenten y con esto  poder mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos.
Doña Maritza espera en unos  hacer crecer  su negocio y con esto seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos terminen  los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Maritza is a very hard-working person.  She lives with her three children in a community in southern Honduras.  She has had a business of selling sweets in her community for ten years.  Her business is very well-known and frequented.

Maritza needs the loan to buy raw materials like meat, corn, chicken, bread, butter, cooking oil, firewood, and flour, etc.  She needs these supplies to make her confections.

Maritza expects that the loan will help her a lot because she does not have the supplies needed to continue making her product.  Also, her sales will increase.  With this increase in her profits she will be able to improve her family’s lifestyle at home.

Maritza hopes to make her business grow.  With this she will continue supporting her family.  Her children will complete their education, and they will have better opportunities in the future.

Coluteca, Honduras – November, 2013

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, chicken, bread, butter, cooking oil, firewood, and flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rema Ii Group

texts.fr:
Joseph fait partie du groupe  Rema II  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 32 ans et est marié  à Agrippine, une cultivatrice.  Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 9 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Il  fait le commerce des habits et des chaussures  depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’habits et de chaussures  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter  une parcelle , une moto pour son transport et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Joseph is a member of the group called Rema II  and lives in Rumonge. He is 32 years old and married to Agrippine, a farmer.  Together they have three children aged between four and nine years old, of whom one is enrolled in school. 

Joseph has been selling clothing and shoes for two years. This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he intends to grow his working capital and buy lots of garments and shoes to resell so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, Joseph would like to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle for his transport, as well as see his children enrolled in school.

loans.use: to grow his working capital and buy lots of clothing and shoes to resell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
This is William, 61, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married and has children, his youngest in high school. He works hard to provide for his family while he is also managing their household.

William maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. He starts work early in the morning and works until late in the evening. There are times when he drives until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

William dreams of expanding his business and having more tricycle units. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 61 years old. She is a widow with two children. She is very happy for the past loan which helped in rebuilding her business. Now she feels more secure and confident with her business. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Sharookan Group

texts.en: This group is called Sharookan. It consists of four members who are all females. All of them are friends and from Hodeidah, Yemen. Mabroka is a 34-year-old single lady.  She sells incense, perfumes and pigment at low rates to clients in her community.  She is responsible for the durable household expenses and her income was not enough for the whole family, which is why she started her business. She has developed a good reputation in her community for her customer dealings and good quality services.  She has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB for her business. With this loan, she will purchase cosmetics, incense and perfumes, which will allow her to fulfill her client orders on time and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, incense and perfumes, which will allow her to fulfill her client orders on time and earn higher profits.

loans.name: Mayra Yaneth

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven de 23 años, estudio hasta quinto grado de nivel académico, es casada; el esposo se dedica a trabajar en una empresa de telefonía como reparador de computadoras, tiene dos hijos, los dos están en casa.

Mayra se dedica a la agricultura, ella quiere implementar el negocio de gallinas indias ya que tiene principio, como el lugar donde las tendría y tiene algunas gallinas que para este tiempo de la navidad se venden mucho y las personas buscan bastante.

Con el préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pollos pequeños, para instalar una granja, aparte de pagar algunas deudas a prestamistas que ella tiene lo demás lo invertirá en la granja. 

Ella quisiera tener una granja muy grande, para  trabajar y ayudarle a su esposo a los ingresos de la casa y trabajar de una u otra manera y poder sacar adelanta a sus hijos; ya que como madre trabaja para darle un buen estilo de vida a los hijos y educarlos de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Mayra is 23 years old. She studied up to Grade 5. She is married and her husband works for a telephone company as a computer technician. They have two children who live at home.

Mayra works in agriculture. She wants to start a chicken business. As a start she has the space to raise them and already has some chickens. With the Christmas season lots of people look for them and they sell well.

Mayra will buy some chicks with the loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo and start a farm. Besides this she will pay some loans she owes to lenders and what's left over will be put into the farm. She wants to have a big farm to work and help her husband with the household expenses and get the kids ahead. as a mother she works to give them a good lifestyle and educate them in the best manner.

loans.use: to buy young chickens, to start a farm and pay some debts owning to lenders.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bouwere, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments,  des céréales, des produits alimentaires et des articles divers.
 Les femmes du groupe BENKADI  sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Elles sont tous des habituées du programme de Soro Yiriwaso et les prêts demandés seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente YAH, assise de la gauche vers la droite est une  vendeuse d’arachide.  Elle compte acheter un sac d’arachide auprès des producteurs. La vente se fait au marché à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 6000CFA. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité et dans l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Bouwere, Konobougou commune, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women of the group know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell condiments, cereals, food products and other goods for a living. They are on their seventh group loan. They are all members of Soro Yirwaso and the loans they receive will be used to buy the items mentioned above.

Yah, seated on the left, sells groundnuts. She plans to buy a sac of groundnuts from producers. She sells her groundnuts at a market to a mixed clientele.

Yah hopes to earn a monthly income of 6,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in the business and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bouwere, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de jarre,  des condiments, des céréales, du couscous et de la restauration.                
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO  sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FOUNE la personne au milieu est vendeuse de couscous, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de mil et 5kg de sel pour la confection de son couscous. Le couscous est  vendu au village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11.000CFA. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité de vente de couscous.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is made up of married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Bouwere, Konobougou commune, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women of the group know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell jars, condiments, cereals, couscous and do food preparation for a living. They are on their eighth group loan.

Foune, standing in the middle, sells couscous. She plans to buy two sacs of millet and five kilograms of salt to make her couscous. She sells her couscous in the village to a mixed clientele. 

Sira hopes to earn a monthly income of 11,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy millet and salt

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua vendiendo comestibles por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo detergentes, arroz, azúcar, pan, gaseosas y otras cosas, ella sigue perteneciendo al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.  Ella nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la ciudad antes mencionada, ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Marisol is a native of the city of Paucartambo and lives with her family there. She is 32 years old, married and as fruit of this beautiful relationship has four children. She belongs to the “San Martincito” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Paucartambo.

Marisol Continues selling groceries and at this time she requires another loan to buy merchandise like detergent, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, etc. She is grateful to the lenders for this loan and is happy with the support given her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like detergents, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en un su casa de su familia en la zona de Villa Litoral  ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica principalmente a la venta de varios productos en distintos supermercados de la ciudad. Los productos que vende son de la empresa donde trabaja por ocho horas diarias. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 17 horas en diferentes zona de la ciudad. 
 Adrian necesita el credito para poder adquirir una computadora portatil para utilizarla en su trabajo para un mejor control de la mercadería y también para sus estudios y asi tener un mejor desarrolo academico y laboral.

El sueño de Adrian es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su persona, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adrian is a very hardworking person.  He lives in his family’s house in the Villa Litoral neighborhood that is located in the city of La Paz. 

He works mainly in sales, selling various products in different supermarkets throughout the city for the company that employs him.  He works for eight hours daily in different areas of the city, beginning at 8 a.m. and ending at 5 p.m.

Adrian needs a loan so that he can get a laptop which he will use in his work for better merchandise control, and also for his studies.  This way, he will achieve better development academically and professionally.

Adrian’s dream is to be able to increase his income through making sacrifices, and be able to have a peaceful old age.  He hopes to have a pension that will allow him to live and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that he will use for better merchandise control in his work selling goods to various supermarkets.

loans.name: Arenas De Villa Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5  personas  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos  residen en el distrito de Villa El Salvador. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal. “ARENAS DE VILLA” una de ellas es  Dolly  de 34 Años de edad soltera y con 2  hijos, Dolly  se dedica hace 1 años al servicio de costura remalle Dolly  confecciona prendas de vestir, en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y salir adelante, Dolly  ha sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Dolly solicito el préstamo para comprar (telas) y seguir confeccionando ropa para su posterior venta y seguir saliendo adelante, ah la vez  Dolly   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Dolly está  parada y se le distingue  por su polo de rayas de color negro y plomo, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: This group is made up of five people responsible for different commercial activities. All of them live in the district of Villa El Salvador. They are members of the Arenas De Villa community bank. One of them is Dolly, 34, who is single and has two children. Dolly has been dedicated for one year to being a seamstress. Dolly makes clothing in a small rented shop with the goal of progressing day by day and getting ahead. Dolly knows how to gain customers and so is able to improve her quality of life. Dolly requested the loan to buy fabric and to keep making clothing for resale and to keep moving forward. At this time, Dolly and all of the members are thankful to Kiva for the loan granted and for the trust given to them. Dolly is standing and wearing a striped black and grey polo (in the photo). She says goodbye with the promise that to fulfill all their goals.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 52 años, esta casada con Jorge y tienen 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Zoila se dedica a la venta de comida, vende en la vereda de su casa que está ubicada en un sector muy concurrido por todo tipo de público, aunque solo realiza este trabajo por las noches ha visto que tal actividad le genera buenos ingresos económicos, se inició en este rubro laboral alrededor de 41 años, ya que desde muy niña colaboraba, ayudaba en la cocina y participaba en la preparación de los alimentos al lado de su madre, oficio que también ella realizaba de manera ambulatoria; éste negocio le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijas y pagarles sus estudios, en el futuro desea poner un restaurante en su casa, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos de manera diaria y continua buscando consolidar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.3800, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes y algunos insumos que necesita para continuar con la preparación de sus platos tales como arroz, carnes y verduras, así mismo invertirá en materiales de construcción para acondicionar un pequeño local para la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila, 53, is married to Jorge and they have four children who live with them n their own house. Zoila is dedicated to selling food. She sells from the sidewalk outside her house located in an area that is well-trafficked by all types of people. Even though she has performed this work at night, she has seen that this work generates good income. She began in this role around 41 years ago as since she was young she collaborated and helped in the kitchen and participated in making food at her mother's side. It's a job that she has also performed on foot. This business has given her the money needed to feed her children and pay for their education. In the future, she wishes to start a restaurant in her home where she can sell with more comfort her tasty dishes on a daily basis and continue to consolidate her income. At this time, she is requesting PEN 3800. She is thankful for the opportunity and trust placed in her to receive this loan. At the same time, she promises to make her payments on time.

With the amount requested, she will buy ingredients and some items needed to continue the preparation of her dishes like rice, meat, and vegetables. Also she will invest in construction materials to make a small restaurant where she can attend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, and construction materials to build a restaurant.

loans.name: Rechael

texts.en: Rechael is 27 years old and married with three children, ages 6, 5 and 3, whom she supports. She sells second-hand clothes (mitumba). She has been in this business, which is located in Timboni, for one year. In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 9,350. She is taking a second loan of KES 25,000 which she intends to use for adding stock to her business by buying more second-hand clothes. Rechael will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to open a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en: Azat is 23 years old and he lives with his parents in Stepanavan, in the Lori region. This young man is a very hardworking and active person and his mind is always full of new ideas. He works as a fabric worker and, over several years, he has managed to build some savings. He wants to repair their house and also furnish it nicely and in good taste.  However, his savings are not enough to complete all of these tasks. He asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, in order to have enough money together with his savings to begin repairing their house.

loans.use: to have enough money together with his savings to begin repairing their house.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima, age 57 and widowed, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Maxima lives in Silang, Cavite. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan in order to help her continue operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Maxima dreams of eventually owning a grocery store and a fruit store. Her goal is to offer her family a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 24 years old, a male and married. He has one child, who is 4 months old whom he supports. He is a farmer. He has been in this business for one year. In his business, he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

Solomon was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by a loan officer. He is taking his first loan of KES 20,000 which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. Solomon will use the anticipated profit to improve his farming. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his farming and educate his child.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his farming.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 60 years old and lives in Vanadzor in Lori region. Svetlana has graduated from Yerevan State Medical Institute with studies in Sanitation and Hygiene. Now she works at the Ministry of Health in the department of Sanitation and Hygiene, where she is a doctor/hygienist. 

She lives alone. With money from her savings, she has managed to do some repair work to her house. But more work needs to be done. She asks for a loan of 120,000 AMD to buy materials to finish the repair work needed on her house.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish the repair work needed on her house

loans.name: Sergi

texts.en:
Meet Sergi.  She is a farmer. She lives in Kitale where she has been doing farming for 4 years. She produces and sells milk, eggs, and maize. The part she loves about farming is when she reaps a bountiful harvest which reflects on her hard work.

Sergi chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good training to the farmers and help them to acquire agricultural assets. They also keep track of the growth of farmers with the loans they give them. This loan will help her to grow her agricultral business and farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a farmer living in Nyamira, which is a popular banana producing area. She has 4 children, all of whom are of school-going age. She has done farming for the past 4 years producing and selling tea.

Ruth chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loans have a low interest rate and they are affordable to the small income farmers. This loan will enable Ruth to purchase a water tank which she will use for storing water for her farming activities. There will thus be a continuous supply of water to her farm and her crops will do well and fetch more income. Ruth will provide her children with a better education and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Mary is a widow with five children. She is a farmer, and has been farming for fifteen years now. She is currently growing maize, ground nuts and millet on her farm. She is looking forward to beekeeping because it will be an opportunity for her to earn extra income.

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beekeeping to pay school fees for her children and to cater to their basic needs. Mary’s hope for the future is to have her children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 44 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico de quinto grado, es acompañado, la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos; han procreado seis hijos, de los cuales cinco viven con ellos y uno está fuera del país.  

Pedro, es albañil desde hace 16 años se dedica a este oficio, lo aprendió de un amigo que lo llevaba a trabajar como ayudante; fue así que él le puso mucho entusiasmo y aprendió el oficio ya que en el lugar de donde él vive es de mucha utilidad el oficio. El trabajo no hay distancia definida ya que él va a muchos lugares de donde lo buscan en este trabajo solamente él se dedica y es de 7 a 4 de la tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse más rápido al trabajo, cuando le sale en lugares más lejos. El préstamo le mejorara la rapidez de trasladarse al trabajo, ya que antes se iba a pie y le costaba más en cambio hoy ya es más rápido; la necesidad que será satisfecha es el movilizarme más rápido de un lugar a otro.  

Los sueños que tiene para su oficio, es ser solo contratista y darles más empleo a las personas, así tendrá ingreso para su familia y le ayudara a otras personas también lo tengan.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 44, has a fifth grade education.  He is in a relationship, and his wife devotes herself to the domestic chores.  They have six children, five of whom live with them.  One is outside of the country.

Pedro is a bricklayer, and he has been in this trade for 16 years.  He learned from a friend who took him to work as a helper.  That is how he, with great enthusiasm, learned the trade.  In the place where he lives the trade is very useful.  His work is not within a defined distance because he goes to a lot of places where they seek out this work.  He works alone from seven until four in the afternoon.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy a motorcycle in order to get to work more quickly when he goes to places that are further away.  The loan will improve how rapidly he gets to work.  He previously went by foot, which took him longer.  On the other hand, it is now quicker.  The need that will be satisfied is to get from one place to another more quickly.

The dream that he has for his work is to be solely a contractor and to give more employment to other people.  This way he will have income for his family, and he will help other people to also have income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to get to work more quickly.

loans.name: Musave Group

texts.fr:
J. Bosco  fait partie du groupe Musave  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 35 ans et est marié  à Julienne, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de 2  à 10 ans, dont 2 étudient.  

Il  fait le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis  8  ans. 

Il est à son troisième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  de bidons d’huile de palme à revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle, des terres  cultivables,  cultiver les palmiers à huile  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
J. Bosco is a member of the group called Musave and lives in  Rumonge. He is 35 years old and married to Julienne, who is a businesswoman. Together they have four children aged from two to 10 years old, of whom two are enrolled in school.    

J. Bosco has been selling palm oil for eight years.  He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he is intending to grow his working capital and buy a lot of jerrycans of palm oil to resell so as to earn more money. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of arable land and grow oil-producing palms as well as see his children enrolled in school.

loans.use: to grow his working capital so as to buy a lot of jerrycans of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Joaquín Alejandro

texts.es:
Joaquín de 21 años de edad, tiene noveno grado de educación, está soltero vive en casa de la abuela donde viven 4 personas más,  dos hermanos, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura y una hermana más que se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, las personas que dependen de él son solamente dos la abuela de él y una hermana que es menor de edad.


Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería aprendió el oficio desde hace 15 años,  tiene mucho tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad desde muy pequeño le ha gustado la ganadería y es por eso que aun hoy día se dedica a esta labor. Joaquín tiene otras actividades económicas, como es el trabajo de jornal, la siembra de hortalizas, lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales para apoyar de mejor manera a su familia. El trabajo está cerca de la casa de él, recorrer 15 metros de distancia para llegar,   lo cual le permite trabajar 8 , 9  horas diarias.  


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una pareja de bueyes para trabajar la agricultura. rastrear la tierra, acercar  el producto hasta la casa, ya que actualmente no cuenta con esta herramienta de trabajo, el cliente tiene dos vaquillas las cuales le producen leche y sustento para la comida; pero no cuenta con una yunta de bueyes para mejorar el trabajo agrícola que desempeña.


Sus sueños para su  negocio son producir mejores cosechas cada año, para  apoyar a su abuela y colaborar con sus hermanos y sueña con un día tener su propia familia sus hijos y desea ahora superarse para cuando tenga su familia poder ofrecerle una vida más digna. El préstamo le ayudara a tener una herramienta de trabajo,  para dedicarse mejor al trabajo, pretende ampliar el trabajo sembrando  más producto para obtener más y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Joaquín has a ninth grade education.  He is single and lives in his grandmother's house with four other people; two brothers who work in farming and a sister who works in housekeeping for a living.  There are only two people who are dependent on him, his grandmother and a sister who is a minor.

He works in farming and livestock.  He started learning this profession 15 years ago.  He has been doing this work since he was very small and he liked livestock, which is why he is still doing this work today.  Joaquín does other work, such as day labor and growing vegetables, which provide him with more income to better support his family.  His work is close to his home; he covers 15m to get there, which allows him to work eight or nine hours a day.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a pair of bulls to work his agricultural fields, drag the land, and bring his produce home, as he currently does not have this work tool.  This client has two heifers that produce milk and food, but he does not have a team of bulls to improve the farming work he does. 

His dreams for his business are to produce better harvests each year to support his grandmother and to work together with his brothers, and he dreams of one day having his own family and children.  Currently he wants to better himself so that when he has his family he will be able to offer them a more respectable life.  This loan will help him get a work tool so he can better carry out his work.  He hopes to expand his work by planting more produce so he will have a bigger yield and more earnings.

loans.use: to buy a pair of bulls to work his fields, drag the land, and bring his produce home.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 23 years old, married, with one child, four months old. He has a cafe and has been in this business, that is located in Timboni, for three years. In his business he earns a monthly income of 8,520 KES. He is taking out his first loan of 20,000 KES, which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil, and to buy furniture for his cafe. Michael will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to grow his business and to educate his child.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and furniture for his business.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo is single and has two children. He manages his own corn farm to make a living. He has been doing this for more than a year. He earns enough money to be able to support the needs of his children. Edgardo joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to cover the costs for weeding maintenance in order to improve his farm. He is hopeful to see his family happy and with a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for weeding maintenance

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita runs a general store, selling grocery goods to resell. For many years in doing this, she was able to provide for the needs of the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used in her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to resell in order to boost her store. She plans to used her generated revenue to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Los Solidarios Group

texts.es: La Sra. Clara   de 41  años de edad soltera y madre de  1 hijo, la Sra. Clara  tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de menú (comida) en un pequeño mercado (alquilado) ya hace unos  1  año. La Sra. clara  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus platos típicos y  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos como (arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceites, cubiertos, platos etc.) Para su posterior venta  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. clara  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Clara   se encuentra sentada en el medio se le distingue por su chompa de color OLIVA, adjunto la foto de la Sra. Nery y la Sra. Maximiliana  por el motivo que no pudieron estar en la reunión de desembolso por motivo de trabajo, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Clara, 41, is single and mother to one son. Clara has had a small business selling food in a small rented market for one year. Clara has managed to build a faithful customer base which has generated income to be able to cover her personal expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own restaurant where she can sell typical dishes and obtain greater income. With the loan granted, she will invest in the purchase of more products like rice, sugar, beans, oil, cutlery, plates, etc. for resale and to keep satisfying the needs of her customers and to continue moving forward. Together, Clara and all of the members are thankful to Kiva for the loan granted and for the trust that has been placed in them. Clara can be found seated in the middle wearing an olive sweater. The second photo features Nery and Maximiliana since they could not be at the disbursement meeting due to work. They say goodbye with the promise that they will fulfill all of their goals.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy, de 59 años de edad, esta divorciada y vive en compañía de su hija de 24 años de edad en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Lucy es la confección, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganar  su aceptación y así una regular clientela. Le gusta su negocio ya que le gusta la costura, además de las buenas ganancias que le deja. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 3000, se siente agradecida con la ayuda financiera que viene recibiendo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de  01 maquina de coser y con el saldo tiene planeado comprar materiales de costura como telas, hilos, y otros.
texts.en:
Lucy is 59 years old, divorced, and lives with her 24-year-old daughter in her own home.  Lucy sews for a living, which she learned after studying at an occupational education center.  She then bought a sewing machine with her savings and set it up in her own home.  This is where she attends to her customers, who seek her out because of her good finished products, which have earned her their acceptance and a regular clientele.  She likes her business because she likes sewing, in addition to the good earnings it provides her.  She is currently requesting 3,000 soles.  She is thankful for the financial help she is receiving, which is why she promises to make her payments on time.  

She will invest the requested amount in the purchase of a sewing machine and with the remainder she plans to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and other things.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and other things.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 38, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dioreco. She is a vendor and a mother to their children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Nenita maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought with cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Nenita dreams to have her own stall and hopes to have good health always. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth, 48, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a welder and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ruth operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has a direct selling business and a small food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ruth dreams to expand her business and hopes to have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is a young farmer of 26 years. He lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. He is not married. He thinks of becoming more skilled and having a richer farm with good profit. After that, he will be ready to have a family of his own. Now, Hambardzum is taking care of his farm livestock, which are a lot and various: cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. He is especially interested in swine breeding. He also has a decent income from potato cultivation. All these businesses are thanks to his prior loan from Kiva. 

Hambardzum now asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for his cattle.  He has a lot of cattle and wants to provide for them during the winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and has a son. Mouhammad and his son provide the family income together.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he repairs electrical equipment like air conditioners, washing machines, and refrigerators. He has been in this field since 2011 and has gained much experience. He is well-known in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation. Now, he has hired an employee. 

Mouhammad is applying for a loan of 1,500 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and some new shelves in his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to install a display window and some new shelves in his shop

loans.name: Abdukholiki

texts.ru:
Абдухолики уроженец района Муминобад. Ему 26 лет. Абдухолики семейный человек. Он с женой живет в родительском доме. Абдухолики около 3,5 лет занимается предоставлению услуги такси. Водить машину и правильно предоставить услуги такси его научил его дядя, по сей день дядя Абдухолики помогает ему по работе. В его деятельности Абдухолики нравится, что его работа зависит он него, и сколько он будет работать, и столько будет зарабатывать. Абдухолики хочет много работать. 
  У Абдухолики есть проблемы с машиной, и он решил починить ее. Но достаточной суммы денег у него не оказалось. Он хочет взять кредит и оплатить ремонт машины. Абдухолики нуждается в Вашей поддержке. Он старается не потерять работу.
texts.en:
Abdukholiki is a native of Muminobad. He is 26 years old and a family man. He and his wife live with his parents. Abdukholiki has about three and a half years of experience driving a taxi. His uncle taught him how to drive a car and how to be a good taxi driver. His uncle continues to help him with work to this day. 

Abdukholiki likes that he controls how much he works and how much he earns. He wants to work a lot. He is having car trouble and has decided to fix it, but does not have enough money. He wants to take out a loan to pay for car repairs. He needs your support and is trying not to lose work.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
Juston, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children. One of his children goes to school. The other child is still small. Juston has been a photographer since 2002. He works from 8 am up until midnight in case he gets a tender on big occasions like weddings and baptisms.  

This will be Juston's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a digital camera and photographing equipment. He is a hardworking man. He is so happy with a loan which has permitted him to get married and take care of his family. He managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used his profits to buy a TV set, pay school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy small items for the photography business. He dreams of living a good life with his family.

Juston will share this loan with his loan group "Mawela" which has a total of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy small items for the photography business.

loans.name: Sabo

texts.en:
Sabo is married and has 2 children, who are adults. She also has 2 small grandchildren. Sabo decided to start a new business, growing grapes, in order to generate income which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She has her business with animal husbandry but her income from this business is small. 

Sabo studied at IMON's "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" program to get skills about business.  Her children will help her with the business. 

Sabo is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy grape trees and mineral fertilizers for starting the new business. Her business will be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy grape trees and mineral fertilizers for starting a new business.

loans.name: Ambrocia

texts.es: Ambrocia es la venta de desayunos por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo maca, quinua, azúcar, pan y otras cosas más, ella nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella sigue participando al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Ambrocia sells breakfasts so she is using this opportunity to ask for a loan to buy goods such as maca root, quinoa, sugar, bread, and other items. She was born in the province of  Paucartambo and she lives with her family in this province. She is married and she has five children from this marriage. She is still a member of the communal bank “San Martincito”  of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy maca root, quinoa, sugar, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Juan Cecilio

texts.es:
Juan Celio tiene 54 años de edad es soltero tiene una hija, vive con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Juan Celio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, urea, insecticidas, herbicidas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para trabajar en el campo e invertir en los fertilizantes y poder progresar.
El sueño es comprar terreno para aumentar las utilidades en las cosechas.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Celio is 54 years old, single, and has a daughter.  He lives with his daughter in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the SAN FRANCISCO Communal Bank, which is located in the precinct of Pantano, which is part of Ventanas Canton.  It deals with farming and livestock.  

Juan Celio works in farming, growing corn and rice, and he also raises chickens and pigs.  He is requesting this loan to buy seed, fertilizer, urea, insecticides, and herbicides. 

With the help of this loan he will be able to buy what he needs to work the land and invest in fertilizer and make progress. 

His dream is to buy land to increase his earnings from his harvests.

The challenges he faces are diseases and bad weather. 

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, for his corn crop.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina continua vendiendo comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes y otras cosas más por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz y otras cosas para esta campaña navideña, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Alejandrina continues to sell food products like, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, detergents and other things. For this reason, she needs this loan at present in order to buy merchandise, such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, and other items for the Christmas season. She is thankful to those who make themselves part of her dream in this way. She values this loan and is committed to making her monthly payments in a very responsible way.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Isrrael Cecilio

texts.es:
Israel Cecilio tiene 25 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos vive con ellos en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Israel Cecilio  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, urea, insecticidas, herbicidas. Realiza las compras en ventanas en el comercial Elvi . 

El sueño es  seguir trabajando e invertir para obtener ganancia de los productos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima.En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y el futbol.
texts.en:
Israel Cecilio is 25 years old, single, and has two children whom he lives with in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

He is a member of the SAN FRANCISCO Communal Bank, which is located in the precinct of Pantano, which is part of Ventanas Canton.  It deals with farming and livestock. 

Israel Cecilio works in farming, growing corn, and he also raises chickens and pigs.  He is requesting this loan to buy seed, fertilizer, urea, insecticides, and herbicides.  He does his buying in Ventanas at the store Elvi.

His dream is to keep working and investing to profit from his produce.

The challenges he faces are diseases and bad weather.  In his free time he likes to play indoor and outdoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, Ranger, organic manure and chicks.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 38 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region. Lilit is married and she has two school-aged children. She is educated and is a specialist of Russian language and Literature. For the past 12 years she has been working at the local school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She says that she likes her work very much and does it carefully and with great responsibility. She does her best to make her lessons interesting and interactive, so that the pupils during her lessons are attentive and active. She also gives paid courses of Russian Language and Literature to pupils who are going to take Institute entrance examinations. 

Lilit is requesting a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy a computer and some professional literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature for her work

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother, whose children like her a lot because she is caring.
