texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Dirianis quien con su credikiva pudo comprar materiales e insumos, como carnes frías, harinas, leche, huevos y productos de panadería;  a ella en sus dos negocios, el de confecciones y el de ventas de postresy comidas rápidas, le ha ido muy bien;  así fue que con  su credikiva anterior, pudo atender  oportunamente a su clientela y mantuvo una buena base de clientes. En la actualidad Diranis está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual planea comprar una máquina de confecciones para aumentar su producción de prenda de vestir y materiales e insumos, para invertir en su negocio de comidas rápidas. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “Gracias por la oportunidad que le dan a los empresarios para salir adelante“.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Dirianis with her Kiva loan.  It allowed her to buy materials and supplies  such as cold cuts, flour, milk, eggs, and bakery products.  Things have gone well for her in both of her businesses, making desserts and fast food.  This is how she used her previous Kiva loan.  She was able to serve her customers and keep a good base.

Diranis is asking for a new Kiva loan to buy a machine so she can increase her production of clothing and ingredients for her fast food business.  She sends the following message, “Thank you for the opportunity you give so that entrepreneurs can get ahead.”

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr is from Lernavan village of Lori region; he currently lives with his parents.

A few years ago Hrayr came back from Russia, where he was a migrant worker living with his son and wife. He brought with him a truck and decided to run a farming business. His farm currently includes chickens, pigs and cows and also cultivates wheat, barley and different fruits. Hrayr takes the gathered harvest to the open market and sells it. Agriculture is currently his only source of income so Hrayr works hard to gather enough income for his family.

Now, Hrayr is applying for a USD 2000 loan to purchase forage for feeding his livestock and seeds for cultivation. He will be very thankful to Kiva lenders for the loan. 

As this is Hrayr's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit products due to a lack of credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Soqatra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Soqatra, and is made up of five ladies. They live in Aden, Yemen. 

This group is requesting financial assistance from Kiva partner AMB in order to raise their level of activity.  Fatima is the group's representative. She is a 32-year-old married woman, and has four children. She sells different items such as clothes, incense, etc. She started her business with goods she took on credit from merchants. 

She tries hard to improve her living conditions. To meet her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Fatima is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy additional clothes, incense, etc. for her business. She hopes to expand her business in order to improve it.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes, incense, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Om-Marvt Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Marvt, which consists of three women who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a collective loan of YER 150,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Adila is a 40-year-old, married woman who lives with her family in Aden. She has been in the cloth trade business for many years. She is famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients. She is making enough money to lead a decent life, but she said her income is not sufficient to bear all of the daily expenditures of her family members alone. 

Adila is greatly contributing to the family income to support her family through all of her hard work. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense, and perfumes in larger quantities, to add to her stocks.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense, and perfumes in larger quantities, to add to her stocks.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий 22 года занимается тепличным хозяйством в своей родной Гладковке. Он выращивает в теплицах ранние и поздние помидоры, перец, редис, картофель. У Дмитрия есть свой участок в 33 сотки. 
30 000 гривен понадобились Дмитрию для того, чтобы подготовить теплицы к сезону, закупить полиэтиленовую пленку, удобрения, семена,  а также провести в них отопление и сделать небольшой ремонт там, где это необходимо. Дмитрию нравится вести свое хозяйство, он планирует заниматься им и в будущем, по возможности расширяя его и тем самым обеспечивая нужды своей семьи.
texts.en:
Dmitriy has grown greenhouse vegetables in his hometown of Gladkovka for 22 years. He grows late and early tomatoes, peppers, radishes and potatoes and has his own 3300 square meter plot.  

Dmitriy needs 30,000 hryvnia in order to prepare for the season's planting. He has to buy plastic sheeting, fertilizers, seeds, and also heat the greenhouses and make minor repairs where necessary. Dmitriy likes planting his crops and plans to continue in the future, expanding the business where possible and providing for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy plastic sheeting, fertilizers, and seeds, and to begin heating his greenhouses in order to prepare them for the growing season

loans.name: Norma Evelin

texts.es:
Norma de 44  años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado ya que por su escasos recursos económicos sus padres decidieron no seguir dándole estudio, actualmente esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, de sus hijos, 3 están viviendo con ella.

Norma actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura con su esposo y lo ha hecho desde su niñez, ya que sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar aun siendo mujer; ademas compra pollos pequeños y en un termino de 6 semanas los esta vendiendo y también compran ganado y en unos meses lo esta vendiendo, ella hace de todo un poco y lo que le interesa es ganarse el pan de cada día para ella y su familia. Horario de trabajo no tiene pues se levanta muy temprano a preparar el desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos y luego tiene que dedicarse a sus que aceres diarios.


El préstamo será invertido en la compra de algunos fertilizantes ,para el cultivo que tiene ya que los fondos que tenia no le alcanzaron para terminar de sacar la cosecha, ademas tiene pensado comprar un vaca lechera y así poder ir sacando el dinero de la cuota, la necesidad  es grande pero con el préstamo podrá seguir trabajando.

Sus sueños, son tener un negocio grande del cual ella pueda mantenerse el resto de su vida sin ninguna preocupación, poder darle el estudio a sus hijos ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad. Se siente muy agradecida, con la oportunidad que le han brindado por medio de los créditos y sabe que es un compromiso grande, pero también esta segura que solo así podrá hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Norma is 44 and only studied up to eighth grade as her parents didn't have much money and so they decided they were unable to continue sending her to school. She is now married and her husband works in agriculture. Three of her children are still living with her. Norma now works in agriculture with her husband. This is work she has done since her childhood, as her parents instilled the work into her, even being female. She also buys small chickens and in 6 weeks will sell them and she buys cattle and will sell those in a few months. She does a little bit of everything and what motivates her is to earn a living for herself and her family. She does not have a set work routine as she gets up very early and prepares breakfast for her husband and her children and then she carries out whatever daily chores she has to do.

Norma plans to use the loan to buy some fertiliser for her crops as she didn't have money to cover it. In addition, she is planning to buy a dairy cow and thus be able to meet her loan repayments. She needs a lot, but with the loan she will be able to carry on working. Her dream is to have a bigger business which she can rely on for the rest of her life without worrying. She also dreams of being able to send her children to school, as she herself didn't have that opportunity. She is most grateful for the opportunity the loan provides. She knows that she is taking on a significant commitment, but is also sure that only in this way will she be able to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy crop fertilisers and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 21 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre junto a sus hermanos. El trabajo de Elisa consiste en la venta de comida y refrescos, también se dedica a la venta de joyas en oro, plata y fantasía fina, tiene un circulo de amistades muy amplio y es ahí en donde aprovecha en vender los productos que trae de otra ciudad. Todo el tiempo trabaja sola, pues así se siente mejor y tiene ganancias individuales, además le gusta que puede poner su horario ya que nunca le gusto ser controlada por nadie, espera continuar con su trabajo y seguir creciendo ya que mas adelante tiene pensado poner una joyería en donde el buen trato sea la principal atracción aparte de los modelos exclusivos y buenos precios. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 800, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado  comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas. También adquirirá joyas y productos para continuar con su venta, además de implementarse con algunos probadores de sortijas y franelas para limpieza de plata.
texts.en:
Elisa, 21 years old, is single and lives in her mother's house with her brothers.  Elisa's work involves selling food and soft-drinks; she also sells gold and silver jewelry and fine novelty items.

She has a very large circle of friends where she makes the most of selling her products she brings from another city.

She works alone the whole time; she feels better this way and has individual earnings; additionally she enjoys setting her own schedule since she does not like being controlled by anyone.  She hopes to continue with her work and continue growing since down the road she has considered opening a jewelry shop where good treatment along with select models and good prices shall be the main attraction. 

For this opportunity she is requesting 800 Peruvian soles ($300).  She is very happy to know that she will have a loan so she can fulfill her goals.  For her part she promises to be punctual with her dues and remain in good standing with the group she belongs to since they are all responsible and good.

With the requested amount she will buy ingredients for preparing her foods.  She will also acquire jewelry and products to continue selling as well as getting some test-rings and cloths to clean silver.

loans.use:
to buy ingredients and soft-drinks for her food, as well as jewelry.

Compra de ingredientes y refrescos para sus comidas y joyas.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 40-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from nine years to 15 years. 

He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and fuel. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and fuel

loans.name: Keki Security Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her early 50s, is married with eight children.  Five are still going to school; the other three are grown ups.  She has been running several businesses, selling fruit and vegetables, water, juice, and sodas.  She has been in her business since 2008.  She works from 5 am to 7 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy fast moving items like mangos, bananas, oranges, tomatoes and onions.  

She dreams of building her own house.

Asia will share this loan with her loan group, "Keki Security".

loans.use: to buy fast moving products like mangos, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Vaileth, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children who are in school. For three years now, Vaileth has had a business selling shoes. She  works from 8am to 6pm per working day and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Vaileth will use this loan to buy business shoes to resell to more people. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a grocery business. Vaileth will share this loan with her loan group " MUUNGANO", which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business shoes to resell to more people.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia continua con la compra y venta de frutas por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo manzanas, duraznos, membrillos, plátanos y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.  Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Eulalia continues buying and selling fruit and she is seeking another loan so that she can buy more merchandise such as apples, peaches, quinces, bananas, and others.  She sends her thanks to the people that have contributed to her dream by helping her with a loan and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

She belongs to the community bank "San Martincito" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy oranges, peaches, quinces, bananas, and other fruits.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 50 years old, a male and married. He has four children aged 18,16,14 and 10 years, all of whom he supports. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and he has a bodaboda (bicycle) business. He has been in this business, based in Malindi, for eleven years.  In his business he earns a monthly income of 6000 KES and is now requesting this, his forth loan.  He intends to use the 20,000 KES to purchase another bicycle. His previous loan of 10,000 KES was paid back successfully.

Benard will use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to open another business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle to use it as a bodaboda.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30-year-old father of one from Embu, who practices mixed crop farming. He is married to Grace who is a housewife. He also offers motorcycle transportation, a business which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings.  The additional income that this will create will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Charles would like to take care of his family with ease and boost his farm production. 

He hopes to save money to educate his child to university level.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Jonatham's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 8 group leader farmers in Matete District with Jonatham selected as the Kiva representative.  Jonatham has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 93 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Jonatham is married and has 4 children.  He is 51 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, and trustworthy.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Jonatham has been a farmer for 17 years.  Jonatham described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  
							
Jonatham first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Jonatham joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  Jonatham plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Jonatham’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and feed his family.  							

Jonatham and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

Please note that there is 1 additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.						

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a single, 43-year-old mother of five children in Mwingi. Salima has been running a grocery store for the past 17 years with a monthly income of KES 14,000, which she uses to support her family. She also sells charcoal to supplement her income.

Salima is applying for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, after she was introduced by an existing client. 

She will use the loan to purchase 2 bags of potatoes costing KES 6,000, 2 bags of onions costing KES 10,000, 1 bag of avocados at KES 1,000, and 1 crate of tomatoes at KES 3,000. 

She will use the additional income to repay her loan and open other branches of her business. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of potatoes, 2 bags of onions, 1 bag of avocados, and 1 crate of tomatoes.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is 31 years old. He is a male, married, and has three children he supports, ages 14,10, and 6 years old. Kyalo has had a clothes shop for the last four years, and earns a monthly income of ksh.14,675.

He was introduced to Kadet Ltd by a Kadet staff member, and he is a taking his third loan from Kadet of ksh.50, 000.  He will use his loan to buy more clothes. 

Kyalo will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business are to open a wholesale shop, and to make sure his children get a better education.

His previous loan of ksh.30,000 paid back successfully.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to his buyers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a man of forty-seven years, married to Monica, and a father of three children.  He runs a transport business and also sells charcoal in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years now.  He gets a monthly income of twenty-three thousand, five hundred shillings. 

This will be David’s first loan with VisionFund Kenya.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal for his business. In future, he wants to raise his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is from Iraq. He is a hard-working client who is 38 years old. He is married and has no children. Adel is the only provider for his family. Adel is a motorcycle mechanic who also sells engines and other spare parts for motorcycles. He established his business in 2000 and has two employees. He has good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.  Adel is requesting a sum of $2,400 to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his work

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en: Anzhela lives in Gavar city in the Gegharkunik region. She has a large family.  She has five children. Anzhela got married very early and since then she has been engaged in farming activities. Her husband is a builder and he does not manage to help his wife very much.  Anzhela does everything around her farm alone.  She breeds two cows and three calves, twenty chickens. She also manages to work as a milkmaid in nearby villages. For this winter, Anzhela and her husband have gathered a lot of hay for her farm cattle, but she wants to have some of it reserved.  So she asks a for loan of 200,000 Armenian drams in order to buy more fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy more fodder for her farm cattle for winter period

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 32 years old, is a single mother of one child.  She is from Mwingi and owns a business selling cereals and other grains. She currently lacks the capital needed to purchase cereals in bulk to restock her store. This marks her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With a loan through VisionFund Kenya, Jane will be able to purchase cereals in bulk for sale. 

She will then be able to have a fully stocked store which will attract more customers, generate sales, and create more profit due to a lower cost of cereals sold. Additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business, meet the needs of her family, and educate her child. 

In the future, Jane would like to eradicate poverty and uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married, a 50-year-old mother of two in Thika. Her children are ages 18 and 16 years. 

Lydia has been running a grocery store for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 13,200 which she uses to support her family.  She also practices small scale farming to supplement her income.

Lydia is applying for her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya, after repaying all her previous loans successfully. 

She will use the loan to purchase oranges, bananas, watermelons, onions, and cabbages in bulk to sell in her grocery store. She will plough the proceeds back into the business. 

She hopes to start selling her groceries in wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, watermelons, onions, and cabbages in bulk

loans.name: Thelma Rosa

texts.es:
Thelma de 35 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de su hijo, y pasar tiempo de calidad.  En la actualidad lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo.
Gracias a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de material de construcción de forma ambulante, y se moviliza en una camioneta por diferentes puntos de la ciudad, vende productos de construcción como zin, clavos, pernos, cemente, palas, perlines, mangueras. Tornillos, serruchos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de ferretería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Thelma agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como  es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Thelma is 35 years old, married, and has one minor child. She's a native of the central region of the country, and is known for being hard-working, responsible, and having ambitions of self-improvement. In her free time she likes to enjoy her son's company and spend quality time. Currently she works hard to give her young son a better future. Thanks to her efforts and desire to persevere, she works as a traveling vendor of construction materials and moves about in a pickup truck through different parts of the city. She sells construction products like zinc, nails, bolts, cement, shovels, purlins, hoses, screws, and shovels. She devotes 10 hours a day to selling products for her business. 

The purpose of Thelma's loan is to invest in work equipment and stock her hardware purchase and sale business, so that she can improve her income in the not-too-distant future. Thelma is grateful for the assistance Kiva lenders provide to low-income people from poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a respectable line of work.

loans.use: To invest in work equipment and purchase construction materials like zinc, nails, bolts, cement, shovels, purlins, hoses, screws, and saws.

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.ru:
Анжелика – из Хуста. Она работает на щвейной фабрике швеей. У нее есть муж и двое взрослых детей. Анжелика с семьей живет в своем доме. Так как обоих детей надо было учить, все деньги в семье шли в основном на это. А дом давно нуждался в хорошем ремонте. 
Сумма в 11 000 гривен необходима этой семье для того, чтобы заменить крышу дома. Сейчас у семьи уже нет таких затрат на детей, которые вдвоем выросли и образовали свои семьи, но собственных средств на ремонт дома все равно не хватает. Муж Анжелики много ездил на заработки одно время, но потом заболел и сейчас получает только пенсию. Поэтому эта семья очень надеется на дополнительную финансовую помощь от КИВА, которая для них так критически важна.
texts.en: Anjelika is from Khoost. She works as a seamstress in a textile factory. She is married and has two adult children. Since both children had to go to school, all of the family's money was used to pay those expenses. Their house has needed repairs for a long time. The family needs 11,000 hryvnia to replace the roof of the house. Now the family doesn't have to pay for the children's education because they are grown up and have their own families, but they still do not have enough money to repair the house. Anjelika's husband used to work a lot, but then he got sick and only receives a pension now. Therefore, the family really hopes for additional financial assistance through Kiva, because it is critical for them.

loans.use: to fix the roof of her house

loans.name: Muazamakhon

texts.ru: Муазамахон жительница района Дж.Руми. Она замужем. Ей 26 лет.  Муазамахон начинает швейное дело. Она умеет шить женские платья и теперь решила открыть свой швейный бизнес. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Муазамахон будет заниматься этим делом у себя дома и уже отвела специальную комнату для этого. Она планирует в день вышивать по одному платью. Муазамахон считает, это прибыльным бизнесом, благодаря которому финансовое положение ее семьи улучшится.
texts.en: Muazamakhon lives in J. Rumy.  She is married. She is 26 years old. Muazamakhon is starting a sewing business. She knows how to sew dresses and has now decided to open her own sewing business. She has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine. Muazamakhon will do her work from home and has already designated a special room for this. She plans to complete a dress every day. Muazamakhon thinks her family's financial situation will improve through this profitable business.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chahideh

texts.en:
Chahideh is a 62-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her only child. After her husband’s death, she became responsible for raising her child on her own. 

Facing life's tragedies alone is not what she aimed for, but life imposed her to facts and she was obliged to work really hard to carry on and support her child. 

She raises cattle, specifically cows, and she produces daily fresh milk which she sells to multiple customers and traders. 

Chahideh seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase fodder to feed the cows and to be able to increase the quantity of milk that she produces. 

She really needs help, as her age doesn’t allow her to get involved in a new business.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her cows

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
Khouloud is a 27-year-old, married woman, living with her husband and only child. Her husband works in the construction field, while she works as a tailor, producing women's items and repairing them, whenever necessary. 

Today, with her youth loan, requested from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., Khouloud will be able to possess new tailoring machinery and, therefore, she will more quickly respond to customers' demands. 

Khouloud’s only wish is to develop her work and make a good income, to live contentedly and satisfyingly.

loans.use: to buy new tailoring machinery.

loans.name: Sri Purusottam Group

texts.en:
Tukla, located in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India is a rural village. In the year 2009, five women from the weaving and cloth business community stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named Sri Purusottam to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses. Since then, the group has already taken four loans from  Mahashakti Foundation and has successfully repaid the loans. 

Damayanti is the one standing in front with her hand raised in the photo. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two sons of 12 and 9 years old. Damayanti hails from a traditional cloth weaving community. She has been running a cloth weaving & selling business with her husband. Presently, she has two hand looms for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader 20 km away from her village. They knit 80 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees. She only produces saris because of the demand in the market. Damayanti makes two pieces of sari per day. Apart from this, she also purchases ready made garments from the local market. Her husband goes to weekly markets to sell the clothes. From this business, she earns a monthly income of Rs 7,000, which is not sufficient to make her future dream materialize. With the present loan of 48,000 INR, she wants to buy bulk quantities of thread/yarn and ready-made garments to increase her income. Purchasing in bulk will help her to reduce the purchasing & transportation costs of the raw materials. Damayanti wishes to grow her business and save enough to construct a good house.

The other four members of the group are Pramila, Basanti, and Hema who are doing a cloth business  and Padmabati, who is running a general store.

loans.use: To purchase thread/yarn and ready made garments.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 34 years old and lives in the village Getahovit in Tavush region. Karen has a large family and lives with his retired parents, his wife and his four children (3 daughters and a son). Karen’s wife is a physics teacher at the local school. 

Karen has had several occupations.  He worked at the college as a computer skills teacher  and then as a lecturer of computer skills and communications. For several years, he worked at the Ijevan State University as a department head of Information Systems Services. 

He has had his own computer repair business for a year. Karen considers his business to be profitable because his customers have computers and often need Karen’s assistance to solve technical problems. 

Karen asks for a loan of 500.000 AMD to buy equipment needed to repair computers.

loans.use: to buy equipment needed to repair computers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married, 34-year-old female. She supports her four children (ages 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old). 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer.  She has been in the Beauty Salon business for two years.  She earns a monthly income of 9,550 KES.  She requests this first loan of 20,000 KES to buy to buy hair chemicals, hair products, nail care products, and towels to use in her saloon.

Rose will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, hair products, nail care products, and towels to use in her saloon.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 32-year-old single mother of a seven year old child.  She earns a living for her family by selling gas cylinders. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Lilian is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya in order to stock her shop with more gas cylinders. With the additional income earned from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business and use the remaining amount to repay her loan. 

In the future, Lilian plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger cylinder store.  She plans to give her child a quality education.

loans.use: to stock her shop with more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Vardiko

texts.en:
Vardiko is a 65-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a small village in the Zestafoni district. Vardiko and her husband are provided with a retirement pension of 150 Gel monthly per person. 

The family is actively involved in an agricultural business. They have a pig, hens, a vineyard, and a plot of agricultural land. Vardiko wants to start dairy farming, and sought credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

Vardiko's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to purchase a milk cow. After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products (cheese and yogurt) to sell. They will also use the milk products for family feeding. 

The new business initiative will give her chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married, a 44-year-old mother of two in Thika. Her children are ages 21 and 18. Mary has been running a grocery store for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 14,200, which she uses to support her family. 

Mary is applying for her fifth loan from Vision Kenya, after repaying her all her previous loans successfully. 

She will use the loan to purchase oranges, bananas, watermelons, onions, and cabbages in bulk to sell in her grocery store. 

She will plough the proceeds back into the business. 

She hopes to start selling her groceries in wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, watermelons, onions, and cabbages in bulk

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is 26 years old, a male, and married. He has two children, four and two years respectively, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer, and he sells CDs, DVDs and videos. He has been in this business for four years.  It is located at Timboni.  In his business he earns a monthly income of Ksh.11,800.  He is taking his third loan of Ksh.25,000, which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying  more CD's and DVD's.  Suleiman will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to open another business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy CD's, DVD's and videos to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Isuf

texts.en:
Isuf’s wife had head surgery sometime back and the aftermath was that she suffered paralysis on one side of her body. This made it worse since she has to be on medical devices and medications forever. “This was something that came out of nowhere. I took my wife to the doctor to make her better and she came out paralyzed. Now I have to look after her and do everything around home by myself including the agricultural activity that is primarily my domain now.  I plant beans and sell the dried ones in a local farmers market in a nearby city. During summers, I go to Greece to do seasonal work,” said Isuf.

Kindly note that Isuf needs a loan to cover her medical expenses and this will be his first time requesting a loan. Isuf’s wife is not in the picture, since she did not want to be photographed.  

Isuf is 57 and has five children.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical expenses

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 44 years old, is a married businessman in Mwingi. He runs a business selling cereals and other grains. He is married to Teresia and together they are blessed with six children who are 25, 23, 19, 18, 15 and 12 years old, respectively.

With a loan from VisionFund Kenya, John will be able to purchase cereals in bulk such as beans, maize, sorghum, green grams, cowpeas, millet etc. John is requesting his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, having been introduced recently by one of VisionFund Kenya's staff members. The additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business and repay his loan. In the future, John would like to give his children a quality education. 

His hopes and dreams are to become an established cereals distributor in Mwingi region.

loans.use: to purchase cereals in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en: Anzor is a 29-year-old young man, from Ubisa, Kharagauli district. He lives with his large family consisting of his mother, wife and four children. His mother is a baker and Anzor works as a barman. The family's additional income is from their agricultural business. They have a cow, a calf, a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land. Anzor wants to start his own activity and buy a mini-bus. He will serve the clients on the mini bus line from Tbilisi to Zestaponi. He couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirement to have business experience or stable revenue. The Start Up program, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo, gives poor people like Anzor a chance to start or re-start a business.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus

loans.name: Estrellas De Cristo Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE CRISTO II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de estuco, venta de bebe, taller de costura, venta de tenis, venta de ropa, servicio de transportista.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material de construcción; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo, ya que él conocía esta área de trabajo y deciden invertir capital en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de estuco) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente  lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud por los consultorios.
texts.en:
The "Stars of Christ II" communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Alto Lima regional office. It has eight members and is managed by an executive board, of which Antonia is president. The members of the association have various businesses, including: plaster sales, drink sales, a tailor workshop, sports footwear sales, clothing sales, and transportation services.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners, including Antonia. She says that this is the fifth year that she is a member of Pro Mujer, having been invited to join by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, Antonia has a store that sells construction materials. She launched this business alongside her husband, as he was familiar with this type of work and decided to invest capital in this account.  

Antonia is taking out this loan to raise capital to buy plaster from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. Subsequently, it will be sold in her retail space. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to take care of her family, as she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Antonia responds that she likes the local health clinics.

loans.use: to buy plaster

loans.name: One Word Sweet Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of the “One Word Sweet” group. They are a small-scale businesswomen group based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they request a loan of 4,000,000.00 SLL to increase the inventory of their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is 35 years old and was born in Tankoro Chiefdown, in eastern Sierra Leone. Fatmata is married to a businessman and the couple has 5 children, 4 attend school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for 8 years and sells dried fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 33 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 15 años y 3 años de edad. Es una mujer admirable ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como papas fritas y enchiladas. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este negocio  por lo que tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Su vivienda es muy humilde y sencilla la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Actualmente el techo de la vivienda se encuentra en mal estado y desea repararlo, por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para dar inicio a la reparación del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María, 33, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two children, ages 15 and 3. She is to be admired because she has managed to provide for her children through hard work. She sells traditional snacks like fried potatoes and enchiladas. She has run this business for a long time, so she has many customers, who prefer her more each day.

She worked very hard to build her modest, simple house. Now the roof is in bad shape, and she wants to fix it. She has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheets, nails, and wood to repair the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, nails, and wood to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Patron San Jeronimo Acopia Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN JERONIMO ACOPIA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Acopia, perteneciente a la provincia de Acomayo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria ella es casada y tiene 34 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende la comida, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ganados.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Patrón San Jeronimo Acopia” communal bank which is located in the district of Acopia which belongs to the province of Acomayo and the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Gregoria.  She is married and she is 34 years old.  She works in her business selling food.  She prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups and ‘saltado de carne’ [a stir-fried Peruvian dish of meats and vegetables].  She works from 10:00pm until 5:00pm.  She already has 7 years in this business and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is requesting the loan to purchase products like chicken, meat and vegetables for cooking.

The other members work in the businesses of selling vegetables, raising animals to sell them, a grocery store and selling livestock.

Gregoria is grateful to those who are a part of this dream by means of this method and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the established period of time.

loans.use: to purchase products like chicken, meat and vegetables for cooking.

loans.name: Simón Antonio

texts.es:
Simón, a sus 47 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esmero, trabajando arduas jornadas para genrar ingresos y lograr llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como reciclador, sui negocio consiste en comprar cobre, hierro y aluminio, entre otros, artículos que luego vende a un mejor precio, logrando generar utilidades para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de chatarra (hierro, cobre, aluminio, cartón, entre otros), esto le permitirá generar mejores ingresos al momento de revender lo recolectado, además tendrá la capacidad económica para trasladarse a algunos pueblos a realizar su labor por unos días.
Simón manifiesta que su único propósito es continuar con su oficio y seguir generando los recursos suficientes para dar a su familia una vida digna y brindar educación a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Simón, at his 47 years of age, is married and is the father of two children who he has been providing for with great care, working arduous days to generate income and to manage to bring home the daily bread to his family. 

During his productive life he has made a living working as a recycler.  His business consists of buying copper, iron and aluminum, among other things, articles that he then sells at a better price, managing to generate profits to pay the household expenses.

He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of scrap metal (iron, copper, aluminum) and cardboard, among other things.  This will allow him to generate better income at the time of reselling what he has collected.  He will also have the financial capability to go to some other towns to carry out his work for a few days.

Simón says that his sole purpose is to continue with his work and continue generating the sufficient resources to give his family a good life and provide an education for his two children.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal (iron, copper, aluminum) and cardboard, among other things.

loans.name: Sicenio Pascual

texts.es:
Sicenio tiene 38 años de edad estado civil unió libre vive con sus esposa y sus hijos de 17, 15 y 3 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Sicenio se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas, urea, herbicidas, mata plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. El sueño es reunir un dinero para comprarse una bomba de agua. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y andar en moto.
texts.en:
Sicenio is 38 years old and in a common-law relationship.  He lives with his wife and their children (ages 17, 15, and 13) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Provicne.  

Sicenio is a member of the Communal Bank "San Francisco", which is located in the neighborhood of Pantano in the canton of Ventanas.  The members are farm workers and livestock breeders.  

Sicenio is a farmer who grows corn.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, seeds, urea, herbicides, and weed killer.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for farming.  His dream is to have enough money to buy a water pump.  

In his free time, Sicenio enjoys playing sports and riding motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, urea, herbicides, and weed killer.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира порядочная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж плотник и всегда старается помочь своей жене. Замира имеет педагогическое образование. Она более 15 лет преподает в средней школе. Замира знает все тонкости своего дела. Она в течение 15 лет преподала многим ученикам и воспитала их в духе патриотизма. Замира имеет маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Поэтому она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Замира имеет дома большой коровник. Она продает молоко своим соседям. Этим она получает доход. Замира хочет увеличить свой оборотный и капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zamira is a respectable, sincere woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter and always tries to help his wife. Zamira studied teaching and has been a high school teacher for more than 15 years. She knows all the tricks of the trade. She has taught her many students with a patriotic spirit. Zamira has a small salary that isn't enough to support her family, so she earns additional income raising cattle. She has a big barn and earns money selling milk to the neighbors. Zamira wants to increase her working capital and is requesting a loan of 3500 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase her working capital

loans.name: Zohrak

texts.en:
Zorhak lives in Zovaber Village in Gegharkunik region. Now, he lives with his wife, who works as a teacher at the local school. They have two sons who are married, and they live with their families. 

Zorhak graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute Geography Department. For many years after graduation, he worked at the school as a teacher of geography. Now, he is a deputy director at the same school. 

During this year, Zorhak did some repairs on his house, but furnishing it is not completed yet.  He asks for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy furniture for his kitchen and living room.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his kitchen and living room in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Uhai Group

texts.en:
Suzana, who is in her early 40s, is single and has two boys and a girl.  Two of the children are in school, while one is a baby.  Suzana is currently running a fresh water fish business, and has done for three years now. She runs her business from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is Suzana's first loan request.  She will use it to buy fishes for her business. She is really working hard to meet her dreams of being able to expand her business, together with buying a plot of land for house building. 

Suzana will share this loan with her loan group" UHAI", which consists of 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old, and together with her spouse has been blessed with three children. She does poultry farming in Kangundo town and has been in this business for three years now.  She will use this loan to buy more chicks for rearing, poultry feeds and vaccines. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term and in the future she hopes to become a supplier of poultry and poultry products.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feeds and poultry vaccines.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 35 years old. He is a male, married, and has two children, seven and two years old, respectively. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet staff member, and he is taking his third loan of Ksh25,000 from KADET.  Stephen has a shoe shop which has lasted for one-and-a half years now. He earns a monthly income of Ksh.15,000.  His previous loan of Ksh.25,000 was paid back successfully.  He will use his loan to buy more shoes. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business are to open a wholesale shop and make sure his children get better education.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell to his buyers.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a mother and grandmother, Linda is no stranger to cooking. She’s not just good at it; it’s also a passion of hers. Over the years, her friends began asking her to cater for them. After a few years, she decided it was time to go into business for herself. 

Linda’s business, Affairs Catering, is based out of her home and caters to all walks of life. “I love when people enjoy my food. Knowing that the people I’m serving are enjoying my food is extremely rewarding to me.”
 
However, things have not always been easy for Linda. Her husband lost his job in 2009 and then they lost their car last year during Hurricane Sandy. They were forced to purchase another vehicle in order to continue with the business. Now, Linda needs capital in order to purchase additional equipment to continue to build her business.

Help this passionate chef rebuild her business and livelihood!

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her catering business.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group

texts.en:
Maa Gayatri is a Joint Liability Group formed by four active women from Junani village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India.  The purpose was to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Gouri is one of the active members of the group standing on the extreme right in the photo, raising her hand. She is 42 years of age and hails from a Below Poverty Line family. Her family comprises her husband and one son of 28 years. She resides in a small house.
 
Gouri has been running a general store in her house for the last 10 years. Her husband helps in her business. She sells general grocery items like sugar, lentils, biscuits, soap, shampoo, potatoes, onions, etc. Gouri was able to increase the variety of items at her general store with her scanty savings and increase her cash flow. Her monthly income from the existing business is Rs 3000/-. Out of this income, she hardly manages her household expenses. Due to this limited income, she is not able to construct a house for her family. So, she wants to increase the stock in her business to earn some more income. Gouri's present loan will be used to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she will replenish her stock frequently. Gouri hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested. 

The other three members of the group are Ranjulata, Geetanjali and Sunita who are running a Tiffin stall, a footwear shop and a cycle repair mart, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, shampoo, potatoes, onions etc.

loans.name: Baibha Laxmi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, five active women from Lachhipur village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India formed a group named Baibha Laxmi to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Saudamini is one of them. The 29-year-old lady standing on the extreme right in the photo is Saudamini. She lives with her husband and three daughters who are 16, 13 and 8 years old. All her three daughters are studying in school and college. 

Saudamini has been running a general grocery shop in her village for the last 15 years with the help of her husband. She started the business in a very low profile manner with a small investment of her own. At that time, her monthly net income was around 2,000 INR. It was very difficult on her part to maintain the family. Since the formation of the group, Saudamini has already availed three loans from Mahashakti Foundation and has been able to expand her business. Presently, she is earning a monthly income of 8,000 INR, but according to her, this is not sufficient to make her dream materialize. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. So the present loan of 14,000 INR will be used to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she will replenish her stock frequently. Saudamini hopes to save enough to give a better education to her daughters. She also hopes for decent marriages for her daughters. She expresses her satisfaction that she has achieved total success due to the timely support of Mahashakti Foundation.

The other four members of the group are Sasamita, Sabetri, Lata and Jambubati who are running a general grocery shop, a seasonal products procurement business, a puffed rice business and a milk-selling business, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria (39) and her husband Alonzo (40) care for the living space they can offer their seven children. Pedro is 17 years old, María has 16, Alonso has 12, Manuel has 10, Antonio has 9, Diego has 6 and the youngest is 2 years old.  It´s a big family and even though the oldest children helping out by working, it´s difficult to find the income to cover their needs, including school fees for the little ones.

They live in the a community in the San Juan Cancun municipality of the state of Chiapas in southern Mexico. Their current home is a one room wood house, with tin roof without bathroom or any services, they use wood to cook. Their community is a small indigenous one with 282 inhabitants, the majority speak an indigenous language and just 58 of them speak good Spanish. 

Alonzo goes out to other places searching for a job; sometimes as  a peasant in the fields, sowing maize and coffee fields and merchandising them; even he had worked out of México for some time to get more money. At one point he even worked out of México City for some time. María, she likes to take care of their children and 10-15 chickens they usually have, she cooks and gives the family food. They sow maize in the maize season and they collect coffee as well.

Maria and Alonzo would love to leave the land for their children in the future but they know it´s difficult nowadays because there´s not much land to split among all of them. That´s why they want to at least leave them with a better and safe house where they can help each other to live happy and healthy. 

They would like to have a kitchen and bathroom inside the house, they would keep it clean and without smoke. There´s a governmental organization that helps with money sometimes in exchange of going to reunions and workshops, the difficulty for them is that they don´t have where to leave their kids and they are not allowed to take them with them.They think Habitat can support them and they really wish to be beneficiaries.

Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe and affordable place to live. Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system where the families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing and financial education, this aiming to develop and strength their capacities. In México, works since 1989 and today more than 7,000 families have been served just on the last 3 years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia and her husband Antonio (32 years old) are hoping to build their house. They have 5 children: Juan is 13 years old, Mario has 10, Lucía has 9, Juana has 6 and Catalina has 4 years old. 

The family has a house made of wood where the 7 family members live. Their house is small and the space is not enough for all of them. They wish to get the loan to build a home and give their children a better, safer and healthier place as the little kids play a lot on the floor and this make them get sick very often.

Their main income is from growing coffee, but coffee prices have been dropping and currently they sell a kilo of coffee for less than USD2, so they do not have much money. Antonio loves to work as mason but its not a well paid profession, so he has to go out from the community all week to find alternative work. He only comes back on Sundays to be with his family. He often goes cut firewood with his children.

Lucia and Antonio have seen how other members of their community have benefited from working with Habitat. They want to trust Habitat and get a loan for their house so their children can live in better conditions.

Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe and affordable place to live. Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system where the families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing and financial education, this aiming to develop and strength their capacities. In México, works since 1989 and today more than 7,000 families have been served just on the last 3 years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build their home

loans.name: Arsena

texts.en: Arsena is 54 years old.  He is from the small village in the Zestaponi district. He has a 21 year-old son who works as a waiter at a local restaurant. Arsena owns a hectare of agricultural land and walnut trees. He sells the harvested walnuts locally. The family gets social assistance from  the government, as they live in poverty.  Arsena wants to start his own business. After several unsuccessful attempts, Arsena applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. He needs 1000 Gel to buy pigs to raise and to sell piglets. After purchasing pigs, he will be involved in the husbandry business and will expand in future. The Start Up loan will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and sell piglets

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Henry is married and has eight children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years now. They are currently growing beans, millet, and maize and raising livestock on their farm. Henry is excited about beekeeping as the honey produced will be a source of food and medicine for his family and it will also earn him extra income.

This is Henry’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because they are keen in keeping their promises. He intends to use the income generated from his beekeeping to pay school fees for some orphans he is taking care of and to provide for their basic needs. Henry’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and to teach others about beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Myzejen

texts.en:
Myzejen requests a first time loan to increase her stock of second-hand clothing to resell. For the past ten years, she has been buying and reselling such items in the market of a city in southern Albania.

Myzejen, a 53-year-old mother of a 14-year-old son with disabilities, is an Egyptian from the most vulnerable ethnic minority of Albania. This photograph is taken in front of her own so called “home”.  Some members of this community live under difficult circumstances with no water and sanitation. Poor nutrition is also a problem. Those members who haven’t excelled even under the new regime, still live in suburbia and under similar conditions to Myzejen. Other members who have done well have moved out of their community to avoid the stigma.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and other items to resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is the sole owner of Best Shears Inc., a barber shop and beauty salon supplier of shears, scissors, dryers and other small appliances for the hair salon industry. Mohammad is originally from Pakistan where he and his son-in-law have a small factory that produces shears and scissors. In 2005, he incorporated Best Shears Inc. and started distributing shears and scissors to barber shops. Originally the business intended to exclusively distribute shears and scissors made in their Pakistani factory. However, the company has expanded beyond their own factory to include products made in other factories. In 2010, the business generated $100,000 in sales. This year, Mohammad opened a store front. Having a store front has allowed Mohammad to offer a greater selection to his clients as well as be able to sharpen blades on-site, which is a service he would like to provide in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to sharpen scissors and blades

loans.name: Friend Sisters Group

texts.en:
Fanta is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Gbense Chiefdon, in eastern Sierra Leone, 49 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 2 children who attend school.
 
Fanta has been selling used clothing and cloth for 4 years. This is not the first loan that Fanta and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Previous SMT/Kiva lender loans were a huge success in the businesses and personal lives of these borrowers. 

Having successfully repaid their last loan, they are  requesting a new loan to further expand their respective businesses, increase sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fanta will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to buy a large quantity of used clothing and cloth.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of used clothing and cloth to add to her business.

loans.name: Be Honest Group

texts.en:
Ramatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ramatu was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Ramatu is married to a businessman and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary school.  Ramatu sells plates, chains, earrings, mirrors, plastic bowls, etc. and has been a businesswoman for eight years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Ramatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Ramatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry and other items in bulk

loans.name: Quiedondoya Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the Quiedondoya Group, from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, each applying for a loan of SLL 1,000,000  (Sierra Leonean Leones). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and, consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Hawa is the featured leader of this group. The 46-year-old woman is married and has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Hawa has been a businesswoman for 11 years now. She sells market food – palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, rice, flour, beans, etc. 

With her share of this loan, Hawa going to buy the above-mentioned items wholesale, to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, rice, flour, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES PROGRESANDO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, taller de metalmecánica, costura de mochila, tejido de chompas, tejido de chompas, venta de salchipapas, venta de papa y chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en una institución técnica,  posteriormente compro una máquina de costura donde en la actualidad realiza su trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de bolsas de plástico y tela.) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Progresando" communal bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Ana is the secretary. The members of the association have many different businesses between them: food sales, metalworking shop, sewing backpacks, knitting sweaters, selling hot dogs and french fries, and selling potatoes and chuño (freeze-dried potato).

The loan that they will receive will benefit microentrepreneurs including Ana. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, and joined following an invitation from a friend who is also a member. She has a sewing workshop. She says she learned the trade at a technical school, and afterwards, she bought a sewing machine which she uses to do her work. 

The loan that she will receive is to increase capital , and she will buy plastic bags and fabric from wholesale distributors in El Alto. Afterwards she will sell them in her stall. This way of working allows her to generate resources to take care of her family. She is married with four kids. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the attention to health.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags and fabric.

loans.name: Kory Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY CHUYMA” iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de abrigos, tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de fruta, tienda de abarrotes, costura de deportivo, venta de chicharrones (comida tradicional de Bolivia).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su comadre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos de contar con un espacio de comercio que sea cercano a sus domicilios.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Kory Chuyma" communal bank will begin its 26th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. It has eight members and is directed by an executive board, of which Eugenia is Treasurer. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses including: coat making, a general store, a potato stand, a fruit stand, a grocery store, sportswear making, and a stand selling chicharrones [fried pork rinds which are a typical Bolivia food].

This loan will benefit small business owners, including Eugenia. She mentions that it has been five years since she joined Pro Mujer, following the invitation of her godmother who is also a member of the institution. She currently has a business running a neighborhood general store, which she started after observing her neighbors' need for a retail space close to their homes. 

The loan that she will take out is to increase funds to purchase pasta, rice and sugar from the best distributors in the city of El Alto, which she will then sell in her store. This type of work affords her the resources to support her family. She is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings on health and loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, and sugar

loans.name: Namozali

texts.ru:
Намозали 44 года. Он из района Гиссар. Намозали семейный человек. У него есть жена и пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка она занимается воспитанием детей. 
   Намозали работаем пекарем. Более 17 лет он печет национальные таджикские лепешки. В Таджикистане лепешки являются самой главной пищей в любом накрытом столе. Намозали мастер своего дела и вам повезет, если вы когда-нибудь попробуете лепешки сделанными его руками. 
  Намозали активный мужчина и параллельно с работой в пекарне он занимается растениеводством. В этом году он решил посадить зимний урожай. Чтобы реализовать посев ему необходимо купить минеральные удобрения. Для покупки удобрений Намозали просит кредит.
texts.en:
Namozali is 44. He is from Gissar. Namozali is a family man. He has a wife and five children. His wife is a housewife. She works bringing up the children. 

Namozali works as a baker. He has been baking Tajik flat bread for more than seventeen years now. In Tajikistan, flat bread is the most important food on any table. Namozali is a master of his craft, and you are lucky if you ever get to try his flat bread. 

Namozali is an active man who, while working at his bakery, also farms. This year, he decided to plant winter crops. To reap a harvest, he needs to buy fertilizer. Namozali is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tamarneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamarneh Ii” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aminata is the featured leader of this group. Aminata is 42-years-old.  She is married with four children, three of whom are attending primary schools and one is in secondary school.  Aminata sells groundnuts, rice, etc. and has been doing this business for eight years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of groundnuts, rice, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of groundnuts, rice, etc. to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ermitanio

texts.es: Hermitanio continua la construcción de casas, pistas, obras y otras cosas más por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar utiles de escritorio como papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos y otros, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Hermitanio is still building houses, roadways, and other structures. He now needs a loan to buy stationery supplies like paper, pencils, and notebooks. He thanks those who share his dream through this funding. He values the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments on time. He belong to “San Martincito” communal bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies like paper, pencils, and notebooks.

loans.name: Gloria Edith
