texts.es: Gloria de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y reside en casa propia junto a su pequeña hija de un año de edad.  Gloria posee un molino de Nixtamal en donde muchas personas la buscan para moler diferentes semillas como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, etc. de esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene a su pequeña hija. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder tener este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital para el desembolso pero si tiene la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Gloria, 21 years old, is a single mother.  She lives in a house that she owns with her 1 year old daughter.  Gloria owns a Nixtamal mill where many people come to mill different grains such as: corn, rice, beans, etc.  This is how she earns her living and cares for her daughter.  

She wishes to improve her housing conditions, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof on her house.  With the requested amount, she will purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails.  She hopes to get this loan because at the moment, she does not have the resources for the expense but she does have the capacity to make the monthly payments on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase: galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 44-year-old single woman. She has one child who is 15 years old. She describes herself to be confident. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, groundnuts, beans and peas. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a conducive environment, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of products she sells. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of tomatoes, onions, beans, groundnuts, etc. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business to enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, onions, beans, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 25 year old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 4 and 7 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stock of drinks. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of drinks

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 34 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 16 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds to buy more stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as stable. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sell. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an area fit for the business. He describes his biggest business challenge as animal diseases which affect milk production. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds and drugs for the animals. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and drugs for the animals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 46 year old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as determined and goal oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to own her own business premise within 5 years. Currently she has rented a place to do her business. She hopes that in the future she will have the best boutique. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of kes 40,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also pay rent for her business premise. Previously she was selling groceries.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en: Meshack is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a convenient place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
After arriving in the United States from Nicaragua almost 19 years ago, Vida’s mother owned three special occasion stores. Vida always worked with her mother in the stores until she decided to start a special occasion store of her own. 

With her mother’s advice and support, Vida opened Vida’s Atelier in Miami in February 2012. This special occasion store offers a variety of products including dresses for everything from Quinceañearas and Sweet Sixteens to First Communions and Bar Miztvahs. 

“I love helping families in our community get ready for their special occasion,” Vida says.

While she enjoys helping her customers, Vida also relies on the business to support her family and sees it as a way to secure a future for her son and daughter.

With this loan, Vida will pay to advertise her business and purchase more inventory. Help out this entrepreneur and mother of two.

Check out her business here: http://www.vidasatelier.com/.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua began working for a stone distributor and soon fell in love with stone and felt immensely fulfilled by his interactions with customers. Unfortunately, Joshua was laid off shortly afterwards. However, having realized his passion and discovering that there was only one distributor in his area, Joshua decided to establish Ecstatic Stone, a wholesale distributor of natural stone in South Carolina.

“When I first began in the stone industry, I was told that once a person starts working in the industry, they rarely ever leave. I soon learned what was meant by that statement: the granite, marble, onyx, and other natural stones I saw everyday are such amazing creations of nature. It is beautiful stuff. It is art, but it is also very real and has very practical uses.”

At Ecstatic Stone, Joshua imports high quality stones from places like Brazil, India, Nepal, and Italy. He is also conveniently located for local businesses since Ecstatic Stone is the only stone distributor available in a 1.5 hour radius.

The future of Ecstatic Stone certainly looks bright, but Joshua needs your help to take the business to the next level. With this loan, Joshua will purchase more products and warehouse equipment that he will use to move and secure stone slabs.

What does he see in Ecstatic Stone’s future?  “Being very passionate about my work, creative, and imaginative, I envision Ecstatic Stone taking on these characteristics, setting it apart from other stone distributors. I see us as being the best, offering the best, and demanding the best,” he says.

Help out this small business owner today and check out his business here: http://www.ecstaticstone.com/ .

loans.use: to puchase more warehouse equipment

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es un mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo tiene una muy buena sazón, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de venta de comida típica como juane, tacaco con cecina, entre otros, así mismo vende golosinas  en su domicilio con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, los cuales son lo más importante para ella.

Julia gracias a la ayuda de los prestamistas kiva lograr comprar implementos para su negocio como mesas, sillas, manteles, utensilios como cubiertos, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar su negocio y atender a sus clientes de manera mas cómoda y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Julia works very hard and knows how to season food well. She worked hard to open her business, selling traditional foods like seasoned rice and pork jerky. She also sells candies in her house to have additional income to pay household expenses and support her children, who are most important to her. 

Julia thanks the Kiva lenders, who will allow her to buy furniture, such as tables, chairs, and tablecloths, and utensils and silverware so she can make her business better and offer her customers more comfortable service. She will be able to keep striving to make her great dream of having a restaurant a reality.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, silverware, and more.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married to Jose, who is 40 years old. They have 3 children: Antonio who is 12, Rosa who is 10 and Juana who is 9 years old. He is a peasant who grows coffee, a job that is not well paid. Coffee prices are volatile and their income depends on a good harvest that must withstand problems from pest or frosts. Catalina works at house carrying firewood to cook their food and sometimes she dyes clothes to earn more money. 

Their community in southern Mexico is made up of only 1,262 inhabitants. According to government statistics, most people here do not speak spanish well and have very low incomes.

They live in a one room house made of sheet and wood and that has an open bonfire. They often get sick and have respiratory problems because of the smoke in their house. In the winter, it is cold and so they usually catch the flu. Furthermore, there are some animals that come inside the house to eat their food or to hurt their children and themselves.

Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe and affordable place to live. Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system where the families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing and financial education, this aiming to develop and strength their capacities. In México, works since 1989 and today more than 7,000 families have been served just on the last 3 years. This family works with the community committees as they have seen; it gives more and better solutions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Veledin

texts.en:
Veledin lives in rural southeastern Albania, where the majority of people in the villages focus on livestock as the main source of income. 

Veledin is a 56-year-old villager and a married father of six who has been doing livestock for nearly 10 years; he sells the raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. 

He and his family literally fall below the poverty level, and to add to their poverty this past month, they were asked to pay a farmer's contribution as others do in such similar activities. 

In Albania, there is a law that all 'active individuals'. including self-employed farmers, must contribute into the social insurance scheme.  

Farmers and others who are self-employed pay a fixed sum, as well as a set amount of their profits. The contributions are 'registered', but immediately pay out benefits to those who are retired or have disabilities.  Benefits for those paying in now are paid for by the younger generation of workers.

This is the reason why Veledin is requesting a loan for the very first time.

loans.use: to pay for farmer's contribution into the social insurance program

loans.name: Ackim

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Ackim. He is married, and has a 10-year-old son. He lives in his hometown of Mwinilunga, where he offers financial services to people in his community.  When Ackim is not at his shop, he can be found at a local school, where he serves as the school head master.

Ackim started running his mobile money transfers business because he saw a need for people to access affordable financial services. He explains that before he set up his shop, people in his community would have to spend money on transportation to access financial services. He was also motivated by the need to provide a better life for his family because his salary was not enough to sustain his family needs. The business helps him to pay his bills and send his son to a good school.

Ackim is requesting a Kiva loan to boost his working capital and grow his mobile money business.  This will help him to service more customers in his community who need financial services.    

Ackim’s dream is to open another mobile money outlet soon.  He says his passion is education, and he hopes that one day, he will make enough money from his mobile money transfer business and use the proceeds to open his own school

loans.use: to grow his mobile money business in order to service more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: Rositas De Chejecucho Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE CHEJECUCHO” iniciará el primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olinda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de cebollas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olinda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cebollas; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que trabajo con ellos desde niña en el cultivo familiar, posteriormente a su matrimonio decide emprender su espacio de trabajo independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas cebollas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The Rositas de Chejecucho (Little Roses of Chejecucho) communal bank will start their first cycle with Pro Mujer  as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi (Achacachi Regional Office). The group has eight members and is led by a Board of Directors, of which Olinda is President.  

The businesses that the members of the community association carry out vary, but they include crocheting blankets, selling onions, and a neighborhood convenience store.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners, including Olinda. She says this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from her mother who is a member of that institution. She currently has an onion-selling business and she has mentioned that she learned the business from her parents, since she worked on the family farm as a girl. After marrying, she decided to set up an independent workspace. 

The loan that she’s taking out now is to raise her capital (to buy onion seeds), which she’ll buy from wholesale vendors from Ciudad de El Alto. After the crop grows, she’ll sell it using her retail space. This kind of work helps her to generate an income to support her family, since she’s married with 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training area and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds

loans.name: Kholahmad

texts.ru:
Он житель маленького городка Куляб и учитель сельской школы. Его зовут Холахмад. Ему 31 год. Холахмад женатый мужчина. Он воспитывает двоих сыновей. Его жене 27 лет. Она домохозяйка. Пока Холахмад на работе, его жена следит за порядком дома и за детьми. Сыновьям Холахмада 6 и 4 года. Они еще не ходят в школу. 
   Холахмад в течение 12 лет работает учителем в школе. Ему его работа нравится, он большое внимание уделяет воспитанию детей. В свободное от школы время Холахмад проводит на земле. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он трудолюбивый человек и около 10 лет выращивает овощей на земельном участке.
  Холахмад решил на зиму посеять пшеницу. Чтобы купить необходимые средства для посева, у Холахмада не достаточно денег. И он решил взять кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, горючего для трактора и пшеницу. С такими запасами он начнет посев. И Вы можете ему помочь.
texts.en:
He is a resident of the small town of Kulob and a rural school teacher. His name is Kholahmad. He is 31 years old. Kholahmad is a married man. He has two sons. His wife is 27. She is a housewife. While Kholahmad is at work, his wife takes care of the home and children. Kholahmad's sons are 6 and 4 years old. They do not yet attend school. 

Kholahmad has been a school teacher for twelve years. He likes his job, he gives a great deal of his attention to educating children. When he is not at school, Kholahmad works the earth.  He farms. He is a hardworking man who has been growing vegetables for the past ten years. 

Kholahmad decided to sow winter wheat. He does not have enough money to sow. Therefore, he decided to take out a loan to buy fertilizer, tractor fuel, and wheat. With these things, he can start sowing. And you can help him.

loans.use: buy fuel, fertilizer, and wheat

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 30 лет, живет в районе Бохтар.  У нее один маленький ребенок. Муж находится на заработках в чужих краях,чтобы обеспечивать семью. Дилрабо нигде не работает, но она умеет вышивать красивые таджикские платья для женщин. Она решила использовать свое умение и зарабатывать этим путем. Дилрабо планирует у себя дома принимать заказы на шитье. Для этого ей нужна швейная машинка. Она собирается купить две швейные машинки и вместе с матерью начать швейное дело. Однако ее собственного сбережения не хватает для осуществления этой покупки и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Dilrabo is a young married woman, aged 30. She lives in Bohtar. She has one small child. Her husband is working abroad to provide for the family. Dilrabo does not work anywhere, but she knows how to make beautiful Tajik dresses for women. She decided to use her skills and earn money this way. Dilrabo plans to take custom orders from home. To do this, she needs a sewing machine. She is going to buy two sewing machines and, with her mother, start sewing. However, she does not have enough in savings to make the purchase, so she applied for a loan.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to start a sewing business

loans.name: Rita Guadalupe

texts.es: Rita de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia y habita junto a sus dos hijas de 7 años, 5 años y un hijo de 9 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que sus hijas e hijo estudien y cuenten con mejores condiciones habitacionales. Rita tiene  una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer. Este negocio le permite dar a sus hijos el sustento diario ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Desea mejorar las paredes de su casa las cuales están construidas a base de lámina y por mayor seguridad desea levantar las paredes a base de ladrillo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento y hierro.
texts.en:
Rita is 27 years old, and lives in a house that she owns.  She lives with her two daughters who are 7 years old and 5 years old, and one son who is 9 years old.  For her, what is most important is that her daughters and son are educated and have better living conditions.  Rita has a small store in her home, which she was able to establish after a lot of hard work.  This business allows her to provide her children with their daily needs as it is her primary source of income.  

She wishes to repair the walls on her house, which are made of metal sheets.  For security reasons, she wants to build brick walls.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, sand, cement and iron.

loans.use: purchase bricks, sand, cement and iron to chain the walls in her home.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Danelia mujer de 51 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos que dependen de ella, su negocio es un taller de bordados desde hace 20 años, ella comercializa sus productos  en el mercado de Masaya. Tiene a dos personas que le ayudan  en su negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales como seda, hilo, tela, botones, agujas, otros.
texts.en: Danelia is a 51-year-old woman; she is in a relationship and has two children still depending on her. Her business has been an embroidery workshop for the last 20 years. She sales her products in the market of Masaya, and has two persons helping her with the business. She is requesting the loan to buy materials like silk, thread, fabric, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.use: to buy inputs like silk, fabric, thread, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: La señora Yovana tiene 22 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa vestidos para niñas, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Yovana,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de vestidos al por mayor y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Yovana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yovanna is 22 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 6 years old. She sells clothing and dresses for girls. She sells her products in different markets in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first loan cycle with the institution. Yovanna will use the loan to buy dresses at wholesale price so she can stock her business. Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her inventory. Yovanna faces challenges in her business, which is competition. She will use the loan to continue buying merchandise so that she can generate more income. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she is provided to grow her business, improve her income, and thereby her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dresses at wholesale price

loans.name: Jessica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jessica de 26 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 4 añitos que aun no estudia, su pareja trabaja como fotógrafo por cuenta propia, ella es comerciante de casa en casa, vende cosméticos por catálogos y venta de comida rápida en su casa de habitación por lo que se siente muy tranquila porque le brinda una mejor atención a su hijo. Jessica intenta salir adelante  con su negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para invertir en cosméticos y  materia prima para comida, gracias al financiamiento podrá comprar lo siguiente: perfumes, vanidades, labiales, cremas para el cuerpo, así como también, plátano, repollo, tomates, carne.
texts.en: Jessica is 26 years old and the mother of a 4 year old son who is not yet in school. Her partner works as a free-lance photographer. She sells things door to door. She sells cosmetics from catalogs and also sells fast food from her home, which makes her very happy because she can spend more time with her son. Jessica tries to get ahead with her business, which is why she is requesting the loan, so she can buy cosmetics and raw ingredients for her food. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to buy the following: perfumes, accessories, lipsticks, body lotions, and also plantains, cabbage, tomatoes, and meat.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, accessories, lipsticks, body lotions, and also plantains, cabbage, tomatoes, and meat.

loans.name: Priscillah's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Priscillah selected as the Kiva representative. Priscillah has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  

Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. (67 individual farmers in total are represented by this group).

Priscillah is 45 years old, and has been a farmer for six years to provide for her six children.  The community and other farmers know Priscillah as friendly and hard-working.  Other than farming, she is also involved in community activity, such as the women's group.  Priscillah described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Priscillah joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Priscillah joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because she is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, Priscillah has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Priscillah's life because she has more farm training, and has more farm group support.  She was also able to save money and feed her family.  In the future, Priscillah hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to save for the future, and to buy a cow.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Priscillah and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Fanny Maritza

texts.es:
Fanny de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta  primer grado de nivel académico, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la agricultura, los dos hijos van a la escuela y solo ellos dependen de ella. Fanny vive con la mamá y sus dos hijos. 

Fanny se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo se lo enseño el papá; ya que antes solo vivian de la agricultura, a esto se dedica desde que era una niña,  en el trabajo solo se involucran los hermanos, ya que a  los hijos aun no los involucra en esto porque ellos están en la escuela y ella quiere que se preparen.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar unas deudas que tiene en otras instituciones y siente que le está saliendo muy caro el interés y se le hace muy difícil poder salir adelante con los gastos, el préstamo mejorara mucho  porque  estará un poco más tranquila que pagara menos interés.

Sus mayores sueños son preparar a sus hijos, apoyarlos que vayan a  la escuela y que sean muy preparados, que en el futuro sean alguien que aporten al desarrollo de El Salvador.
texts.en:
23-year-old Fanny is the single mother of two children and studied through her first year of college.  She makes a living in agriculture. She lives with her mother and her two children who attend school and are dependent on her.

She’s made a living in agriculture since she was a girl because her father taught it to her, and because that’s how people used to make their living. Only her brothers are involved in the agricultural work since her children are in school and she wants them to focus on their education.

The loan she’s asking for from Fundación Campo is to pay off some debts she has taken out from other institutions, because the interest is high and she's finding it difficult to get ahead because of her expenses. The loan will help her a lot because she’ll be able to relax since she’ll be paying less in interest.

Fanny's biggest dreams are helping her children, supporting them so that they continue going to school and are well-prepared, and that her children will support El Salvador’s development.

loans.use: to help pay off debts she owes to other institutions because the interest is getting too high

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35-years-old and happily married with three children. He continues to grow his business of mobile money transfers thanks to the financial help he has accessed through Kiva. This will be John’s second loan from Kiva. He is happy with how the business has given him the opportunity to send his children to school and pay his rental costs.

John used his first Kiva loan to expand his business by opening another Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lusaka’s Chaisa compound. He was able to generate more profits and now runs his business with more confidence because he is able to pay out his customers in good time. John says from the time he got his fist loan, his personal life has also improved because it is now easier for him to provide for his family’s basic needs.

John is applying for a second Kiva loan to boost his working capital at his two outlets. This will help John to  grow his mobile money business to service more customers at his two outlets who need financial services.

loans.use: To boost his working capital at his two outlets so that he can serve more customers in need of financial services.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
El señor Estanislao es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus nietos. Su negocio es una pulpería y el servicio de molino desde hace 6 años.
Don Estanislao es muy conocido y visitado por los vecinos de su comunidad. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: arroz, manteca, huevos, aceite, refresco, arroz, frijoles, bandas, limas, etc.
Don Estanislao espera que gracias al préstamo las ventas aumenten ya que con este podrá tener el producto necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y  de igual manera mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos.
Don Estanislao desea seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Estanislao works hard and lives with his wife and grandchildren in a town in southern Honduras. He has run a small grocery store and milling service for six years. Estanislao is well known to the neighbors, who shop at his store frequently. He needs a loan to buy more merchandise like rice, shortening, eggs, oil, beverages, beans, and limes.

Estanislao hopes that his sales will increase with the loan, as he will have more inventory to meet his customers needs, and that he will also be able to raise his family's living standard with the additional income. Estanislao wants to keep supporting his family. He also hopes to see the children continue their education, become good people, and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, shortening, eggs, oil, beverages, beans, limes, and more for his business.

loans.name: Jennifer Lisseth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión de la cual tiene un  hijo de tres años de edad. El marido es albañil.
Doña Jennifer es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que gana se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en los ratos que ella está desocupada,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días dependiendo de cómo deseen sus clientes. Lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante en ocasiones cuando su marido no tiene trabajo
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: The Credit Group "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets every 15 days in the Abdon Calderon neighborhood of the city of Manta. Manta is well known for its beautiful beaches, which are well visited at all seasons of the year, and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions. Jennifer lives here. She is 21 years old and has a live-in partner with whom she has a three year old son. Her live-in partner is a construction worker. Jennifer is a housewife. To earn her own income, since her partner's earnings are not enough for the family, she sells clothing and Esika catalog products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories) through catalogs. She sells door to door. When she is not so busy, she sells to her customers and allows them to pay her back a week or two later if they need to. She has been selling like this for three years. It has helped her family stay afloat whenever her partner did not have any work. This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, creams and cosmetics to sell. She has been part of the Credit Group for 3 years and she likes that the loans are quick and helpful. Her dream is to give her son the best in life.

loans.use: To buy clothing, perfumes, creams and cosmetic products.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una señora activa y trabajadora, casada y madre de 3 hijos, a los que sacó adelante con mucha dedicación y esmero.
Actualmente genera ingresos realizando 3 labores diferentes que alterna en el día, presta el servicio de confección a terceros, vende mercancía por catálogos y adicionalmente cuida al hijo de una vecina, de esta forma complementa sus ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de una máquina familiar industrial e insumos al por mayor (telas e hilos) que requiere para agilizar su trabajo de confección y así poder cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes y adquirir nuevos contratos.
María manifiesta que su propósito es poder continuar con sus labores pero, desea adecuar una habitación de su casa para poner allí su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y de vida, teniendo su vivienda bien organizada.
texts.en:
María is an active and hardworking woman. She is married and mother of 3 children, whom she raised with much dedication and care. Currently, she generates income carrying out 3 different jobs which alternate in the day. She offers the service of sewing for third parties, sells merchandise by catalogs and, additionally, cares for the son of a neighbor. In this manner, she complements her income, with which she supports her husband with the economic burden of the home.

The loan applied for will be invested in the purchase of a popular industrial sewing machine and supplies in bulk (fabrics and thread) that she needs to make her sewing work more agile. This way, she will be able to fulfill the opportune delivery of orders that she has pending, achieving earning the trust of her clients and acquiring new contracts.

María says that her purpose is to be able to continue with her work, but she wishes to adapt a room of her house to put her business there and improve the working and living conditions, having her home well organized.

loans.use: to buy a popular industrial sewing machine and supplies in bulk (fabric and thread).

loans.name: Noreley

texts.es:
Noreley, a sus 30 años de edad, se desempeña como comerciante independiente desde hace más de 7 años; tiene una pequeña charcutería en la que ofrece mecato, gaseosas, cervezas y licor; trabaja sola todos los días en la jornada nocturna, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida en el sector por su trayectoria, sus buenos precios y calidad del servicio, lo que hace parte de los factores diferenciadores. El oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y lo inició como una alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y con el sustento de su hijo.
El crédito que solicita actualmente, es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, cervezas, gaseosas, licor), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y podrá satisfacer los gustos de su clientela, generando así una mejoría en la entrada de dinero para sus gastos familiares.
Noreley manifiesta que el motivo por el cual lucha día a día es el bienestar de su hijo, por ello sueña con adquirir su casa propia y ampliar su negocio para que sea más rentable y así le permita tener la capacidad para mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Noreley, aged 30, has been an independent businesswoman for over seven years, running a small cafe where she sells pastries, sodas, beer, and liquor in the evening. She learned to run a food service business  by observing other restaurants, and started the cafe to earn income that would help her and her husband meet their household budget and support their son. Noreley runs the cafe by herself and enjoys a reputation throughout the area for having started and developed a business that offers reasonable prices and high-quality service. 

Noreley is applying for a loan to purchase wholesale goods (pastries, beer, sodas, liquor). This additional inventory will allow her to continue her business while meeting her customers' demand, boosting the income that goes toward her family's expenses. Noreley says that her son's well-being is the reason she strives each day to succeed. She hopes to buy her own home and expand her business, making it more profitable and allowing her to improve her family's living conditions and happiness.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale goods (pastries, beer, soda, liquor)

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей с семьей живет в селе Гладковка. Он 11 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством, выращивая в теплицах ранние и поздние помидоры, а также пекинскую капусту. У Сергея есть свой участок в 40 соток
Сергей планирует вложить сумму в 15 000 гривен в подготовку к сезону теплиц и содержание тепличного хозяйства. Сергей хочет закупить пленку, удобрения, семена, дрова и капельные шланги для предстоящего тепличного сезона.
texts.en:
Sergei and his family live in the village of Gladkova. He has been farming in greenhouses for eleven years. He grows early tomatoes and Chinese cabbage.  Sergei has his own forty-hectare plot of land.

Sergei is planning to spend 15,000 hryvnia getting his greenhouses prepared for the season and maintaining them. Sergei wants to buy plastic film, fertilizer, seeds, wood and drip hoses for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, plastic film, wood and hose pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Ocho De Diciembre Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias luchadoras y trabajadoras una de ellas Sucelina mujer de 50 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y tamales, desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como quintal de maíz, carne de cerdo, hojas, rollos de mecates, papas, cebolla, tomate, arroz, leña, molida, transporte. Carolina  mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, Amanda  tiene la edad de 20 años su negocio es la venta de fritanga.
texts.en: The group is comprised of three striving, hardworking members.  One of them is Sucelina, a 50 year old woman who is in a common-law relationship and has two children under her care.  For the past eight years, she has been in the business of selling “nacatamales” [maize, meat, and rice wrapped in a banana leaf] and “tamales” [a Mexican dish made of chopped meat and crushed peppers, highly seasoned, wrapped in cornhusks spread with masa, and steamed].  She is requesting the loan to purchase basic ingredients such as a quintal of maize, pork, leaves, rolls of twine, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, firewood, and meat, as well as to pay for transport.  Carolina, a 31 year old woman, sells clothing; Amanda is 20 years old and sells fried food.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients such as a quintal of maize, pork, leaves, rolls of twine, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, firewood, and meat, as well as to pay for transport.

loans.name: Anayanci

texts.es: Anayanci  tiene  39  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar zapatos para su tienda . Ella piensa aumentar su inventario de mercadería y así  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja…
texts.en:
Anayanic, 39, is married and lives with her husband and son. With the loan she will buy shoes for her shop. She wants to increase her inventory of merchandize so that she can earn more income to support her family. 

She does not have the necessary capital to make such a purchase as she has little resources and does not have a way to obtain the money necessary for this. For this reason, she is asking for a loan. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had earlier loans from state banks but FUNDECOSUR has provided her the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her shop.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Candy

texts.es: Candy,  de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está casada con Guillermo y por el momento no tiene hijos con el, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su hermana de 16 años de edad a la que apoya incondicionalmente. La actividad que realiza Candy es la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, en diversas tallas, colores y modelos. Además se dedica a la confección de ropas dependiendo del tipo de prenda solicitado por sus clientes que en su mayoría esta conformado por sus vecinos y en menor rango por clientes eventuales. Tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en la parte frontal de su vivienda y ahí atiende todos los días esperando la llegada de su clientela. Actualmente trabaja sola y ella misma se encarga de la venta de cada uno de las prendas que tiene. Complementa su trabajo con la venta de perfumes, cremas corporales y otros productos femeninos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está contenta de saber que tiene el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Se compromete a ser puntual con el pago sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado comprará ropa como blusas y faldas para ofrecerlos a la venta en su local de atención.
texts.en:
Candy is 29 years old and is a hardworking woman who puts forth lots of effort.  She is married to Guillermo, does not have any children yet, and lives in a home of her own with her husband, and 16 year old sister who helps her unconditionally.  Candy sells men’s, women’s and children’s clothing of different colors and styles.   She also makes clothing, depending on the types of clothing requested by her customers, most of whom are her neighbors and some future customers.

She has a small store located in the front part of her house and she waits for customers there every day.  She works alone and she is in charge of every article of clothing she sells.  She complements her work by selling perfumes, body creams, and other feminine products.  She is asking for a loan of S/. 500 and is happy to know that she has financial support to continue with her plans.  She is committed to being on time with her payments, as before.  She will use the money to buy clothing such as blouses and skirts to sell from her shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing,

loans.name: Gelmy Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Gelmy es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable tiene 28 años vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus 4  hijos, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años.
Doña Gelmy su negocio es muy visitado y conocido por los vecinos de su comunidad, necesita el crédito para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal y leña, con la que podrá seguir elaborando su producto. 
Doña Gelmy espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que contara con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su trabajo de forma continua satisfaciendo así los pedidos de sus clientes con los cuales espera que sus ventas tengan un aumento el cual venga a beneficiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Uno  de sus sueños es  hacer crecer su negocio y de esta poder cumplir los sueños y metas de los mismos.


Choluteca, Honduras - Noviembre  2013
texts.en:
Gelmy, 28, works hard and is responsible. She lives with her four children in a town in southern Honduras. She has been making and selling tortillas for three years. Gelmy's business is very busy and known to the neighbors. She needs a loan to buy supplies like corn, lime, and wood to keep making her product.

Gelmy expects the loan to be very helpful, as she will have the supplies she needs to keep operating her business. She expects to increase sales by filling her customer orders and to raise her family's standard of living. One of her dreams is to grow her business so that her family can achieve its dreams and goals.

Choluteca, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and wood for her business.

loans.name: Jephet

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Japhet. He is happily married with two children, ages 15 and 11. He sells Coca-Cola products to local retailers and customers in the Mutendere township located in Lusaka, Zambia.  

Japhet has been running his business for twelve years. He enjoys running the business because it is a good way for him to earn money and provide for his family. He also gets to interact with different people everyday which Japhet really enjoys. He says his community benefits from his business because they can order their soft drinks at a convenient place and do not need to go into the city to order drinks for resale. On a daily basis, Japhet can be found at his red container.

Japhet has applied for a Kiva loan because he suffered a misfortune when his container caught fire and his business suffered major losses because a lot of his stock went up in flames. He is now trying to get back on his feet and recover from the loss. He will use the money to purchase stock and boost his working capital, this will help him get back on track and begin to increase his revenue.

loans.use: To purchase stock and boost his working capital

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos  quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y de esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. El compañero de vida de Ana emigro hace algunos años al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida ya que lo que ganaba en el país no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Con mucho esfuerzo van saliendo adelante y tratan de unir esfuerzos para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI ya que desea reparar el corredor de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Ana is 31 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her four children who attend the local public school.  She raises pigs and earns a living this way and helps with the household expenses.  Her husband emigrated a few years ago, in search of better living conditions that he could not reach in the country and was unable to cover the household expenses.  They are getting ahead with great effort so that they can provide better living conditions for their children.  Ana is asking for this loan through FUSAI so she can repair her house to provide better living conditions.  She will use the money from this loan to buy galvanized metal and lumber.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Mariela Allisson

texts.es: La Señorita Mariela tiene 26 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en turismo en una universidad muy reconocida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Mariela trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja vendiendo ropa de segunda mano,  la Señorita Mariela va a usar este préstamo para  los tramites que implica el sacar su título académico a nivel nacional,  la Señorita Mariela enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  vive en la zona de San Pedro, su deseo es poder terminar sus tramites y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y con el tiempo poder estudiar una maestría.
texts.en: Mariela is 26 years old and single. She is studying Tourism in a well recognized university of the city of La Paz. To pay for her studies, Mariela works selling second hand clothing. Mariela is going to use the loan to cover the costs involved in getting her academic title accredited at the national level. Mariela faces challenges in her studies due to the lack of financial support from her parents and the need to work and study at the same time. Nevertheless, she wants to continue and finish her studies so she can work in her profession. She lives in the zone of San Pedro. Her wish is to complete her paperwork and find a job in her profession. In time she wants to be able to get a Masters degree.

loans.use: To get her National Diploma

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adan   tiene 42 años de edad, esta soltero y vive con dos hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales, abono  para un invernadero de culantro y  hortalizas, el se dedica a esta actividad agrícola  y desea poder seguir creciendo con este proyecto y poder venderlo en los supermercados y lugares aledaños. El quiere aumentar un poco la producción y con ello  las ventas para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica a sus hijos. El se ha dedicado  al cultivo de hortalizas. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Adam is 42 years old. He is single and lives with two of his children. He needs this loan to buy materials such as manure for a greenhouse for cilantro and vegetables. He grows vegetables and wants to continue growing with this project in order to sell in supermarkets and neighboring towns. He wants to increase his production a bit and thereby his sales so he can provide a better quality of life and economic stability for his children. He has dedicated himself to growing vegetables. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for growing vegetables

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es: Leocadio, tiene la edad  de 53 años, está soltero y vive con la madre. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos  cerdos y el alimento del mismo. El cuenta con varios cerdos   y lo que pretende es aumentar sus animales  . El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Leocadio is 53 years old, single, and lives with his mother.  He plans to purchase some pigs and feed.  He has several pigs and plans to increase his animals.  He wants his animals to have the ideal weight for later sale at the local market and neighboring areas.  He wishes to generate the most profit for his well-being and that of his family as well as expand his pig-fattening project.   This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t has any other loans with state banks, but FUDEOSUR, has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate

loans.use: to purchase feed and pigs.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man with six children. He describes himself to be experienced. He is a mason and builds houses. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a viable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy tools. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a mason's trowel, joint filler and other tools for building. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a mason's trowel, joint filler and other tools

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es: A sus 50 años Mirian trabaja muy duro para sacar a delante a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado. Además, también vende la leche que extrae de las vacas que tiene. Es una mujer muy conocida en la zona donde habita ya que es muy emprendedora y responsable. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para terminar de construir la pared del corredor y encementar el piso. Con el monto del crédito comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. Espera tener acceso a este financiamiento y así dar inicio a las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en: At the age of 50, Mirian works very hard to help her children get ahead. She dedicates herself to raising and selling livestock. She also milks the cows she has and sells the milk. She is a well-known woman in the area where she lives, because she is very enterprising and responsible. She would like to improve the condition of her house, and for this reason she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to complete the construction of the corridor wall and to lay down cement on the floor. With the funds from the loan she will buy bricks, cement, sand, iron bars, etc. She hopes to have access to this financing and thus start the improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron bars to build a corridor wall and cement floor.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Шоира замужем за доброго человека. Ее муж работает бухгалтером. Шоира тоже имеет высшее образование. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает математику. Шоира всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Дочь Шоиры учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете в факультете Финансы и кредит на втором курсе. Шоира должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shoira is a conscientious woman. She is married and has four children. Shoira is married to a good man. Her husband works as a bookkeeper. Shoira also has a higher education. She works as a high school teacher. She teaches mathematics.

Shoira always dreamed that her children would get a higher education. Shoira's daughter is studying at the Khujand State University in the department of Finance and Credit in her second year. Shoira needs to pay her daughter's tuition at the university.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y un  hijo actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Fernando, an entrepreneurial man, is 67 years old. He is married and currently lives with his wife and son. He requested the loan with the desire to purchase supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes this will help his coffee crops, with the goal of keeping them in good condition during their growth in order to obtain a high quality product.

The only limiting factor that this man has is the lack of money to continue growing. Since he his dependent on this economic activity to be able to get ahead, he is requesting a loan. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not requested any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Манзуре 29 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Она решила организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она еще в родительском доме научилась шитью женской одежды. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Свои услуги она будет предоставить дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и верит, что этот займ даст ей надежду светлой будущей.
texts.en:
This woman, who is the keeper of the hearth for her home, has a grand idea, to organize a new business. Manzura is 29 years old. She is married, but does not have children. She decided to establish a business sewing women's clothing, since she learned while still in her parents' home how to sew women's clothing.

She has long been looking for help and finally, she learned about the course "Bring on Success" organized by the Association of Business Women. She took part in the course and received a lot of good things for herself. After finishing the course, she received a certificate.

Now, she is ready to start her business, and at the same time does not have money to buy a sewing machine. Her services will be offered from home. She is requesting a loan of 500 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She is waiting for kindness and believes that this loan will give her hope for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз прекрасная женщина, жена и мать. Она в средней школе была одной из лучших учеников. Дилафруз умная и трудолюбивая. Она работает уборщицей в музыкальной школе. Так как у нее маленькая и зарплата, она решила организовать свой бизнес. Дилафруз 3 месяца назад организовала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она умеет шить национальные женские платья, так как еще в родительском доме, она научилась шитью женских платьев. Дилафруз начала свой бизнес со старой машинкой, которая она имела дома. Теперь она хочет купить новую швейную машинку. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a lovely woman, wife and mother. In high school, she was one of the best students. Dilafruz is clever and hardworking. She works as a charwoman in a music school.

Since she gets a small salary, she decided to establish her own business. Three months ago, Dilafruz started her business sewing women's clothing. She knows how to sew national women's dresses, since while still in her parents' home she learned how to sew women's clothing. Dilafruz began her business with an old machine, that she had a home. Now, she wants to buy a new sewing machine. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for developing a new business

loans.name: Paula De Los Angeles

texts.es: Paula de 45 años de edad es madre soltera y reside en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 13 años, 11 años y 17 años de edad. Para Paula lo más importante es que sus hijos estudien y cuenten con mejores condiciones habitacionales a las que ella ha tenido. Desea mejorar la seguridad de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y balcones de hierro ya que actualmente no se encuentran en buenas condiciones y no es muy seguro.
texts.en: Paula, age 45, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her three children ages 11, 13, and 17. For her, the most important thing is for her children to study and have better living conditions than she has had. She wants to improve her home's security, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of doors and iron balconies. Currently, her home is not very secure.

loans.use: to buy doors and iron balconies for her home.

loans.name: Sophear

texts.en:
Sophear is 37 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has a nine-year-old adopted child. She has been selling palm juice for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a business of buying cattle to resell. He makes an income of about $7 each day to help cover the family’s expenses. 

To improve her family’s livelihood, Sophear is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cattle to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her adopted child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years selling a variety of items. 

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, detergent soap, bath soap, cooking oil, eggs, etc. to sell. Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, detergent soap, bath soap, cooking oil, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Oliver is 19 years old and is the 3rd of three children in the family. His mother, Ma. Sol, who is the member of Project Dungganon, supports the family through her general store and restaurant business in the Philippines.

Oliver is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course. He is borrowing 25,000 to pay tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When he graduates, Oliver plans to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Almira works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling (Avon products) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear. Almira is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products to sell to her customers.

Almira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amalia is 44 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Amalia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre agricultor de 67 años de edad, el está casado y vive con sus hijos en el Departamento de Sololá. 
El se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando diferentes clases de verduras y lo realiza a unos metros de su vivienda. Esta labor lo aprendió desde que tenía 15 años de edad ya que su padre se dedicaba a la agricultura. Por lo que ahora cuenta con varios años de experiencia en esta área que  ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
Ahora cuenta que gracias a la labor que realiza puede aportar a la economía de su familia. Por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de materiales para la remodelación de su vivienda ya que aún le falta mejorar la estructura. El préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que actualmente cuenta.
Su mayor sueño terminar la remodelación de su vivienda para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Juan, a man of 67, is a farmer.  He is married, and lives with his children in the Department of Sololá (an administrative division of the country).  

He works in agriculture, cultivating different types of vegetables just a few meters away from his home—work he learned when he was 15 years old, as his father also worked in agriculture.  So, he now has years of experience in this field, which has been fairly productive with respect to generating income and earnings, and he says that thanks to his work, he is able to contribute to his family’s economy.

He is seeking a loan of 3,000 quetzales to purchase materials for the renovation of his home, since he still needs to improve the structure; and he will repay the loan with the work that he has currently. 

His biggest dream is to complete the renovation of his home so that his family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the renovation of his home.

loans.name: Omaira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Omaira, a sus 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos a los que sacó adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, se dedica a elaborar y vender empanadas, actividad que aprendió de su abuela y que, hoy en día se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en el garaje de la casa de una hermana, trabaja sola todos los días de 5 a 10 pm y cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida en el sector por su trayectoria y por la calidad y el sabor de su producto; así ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito solicitado será destinado para comprar insumos al por mayor (papas, harina de maíz, aceite, salsas, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de materia prima suficiente para satisfacer la demanda y mejorar los ingresos.
Omaira manifiesta que su propósito es darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente para lograrlo y en un futuro cercano tener la posibilidad de dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Omaira is a 58 year old, married, mother of four who works hard to get her children ahead in life. For about twenty years, she has been engaged in preparing and selling “empanadas” [pastry filled with chopped or ground meat, vegetables, fruit, etc., and usually baked or fried]. She learned this skill from her grandmother and it has become her main source of income today.  Her business is located in the garage of her sister’s house.  She works alone from 5:00 to 10:00 pm and to her advantage, she is known in her area for her experience and her product’s quality and flavor. In this way, she has managed to earn income to support her husband with the household’s financial burden.

The loan she is requesting will be allocated to the purchase of wholesale ingredients (potatoes, cornflower, oil, sauces, and other items).  This will allow her to have enough basic ingredients available to meet demand and improve her income.  Omaira says that, in time, her goal is to provide her business with permanence and continuity.  For this reason, she keeps working arduously to achieve her goal.  In the near future, she hopes to have the possibility of a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale ingredients (potatoes, cornflower, oil, sauces, and other items).

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 34 años de edad,  tiene séptimo grado  de nivel académico, está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tienen 4  hijos  que vive con ellos, en casa de don Luis  vive solamente con sus hijos y la esposa por lo tanto solamente ellos dependen de él.

Luis trabaja como albañil  ya tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este oficio, este trabajo lo aprendió con la ayuda de un amigo que lo invitaba a trabajar  y fue así que aprendió este oficio y vio que esto le daría resultado, decidió meterse muy de lleno a este trabajo;  pero también Luis trabaja como negociante de ganado desde hace  dos años y lo tiene a una distancia de 45 minutos de la casa al municipio, es ahí donde vende el ganado. 

 Para comprar el ganado siempre ha estado trabajando con estos préstamos en la institución, que gracias a Dios tiene las puertas abiertas, en estos dos oficio solamente él trabaja no se involucra ni un miembro de la familia; el trabajo de albañil lo hace de lunes a sábado de 7 am a 4pm , excepto el miércoles que desde la mañana se va para la plaza de a vender y comprar ganado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes que le venden y que ve que eso le dará ganancias,  ya que la plaza suele ponerse muy buena en esta época y así le va generar más ganancias y podrá comprar más ganado para el otro miércoles; las ganancias le ayudara a él y a su familia esto va mejorar  su negocio y así lo podrá ampliar mucho mas.

Los sueños que tiene es poder ser un negociante muy reconocido en la zona y poder comprar un camión para llevar el ganado a la plaza y andar trayéndolo de los lugares que los compra, esto lo lograra con mucho trabajo y con la ayuda de Dios que le dará muchos ingresos y ganancias así para darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y a sus hijos prepararlos académicamente y que aprendan este oficio también.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, has a seventh grade level of education, his wife takes care of their home and they have four children that live with them. In his house, he lives with his children and wife so only they depend on him. 

Luis has been working as a bricklayer for seven years. He learned this skill with the help of a friend that invited him to work. This is how he learned this craft and when he saw that it would give him results he decided to dedicate himself fully to this work. But for the last two years, Luis has also worked as a livestock dealer and lives 45 minutes away from town where he sells the livestock.

To buy the livestock, he has always worked with these loans of the institution, which thanks to God have opened its doors to him. In these two jobs, he works alone and he does not involve any of his family members. He works as a bricklayer Monday through Saturday from 7am to 4pm except for Wednesdays when he starting in the morning goes to the town plaza to buy and sell livestock.

The loan that he is asking for is to buy a pair of oxen, which he will sell. He sees that this will generate a profit because the plaza usually gets really busy this time of year. Through these sales he will earn more profits and he will be able to buy more livestock for the following Wednesday.

The profits will help him and his family and will improve his business and allow him to expand it much more. 

His dream is to become a very well know businessman in the area and be able to buy a truck to bring the livestock to the plaza and other places where they will buy the livestock. He will achieve this will lots of work and the help of God, which will give him high income and profits so that he can provide a better standard of living for his family, academically prepare his children and also teach his children his trade.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan de 35 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo grado de nivel académico,  está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios  domésticos, es padre de una hija de tres años,  que vive con ellos en casa de Juan vive la suegra y la cuñada pero  solamente depende la hija y la esposa de él. 

Juan trabaja como motorista de un moto taxi,  ya tiene 3 años de desempeñarlo. Lo aprendió solo viendo la necesidad que el municipio tenía con el trasporte, ya que mucha gente viajaba a pie del municipio a los cantones vecinos, entonces decidió comprar un moto taxi , además,  posee una panadería que junto con la mamá y su hermana, este trabajo lo tiene a una distancia de 30 minutos de la casa y  viajan en el moto taxi en el trabajo de la panadería se involucra la mamá y la hermana; pero en el trabajo de la moto taxi lo hace  él solo, estos trabajos lo inicia desde las 4 de la mañana y finaliza a las 7 de la noche. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  más preparaciones para la panadería  y dos bicicletas con sus respectivos canastos para que salgan a vender el pan y así les da empleo a demás personas y también le genera más ganancias a él y a su familia, esto va a mejorar su negocio; porque más personas conocerán el sabor del rico pan que aquí se elabora, ya que se saldrá a vender en los cantones cercanos al municipio y la necesidad que satisfará es que tendrá más ingresos. 

Los sueños que tiene es poder tener una panadería más grande y una empresa de transporte de moto taxi,  esto lo lograra con mucho trabajo y con la ayuda de Dios que le dará muchos ingresos y ganancias así para darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y a su hija prepararla en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old. He studied through the seventh grade. He lives with his wife who is responsible for maintaining their home. He is the father of a 3-year-old daughter who lives with them. In Juan's house also lives his mother-in-law and sister-in-law but only his daughter and wife are dependent on him. 

Juan works as a mototaxi driver, which he has been doing for three years. He learned the profession because he saw the need for transportation in his town, since many people traveled on foot across the town to their neighbors' districts. Therefore he decided to buy a mototaxi. Additionally, he owns a bakery with his mother and sister. This business is 30 minutes from his house and he travels to work in his mototaxi. He works in the bakery with his mother and sister, but works the mototaxi job alone. He works from 4 o'clock in the morning until 7 o'clock at night.

The loan he is requesting is to buy more supplies for the bakery and two bicycles with baskets from which he can sell bread. That way he can employ additional people and generate more earnings for him and his family. This will improve his business because more people will learn about the delicious bread that he makes since he will travel to sell it in the nearby districts. This will satisfy his need for more profits.

His dreams are to have a larger bakery and a mototaxi transportation business. He will achieve this with hard work and the help of God, through which he will increase his earnings and profits. With that he will give his family a better quality of life and an education to his daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for his bakery.

loans.name: Makhburat

texts.ru: Махбурат 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Старшая дочь-студентка, остальные дети-школьники. У Махбурат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Махбурат занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Махбурат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также обрабатывают принадлежащую поливную земельную долю 0,80 ГА и арендуют у односельчан 2,0 ГА. Махбурат и ее семья на указанных землях выращивают- хлопок, тыкву, арбузы, помидоры. На сегодняшний день в хлопкоперерабатывающий завод сдано 1,80 тонн хлопка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS).
