В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махбурат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Махбурат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, также обучить детей.
texts.en:
Makhburat is 42 years old and married. They are raising four children. The three youngest children are in elementary school, while the oldest daughter in a higher grade. 

Makhburat has a high school education. She raises livestock as the primary income for the family. She started twenty years ago by buying cattle for 5,000 KGS. Due to her hard work, she now has three dairy cows and farms their own 0.8-hectare plot of land. She also rents 2.0 hectares for the villagers. Makhburat and her family grow cotton, squash, watermelons and tomatoes. To date they have cultivated 1.8 tons of cotton. Their monthly income is 10,000 KGS. 

To improve their living conditions, Makhburat took a loan from the micro-finance organization, Bai-Tushum and Partners, to buy cows to fatten and sell on the market for a profit. Makhburat will use the profit to invest in her herd and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su humilde casa la cual gran parte de las paredes es de lámina y desea cambiarlas por material más resistente. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento y hierro y así dar inicio a la construcción de las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maribel, age 37, lives in her own home with her partner. She has sold tamales for many years, so she has a great deal of experience in the business. With great hard work, she has been able to build her humble home. Most of her walls are laminate, and she wants to change them and install a stronger metal. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, sand, cement, and iron in order to start building the walls of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, and iron to build walls for her home.

loans.name: Welbin Jose

texts.es: Welbin, es un joven habitante del municipio de Juigalpa que trabaja como responsable de bodega en una institucion del estado, no tiene hijos en la actualidad, apoya economicamente a su madre con su salario y a su pareja, Welbin desea construir un anexo con el objetivo de instalar un negocio de pastelería en su casa para que la trabaje su pareja de vida a quien desea apoyarla para salir adelante juntos. Pero para llevar a cabo este bien a futuro solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales a utilizar como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, perlines y laminas de zinc con esta obra realizada podra poner  en marcha su negocio, que  le será de mucha ayuda a su economía que le permitirá tener otro medio de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Welbin is a young resident of the Juigalpa municipality who works in a storeroom in a state institution. He does not currently have children, but he supports his mother and his wife with his salary. Welbin wants to build an annex with the goal of opening a bakery in his home. His wife will work there; he wants to support her so that they can get ahead together. In order to bring this dream to life, he is requesting a loan for the purchase of the materials he will need, such as: cement, sand, iron, blocks, perlins, and zinc laminate. With this work, he will be able to put the business into motion. This will be of great help to their household; it will allow them to have another source of income for their family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, zinc laminate, and purlins, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махина очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Махина с детства помогала своей матери по введению ее бизнеса. Махина шила национальные платья, а ее мать продавала на местном рынке. Махина после замужества нигде не работала и занималась воспитанием детей. Обеспечение двоих детей требует больше денег и ее муж не справляется. Махина 4 месяца назад организовала свой бизнес купле продажей женской одежды. Махина запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки женской одежды для расширения оборотного капитала своего нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahina is a very hardworking woman. She is married and is raising two children. Since childhood, Mahina helped her mother in running her business. Mahina sews national dresses, and her mother sold them at the local market. After her marriage, Mahina did not work anywhere and was engaged with raising the children. Providing for two children requires more money and her husband was not able to cope. Four months ago, Mahina started her own business buying and selling women's clothing.

Mahina is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase women's clothing to expand working capital for her new business.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for increasing the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.ru: Сохибчону 18 лет. Он вместе с родителями живет в столице Таджикистана. Он студент 2 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана по специальности экономиста. Он является одним из успешных студентов и активно участвует в жизни университета. Сохибчон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но доход его родителей от продажи женской одежды не хватает для этого. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему окончить университет и стать будущим экономистом.
texts.en:
Sohibjon is 18 years old. He lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. He is a second-year student at the National University of Tajikistan with a specialization in economics. He is one of the most successful students and actively participates in university life.

Sohibjon must pay tuition, but his parents income from selling women's clothing is not sufficient for this. He is requesting a loan to pay for his education. This loan will help him to finish university and to become a future economist.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Несколько лет назад прекрасная женщина, которую зовут Шамигул, организовала свой бизнес, купле продажей женской обуви и одежды. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она в основном продает женскую одежду и обувь, так как спрос на женскую одежду больше чем на мужские или детские одежды на местном рынке. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своих детей. Ее муж охранник и получает маленькую зарплату, поэтому Шамигул является основной кормилицей семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 доллар для покупки женской одежды и обуви для новогоднего сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Several years ago, a lovely woman named Shamigul started her own business, buying and selling women's shoes and clothing. She has her own trading spot at the local market. She mainly sells women's clothing and shoes, since the demand for women's clothing is higher than that for men's or children's clothing at the local market.

She needs to update her inventory for the new season and to attract more customers, since she needs to earn more money to support her children. Her husband is a security guard and receives a small salary, therefore Shamigul is the main breadwinner for the family.

She is requesting a loan of US$2,000 to buy women's clothing and shoes for the holiday season.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Cinthia Mirely

texts.es:
La Joven  Cinthia   es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus hijos y nietos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de ropa nueva, desde hace mas de 3 años. 
Cinthia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de  blusas,  vestidos,  pantalones, braseares,  camisas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Cinthia  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una tienda más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos y nietos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Noviembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Young  Cinthia is a responsible, hard-working and honest person. She lives with her children and grandchildren in the south of Honduras. She has had a clothing sales business for over three years.
Cinthia needs this loan for the purchase of blouses, dresses, pants, bras, shirts, etc. She hopes that her sales will increase with this loan, because she will have more products to offer and will be able to better serve her clients.
Cinthia hopes to cover her necessities and improve her quality of life and that of her family. In a few years, she hopes that her business will continue to grow and become larger and well-known in the area. She hopes that her children and grandchildren become good people with better opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  November   2013

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, pants, bras, blouses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PROGRESISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina ella es soltera y tiene 73 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y lencería, la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos,medias entre otras ropas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Los progresistas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de peluches, negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to Los Progresistas Communal Bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The featured member is Sra. Segundina. She is unmarried, 73 years old and has two children. She has a business selling clothing and lingerie. She sells sweaters, pants, shirts and socks, among other clothes. She works fronm 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. taking her wares to different places, such as establishments or to her friends. This member has had this business for 8 years and it has done very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase sweaters, stockings, shirts, pants and jackets.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo had their pictures taken after the group photo because they requested permission to be absent due to work commitments.

The member whose face is blanked out no longer belongs to Los PLrogresistas Communal Bank. 

The other members engage in businesses selling teddy bears, sweets, groceries and a travel agency

Sra. Segundina is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, stockings, shirts, pants and jackets.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is thirty-three-year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has two children aged two and six. 

In 2003, Mohamed established his used clothing business. He began his business to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,532,800 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional used clothes. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to improve the business and expand to a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothes.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac de 30 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 6 años, 4 años y 2 años de edad. Para Isaac lo más importante es que sus hijos cuenten con una buena educación y condiciones habitacionales. Él se dedica a la venta de pan de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años. Este negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su casa. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea mejorarlas poco a poco. Desea encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra, además desea construir una pila para reguardar el agua potable que tanta falta le hace. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava y así proceder lo antes posible a la construcción de la pila y encementado del piso.
texts.en: Isaac, age 30, lives in his own home with his three children ages 2, 4, and 6. For Isaac, the most important thing is that his children have a good education and good living conditions. Isaac has sold bread on the street for six years. This business allows him to provide for his family. They have very humble living conditions, and he wants to improve them bit by bit. He wants to cement the floor of his home, since it is currently dirt, and he wants to build a basin to collect the drinking water that they need so much. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, and gravel. This way, he will be able to start construction of the basin and cementing the floor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a basin and cement the floor.

loans.name: Reyna Gladys

texts.es: Reyna de 59 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 10 años de edad quien a la fecha se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Hace un tiempo se separo de su esposo por lo ella es la responsable del hogar. Su exesposo le colabora un poco con la manutención de su hijo. Reyna se dedica a la venta de perfumería, dicha venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño sanitario. Con el monto del crédito comprará lámina, galvanizada, ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso.
texts.en:
59-year old Reyna lives in her own house with her 10-year old son who is currently studying at the local school. Some time ago Reyna separated from her husband so she is responsible for household expenses. Her ex-husband contributes a little to her son’s upbringing.

Reyna earns her living by selling perfumes in different areas of her town. She is seeking a loan from FUSAI to build a bathroom. She wants to buy wall board, zinc sheeting, bricks, cement, sand and rebar. Reyna is hopeful that she will get this loan as she doesn’t have enough money to pay for this expense.

loans.use: buy wall board, zinc sheeting, bricks, cement, sand and rebar to build a bathroom

loans.name: Yohana Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora  Yohanna  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con su esposo y sus 3 hijas  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 2 años. 
Doña Yohanna el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca,  arroz,  frijoles, pollo, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña  Yohanna  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus  hijos   para que  sean personas  de bien para la  sociedad. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Noviembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Sra. Yohanna is a responsible, hardworking, honest person who lives with her husband and three children in the south of Honduras. She has run a grocery store for more than two years. Now she needs a loan to buy butter, rice, beans, chicken, soft drinks etc. As a result she expects her income to rise as she will have more merchandise and better service to offer her customers.

Yohanna hopes to pay for daily necessities and gradually improve the standard of living of herself and her family. In the next few years she expects her business to continue to grow and become one of the biggest and most well-known in the area. She wants to continue supporting her children so they become upstanding members of society.

loans.use: buy butter, rice, beans, chicken, soft drinks etc for her grocery store

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has three children aged eight, fourteen and eighteen. In 1998, Rugiatu established her plastic products business. She started the business after dropping out of school to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,993,390 every month from this business. 

Rugiatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy plastic shoes and chairs. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise more profit. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for plastic shoes and chairs

loans.name: Beatrice R.

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Beatrice. She is married and has three children who are 5, 12, and 21 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 2011, Beatrice established her business, which sells provisions, drinks, confectionaries, jeans and blouses. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and to help her husband with running the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are of all genders and ages. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 707,225 every month from this business. 

Beatrice would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Beatrice requires a loan in order to buy additional drinks and confectionaries. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock of her store and raise more profit. In the future, Beatrice plans to expand the business to sell imported rice. She started business hawking, but now she owns a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and confectionaries

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru:
Каримджон  живет в селе неподалеку от города Канибадама.  Ему  57 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Каримджон работает в насосной станции вагоноремонтного завода.  Одной зарплаты для содержания семьи не хватает и для того , чтобы содержать семью, оплачивать обучение детей помогать престарелым родителям  ему необходимо дополнительно заниматься  скотоводством.  А также дополнительным источником его дохода является садоводство.   Его жена и двое сыновей уехали на заработки для того , чтобы поддерживать благосостояние  растущей семьи и  позаботиться о будущем.
Каримчон в начале этого года  начал строить дом но не смог достроить его,так как у него на тот момент не хватала денежных средств. Теперь до приезда сыновей он хочет достроить дом и для этого он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.
На полученный кредит Каримчон хочет купить строительные материалы и осуществить свои планы. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Karimjon lives in a village not far from the town of Kanibadama. He is 57 years old. He is married and has three children. Karimjon works in a filling station wagon repair factory. One salary to support a family is not enough, and therefore to support the family, to pay for the children's education, and to help his elderly parents it is necessary for him also to raise livestock. And an additional source of income comes from gardening. His wife and two sons went abroad in order to support the well-being of a growing family and to care for the future.

Earlier this year, Karimjon began to build a home but was not able to finish it since he does not have at the moment enough monetary resources. Now before the arrival of his sons, he wants to build a home and for this he applied to Arvand for a loan.

With the loan received, Karimjon wants to buy construction materials and to implement his plans. He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: La Guardiania Group

texts.en:
The eight women of this group are from San Antonio Suchitepéquez, near the city of Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  Most of their businesses are in food, medicine or catalog sales.  They are all eager to start this nine-month cycle with Namaste, as they are looking forward to learning how to manage their businesses and also to having a business advisor help them write a business plan and implement it.

Juana (fourth from left) is 44 years old and single with four children.  She never had the opportunity to go to school as her family was too poor.  Two of her children are in school and two are already working.  She has had much adversity in her life including a major illness in recent years.  Despite this, she never lost hope and managed to pay off her debts and get cured from her illness with the help of natural medicine.  

Her business is selling Omnilife products as she is convinced of their success through her experience curing her own illness.  She also sells chickens, ducks and turkeys.  She will be spending her loan money on more Omnilife products to meet the demand of her clients.  Her profits at the beginning of the loan cycle are about 1,965 Guatemalan Quetzales (around $248 USD), and she is aiming for a 15% increase in profits to earn at least 2,259 Guatemalan Quetzales ($286 USD).  Her dream is to improve life for herself and her children, and especially to have a better house as her current home is made of simple materials and during the rainy season water comes in.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicine to help her clients.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng is 21 years old. He is married and resides with his father in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has a two year-old child. To earn a living, Sokheng works in garment factory. He earns about $5 daily. His wife sells pure drinking water, incense sticks and flowers. She makes an income of $3 per day. 

In addition, this couple is involved in cultivating rice. To improve their farming process, Sokheng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to use for plowing the farmland. This purchase will help reduce their farming expense. In the future, he would like to take another loan from KREDIT to fix their house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for plowing her farmland

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is married with an only child; he operates a motor transportation business in their community to earn a living. 

Aside from being a farmer, he has been providing transportation services for four years, earning well for the family. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs of motor maintenance. 

He is hopeful to see his family have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали 32 года. Он проживает в районе Дж.Руми и занимается там растениеводством. Шерали сейчас собирается начать еще один бизнес. Его интересует овцеводство, так как это прибыльный бизнес и не требует тяжелого труда. Шерали уже запасся 200 вязком кукурузной травы, 100 вязком люцерны, к тому же у него при дворе дома имеется сарай, который он будет использовать для содержания скота. То есть он уже создал все условия для бизнеса, осталось лишь закупить сам скот. Для этой цели Шерали запрашивает кредит. Он собирается купить двух овец и откармливать их в течение 30-35 дней, а после продать с наценкой на том же скотном рынке, где он приобретет их. Шерали дальновидный человек. Как только он добьется успеха в новом бизнесе, он увеличит поголовье скота и расширит бизнес.
texts.en:
Sherali is 32 years old. He resides in the J.Rumy region and is involved there in growing crops. Sherali now intends to start another business. He is interested in sheepherding, since this is a lucrative business and does not require heavy work.

Sherali has already stocked 200 bundles of corn grass, 100 bundles of alfalfa, and beside his home in the courtyard he has a barn that he will use to care for the livestock. That is, he already has created all the conditions for the business, and it remains only to buy himself some livestock.

With this aim, Sherali is requesting a loan. He intends to buy two sheep and to fatten them over the course of 30-35 days, and after to sell at a premium at the same livestock market where he acquires them. Sherali is a farsighted person. Once he succeeds in the new business, her will increase the livestock count and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy two sheep to start a business

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.es:
Orlanda, a sus 59 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que sacó adelante con gran esfuerzo, trabajando largas jornadas para conseguir el sustento diario y educar a sus hijos.
Desde que era joven aprendió el oficio de la confección, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre y, gracias a ello, hoy en día se gana la vida trabajando en su pequeño taller donde ofrece el servicio de arreglo de prendas, confección de artículos para el hogar como sábanas, acolchados, cojines, manteles, cortinas, entre otros y adicionalmente elabora algunos lotes pequeños de blusas que un tercero le solicita; de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales y del hogar.
Con el ánimo de continuar con su labor, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá trabajar de manera más holgada y podrá cumplir con los pedidos y encargos a sus clientes, dando paso a un incremento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Orlanda manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir soñando, y por ello sigue luchando para llegar a cumplir el deseo de tener un taller mucho más grande y bien estructurado, con máquinas industriales y que le permita generar empleo y mejorar la rentabilidad, para tener la capacidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y disfrutar una vejez sin ninguna preocupación monetaria.
texts.en:
Orlanda is a 59 year old, single mother of three who works hard to get her children ahead in life.  When she was young, she learned the tailoring trade thanks to her mother.  Today, she earns a living working in a small workshop where she provides garment mending services, and tailors sheets, quilts, pillows, tablecloths, curtains, and other household items.  In addition, she makes small lots of blouses ordered by a third party.  In this way, she generates enough money to pay for personal and household expenses.

With the intention of continuing her work, she is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale fabric, thread, buttons, and other basic materials.  This will allow her to work more comfortably and enable her to fulfill her customers’ orders and requests, leading to an increase in sales and, therefore, income she receives for her work. 

Orlanda says that her age won’t stop her from continuing to dream, and for this reason, she continues striving to fulfill her desire to have a much larger workshop that is well structured, with industrial sewing machines.  This will allow her to generate jobs, improve profitability, and have the ability to improve her living conditions and enjoy old age without worrying about money.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric, thread, buttons, and other basic materials.

loans.name: Julio  Cesar

texts.es: Julio cesar es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, soltero. De 26 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos variados de uso personal. Inicio su negocio hace varios años con dinero prestado y así logro salir adelante. Su meta próxima es vender sus productos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Reloj, Mosquiteros, carteras, fajas, Hamacas entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar la venta de sus productos y ofrecer una mayor variedad así como aumentar sus ganancias y así mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Su plan futuro es obtener más créditos para que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a native of the city of Boaco. He is single and 26 years old. He is a merchant and sells a variety of personal use items. He started his business several years ago with borrowed money and became successful. His next goal is to sell his products in different areas of the city. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase watches, mosquito nets, handbags, belts and hammocks, among other items. He estimates that the loan will be a big help and lead to an increase in sales because he will provide a larger and more varied inventory. Thus he will increase his profits and be able to improve the infrastructure of his house. His future plan is to obtain more loans so that his business can continue to grow every day.

loans.use: to purchase watches, mosquito nets, handbags, belts and hammocks among other items.

loans.name: Mónica Esther

texts.es: Mónica de 46 años de edad, es madre de un niño de 4 años,  con el que habita al sur de la ciudad. Allí en su domicilio, desde hace 13 años, tiene su taller de confecciones en las líneas femenina, masculina e infantil, pues ella desde muy niña, a la edad de 14 años empezó a trabajar en una confección, en las tareas de oficios varios y allí aprendió la actividad, dirigida por la propietaria del negocio, quien la veía inspirada y con mucho potencial para el oficio der la costura. Poco a poco aprendió de ella y posteriormente, se capacitó durante 3 años en una academia, para lograr un aprendizaje con mayor estándar, conociendo las técnicas de la confección, hasta que debió trabajar desde su casa, para cuidar a su padre enfermo, con lo esta situación se independizó y empezó su propia aventura emprendedora; hoy elabora blusas, pantalones, bermudas, trabajando en su propia casa, lugar donde llegan a buscarla sus clientes, para obtener el servicio. Cada día la exigencia para competir en el mercado de la confección, es mayor y aunque Mónica aplica muy bien las diversas técnicas de las operaciones de costura, no ha logrado confeccionarle a terceros, que es la modalidad más productiva de la actualidad, porque su infraestructura no lo permite. Esta es la razón, por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana, una fileteadora industrial y una recubridora, para responder a nuevas alternativas que el mercado le ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Monica is 46 years old and the mother of a four-year-old child. She lives with her son in the south of the city. She has had a sewing workshop in her home for 13 years, where she sews women's, men's and children's clothing. She was very young, 14 years old, when she began to work at a workshop, completing a variety of different tasks. This is where she learned this activity, guided by the owner of the business, who saw that Monica was inspired and had a lot of potential as a seamstress. Little by little, Monica learned from her. After that, Monica trained for three years at an academy to develop better skills. She learned sewing techniques until she had to begin to work from home in order to care for her ill father.

Given this situation, she became independent and began her own entrepreneurial adventure. Today she makes blouses, pants, and bermuda shorts, all from her own home. That's where her customers come to buy things and use her sewing services.

Every day it takes more and more in order to compete in the sewing business, and although Monica has mastered the diverse techniques involved sewing, she hasn't managed to break into the wholesale market because of a lack of infrastructure. Being a wholesale provider is currently the most profitable way of making a living in this field. This is the reason why Monica is currently requesting a Kiva loan. This will be her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase a sewing machine, an industrial serger, and a cover-stitch machine. This will let her respond to the new alternatives that the market now offers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an industrial serger and a cover-stitch machine.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie works hard to support her family. Analie is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Analie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janner Stiven

texts.es:
Janner  stiven nació el 20 de junio, se graduó como bachiller académico con profundización en educación en la escuela normal superior  maría auxiliadora de Guadalupe Santander.
Llego recientemente a Bogotá con la ambición de seguir en su formación académica, después de observar los programas y técnicas diferentes de los centros educativos opto por vincularse a la institución de educación superior las mercedes como técnico profesional en arte gráfico y publicitario.
La gran vocación de servicio que ha adquirido, porque el padre fue un servidor público de la policía nacional, lo ambiciona a prepararse de manera entusiasta para ser un líder y trabajar por las personas más desprotegidas de Colombia e intentar ser un gran oficial de policía nacional, cuando termine la carrera técnica profesional en este centro educativo.
Como él no tiene la capacidad económica suficiente para lograr este objetivo, cuenta con el apoyo que kiva le pueda hacer para cumplir el primero de los logros que es terminar este técnico,  el propósito a demás de estudiar con gran empeño, es conseguir un trabajo en el tiempo disponible para ayudar con el compromiso de formación, para el crecimiento personal e integral y a si también ayudar a la familia, especialmente a los padres.
texts.en:
Janner Stiven was born on June the 20th. He graduated from the teaching school María Auxiliadora de Guadalupe Santander.  He recently arrived to Bogotá with the ambition of continuing his studies and after observing the different programs and techniques in the educational centers, he decided to attend to the institution of higher education Las Mercedes to study graphic art and advertising. 

The fact that his father was a police officer gave him a great dedication to the service, and such dedication inspires him to become an enthusiastic leader and to work for the most unprotected people in Colombia. He also wishes to become a great police officer once he finishes his professional studies in his current educational institution.

Because he doesn’t have the financial capacity to obtain such goals, he relies on Kiva’s support to fulfill the first of his goals, which is to finish his current studies. Another objective that he has besides studying with great determination is to get a job during his free time so he can support his commitment towards formation, increase his personal growth and support his family, especially his parents.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Mausauri

texts.es: Mausauri  continua con la venta de útiles de escritorio por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Mausauri continues to sell stationary items and he needs a loan to buy merchandise such as notebooks, mechanical pencils, paper, and other things.  He is grateful to those who form part of this dream, values the loan, and is committed to making his monthly payments responsibly.  He is a member of the “San Martincito” communal bank of the Arariwa association in Paucartambo.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Bibimuslima

texts.ru: Бибимуслима молодая замужняя женщина, ей 21 год. Она живет в селе города Вахдат. Бибимуслима талантливая и способная. Она умеет шить женские национальные платья разных фасонов. У нее есть старая швейная машинка, с помощью которой она шьет себе эти платья. Сейчас она решила начать швейное дело и таким образом зарабатывать. Для покупки компьютерной швейной машинки и тканей для шитья она просит кредит, так как ее собственного сбережения не хватает. Бибимуслима будет заниматься этим делом у себя дома. Ей будут помогать ее сноха и тетя мужа. Она с надеждой ждет поддержки, ведь начав этот бизнес, у нее появится источник дохода.
texts.en:
Bibimuslima is a young, married woman, age 21. She lives in a village near the city of Vahdat. Bibimuslima is talented and capable. She knows how to sew women's national dresses of various fashions. She has an old sewing machine, with the help of which she sews herself these dresses.

Now, she has decided to start a sewing business and in this way to earn a living. To buy a computerized sewing machine and fabrics for sewing, she is requesting a loan, since her own savings are not enough. Bibimuslima will engage in this work at her home. She will be assisted by her daughter-in-law and her husband's aunt. She waits with hope for the support, since starting this business will bring a source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine and fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Dekeisha

texts.en:
Trinidad and Tobago resident Dekeisha has a job that most would not find too creative: She has been a Senior Legal Assistant in New York City for almost ten years. However, she has always had a creative and unusual sense of style, and when she woke up one day and realized that it was time to start working towards her dream of becoming her own boss, she relied on her knack for creative design.

In 2012, Dekeisha established OseiLei, a kitchenware and home goods company that features products that have a more creative, unique, and unconventional design than traditional cookware items. 
 
“I have eccentric taste, and I felt that many people, including myself, were lacking cool, never-seen-before, and affordable household gadgets. Therefore, I decided it was time to create something durable, affordable, and chic for consumers to use in their kitchens.”

For Dekeisha, who is married and has a daughter, her highest priority is to have a happy and healthy family, and having a profitable, successful business is one way to ensure that. With this loan, Dekeisha will build prototypes for her kitchenware designs. With these prototypes, she will be able to showcase her creations at tradeshows and attract investors and market her products for future manufacturing. 

Dekeisha hopes that her story will inspire others to live their dreams by showing them that with hard work and determination, anything is possible. 

Help her support her family and move closer to her dream.

loans.use: to build a prototype for her kitchenware designs.

loans.name: Genoveva Gregoria

texts.es:
Genoveva es una madre muy amorosa y luchadora, sobre todo porque ha sacado adelante sola a su hijo de 16 años, al cual quiere muchísimo. Tal es así que Genoveva luego de mucho ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida y venta de refrescos desde hace 4 años; Genoveva cree que le va bien porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazón.

Genoveva esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracia a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un toldo y materiales como utensilios de cocina, mesas, entre otros para su negocio; así ella podrá brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y seguir creciendo y mejorando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y poder tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a loving and hardworking mother who has gotten her 16 year old son ahead on her own.  She loves him very much.  Genoveva started her food and drinks business after much savings four years ago.  Genoveva believes that things are going well for her because she is very friendly and because of her good seasoning. 

Genoveva is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy supplies such as kitchen utensils, tables, and other things for her business.  This way she will be able to provide more comfort to her customers and continue to grow and improve to make her dream a reality, “Provide a profession for her children and be able to have a great restaurant.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 48 years old.  She has a live-in partner and seven children, three of whom attend school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Angelina has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.  Angelina has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda helps her husband in running their own rice farm for a living. She has been doing this for twenty years, and she earns well for the family needs. She sells a portion of their farm produce in the market to earn money for the school needs of her children. Rhoda borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer in order to improve the farm. She hopes to have a greener farm, and to be able to gain more returns in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат женщина среднего возраста. Родилась и выросла в городе Исфаре. Вышла замуж в юном возрасте. Но они с мужем жили не долго так как  не сошлись с характерами и после рождения ребенка они решили разойтись. Она устала от бесконечных ссор. Мухаббат ушла от него, и начала самостоятельную жизнь. По началу ей было очень трудно, с малышом на руке. Но после она нашла себе работу. Сейчас она занимается купле продажей сухофруктов, в местных рынках. А по ночам шьет национальные платья.
После того как купила новую квартиру,Мухаббат   отремонтировала ее, и теперь к наступлению зимы  она хочет  установить пластиковые окна и двери. Мухаббат решила  обратиться  в организацию Арванд за материальной помощью,так как ей не хватает денежных средств. На полученный кредит Мухаббат хочет купить окна и двери и установить у себя дома.  Она заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a woman of middle age. She was born and raised in the town of Isfara. She got married at an early age. But she and her husband did not live together for long since their characters did not agree and after the birth of their child they decided to separate. She was tired of the endless quarrels. Muhabbat left him, and began life on her own. At the beginning, it was very hard for her with a little one to care for. But later she found herself work. Now, she buys and sells dried fruits in the local markets. And at night she sews national dresses.

After she bought a new apartment, Muhabbat renovated it and now with the approaching winter she wants to put up plastic doors and windows. Muhabbat decided to turn to the organization Arvand for material support, since she did not have sufficient funds. With the loan received, Muhabbat wants to buy windows and doors and to install them in her home. She thanks Arvand in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and doors

loans.name: Claveles L Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES L” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de carnicería, compra y venta de ganado ovino, panadería, venta de material escolar, venta de comida, venta de material escolar.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sofía es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres que tenían el mismo negocio como negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado ovino) que adquirirá de las ferias comunales del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Community Association group "CLAVELES L" will start their first loan cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focus Center. The group consists of eight members and is headed by a board of which Sofia is the President. The businesses that the members of the community association undertake are varied including a butcher shop, buying and selling sheep, a bakery, food sales, and two sell school supplies. 
The loan they are taking out will bring benefits to the small microentreprises in which Sofia is an integral part. This is her first time with Pro Mujer, acting on an invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to visit her home. Today she has a business buying and selling sheep. She has had this business for several years and she learned this business from her parents who had the same business as a family enterprise. 
The loan will now bring a capital increase (for the purchase of sheep) which she will acquire at the community markets in the department of La Paz and later sell in the marketplace. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married with four children. 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sofia responds that she likes the loans and the health services and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores de 62 años de edad, Soltera con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caractereriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico se vio obligada a  trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de nacatamal comida típica de la región, a base de carne de cerdos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus nacatamales en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra materia prima como es la carne de cerdo, maíz, arroz, papas, hojas para envolver el nacatamal. Dolores agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno. en la foto podemos observa a Dolores con la hoja del nacatamal
texts.en:
Dolores is 62 years old, single, with four grown children. She is originally from Malpaisillo, located in the western area of the country. She is described as being hardworking, responsible, with the desire to be successful. In her free time she enjoys the company of her children. Sadly because of limited resources she has had to work from an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to succeed, she has been selling nacatamal (corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf), a typical dish of the region made with pork. She works 10 hours a day in her business, offering her nacatamales from her home. The loan will be used to buy ingredients such as pork, corn, rice, potatoes, and leaves to wrap the nacatamales. Dolores is grateful for the Kiva investors who provide to people of few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to be able to work with dignity. In the photo we see Dolores with a nacatamal leaf.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make nacatamal such as pork, corn, rice, potatoes, and leaves to wrap the nacatamal.

loans.name: Juan Xxi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUAN XXI” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y queso, salón de peinado, macramé de mantas, venta de comida, costura de chamarras, fábrica de colchones, bordado de mantas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yola es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar a una amiga que negociaba con el mismo producto, posteriormente con un préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer amplio su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y telas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la frontera Bolivia - Perú. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “JUAN XXI”  communal bank is starting their eight cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is composed of eight members led by a board of directors with Yola as the president. The members of the group have a variety of businesses amongst them: the sale of potatoes and cheese, a beauty salon, macrame blankets, sale of meals, sewing jackets, making mattresses, embroidery of blankets and selling vegetables.

The loan will help all of these micro-entrepreneurs including Yola. She states that she joined pro Mujer eight cycles ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution

Yola has a business of weaving and selling blankets. She tells us that she learned about this business watching a friend who negotiated this same product. Later with a loan from Pro Mujer she was able to expand her business. 

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her capital, buying wool and fabric which she will buy in the markets of the city of El Alto. She will make them and then sell them in the markets on the Bolivia- Peru border. This work allows her to generate the resources she needs to maintain her family. She lives in a common-law relationship. Asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she enjoyed the loans, health and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool and fabric.

loans.name: Apu Marhuay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU MARHUAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina ella es casada y tiene 41 años y tiene 4 hijos La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de construccion, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de chicha.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members in the community bank "APU MARHUAY." This group is located in the district of Coya, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the Cusco department. 


The featured partner is Luz Marina. She is married and is 41-years-old. She has 4 children. She has a business of breeding and selling animals. She breeds guinea pigs, making them grow and fatten to be sold in different markets. Through this business, Luz Marina supports her children.

 Her dream is to have a place where should can sell her guinea pigs. She is requesting a loan to buy food for the guinea pigs and to purchase more guinea pigs.


The other partners in this group are in the business of selling animals, have a construction business, run a grocery store, and sell chicha. 

Luz Marina is grateful for those who are part of this dream and agrees to comply with the payments of her loan by their deadlines.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and their feed.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 59 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, milk, cereals, soft drinks, sanitary napkins and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Angelita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items including canned goods, milk, cereals, soft drinks, sanitary napkins and other groceries. 

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, milk, cereals, soft drinks, sanitary napkins and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ayn

texts.en:
Ayn is 37 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Ayn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items like toothpaste, detergent, soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo and soy sauce to sell.

Prior to this loan, Ayn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from selling electronic mobile load (prepaid cell phone cards).

Ayn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like toothpaste, detergent, soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo and soy sauce to sell.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Bonifacia works hard to support her family.  She has a buy and sell rice-grains business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from pig fattening. Bonifacia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice-grains business.

Bonifacia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Basilia requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, and zippers for her business. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Basilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, and zippers for her business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who owns a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, and eggs for her food vending business. Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from rice farming.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, and eggs.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga the beneficiary is 34 years old and her husband Lorenzo is 40 years old. They have 3 children: Gaspar, the oldest is 14 years old, 2 years younger is María and the youngest one is Lorenzo Jr. of 10 years old, they live in a small community in southern Mexico that has 1262 inhabitants. 

They now live in a 2 rooms wood house, without doors, windows or bathroom. The family hopes to get a loan beneficiary to build their home since their children have grown and they need more space. They also wish to have a clean bathroom.
Dominga’s family does not have much land to work. Sometimes they rent the land but the costs are very expensive and the harvest barely pays the rent. They say they have lots of problems with field rats that eat the maize they have sown and this is the only food they have for sure for them and their children. 

Dominga likes to sew and she has a sewing machine with it she provides incomes to the family. Lorenzo is farmer, he also cleans maize fields, sows coffee, and does whatever he can to get money depending the season. The older children sometimes can´t go to school because they need to work on the field or carrying firewood and water, the little ones also go to school when Dominga and Lorenzo don´t need them in their house; they love to take care of the hens and chickens. They wish in the future their children to go to school in the municipality school so they can have better jobs and don´t suffer what their parents did.

They believe in Habitat as they have seen other families in their community benefit. Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe and affordable place to live. Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system where the families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing and financial education, this aiming to develop and strength their capacities. In México, works since 1989 and today more than 7,000 families have been served just on the last 3 years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to buy a house

loans.name: Esly

texts.es: Esly, tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. La actividad que realiza es la fabricación de muebles de madera como puertas, mesas, sillas, ventanas y otros muebles. Este taller lo tiene en su casa desde hace 10 años, y elabora los muebles mediante pedidos. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo siendo este el tercer ciclo y es por 30,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar madera para la elaboración de puertas, ventanas, juegos de comedor etc. con el propósito de brindar mejor servicio de entrega de sus pedidos. Su meta es seguir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en: Esly is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife in the city of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  He makes wooden furniture such as doors, tables, chairs, windows, and other things.  He has had his workshop at his home for 10 years and makes furniture to order.  He is asking for another loan, being in his third cycle, for 30,000 Lempiras, with which he will buy lumber to make doors, windows, dining room sets, etc. so he can provide better delivery on his orders.  His goal is to continue growing as a small businessman.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: José Hernei

texts.es:
José es un campesino que durante toda su vida productiva trabajó como administrador de una finca ubicada en el municipio donde residía, pero debido a que su familia vivía en la ciudad,  hace 8 años decidió radicarse allí junto a su esposa y su hijo e inició su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su vivienda, donde trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm y cuenta con la ventaja de que su negocio ya está posicionado en el sector y es reconocido por los habitantes.
Con el ánimo de dar crecimiento a su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, granos, licor, cerveza, gaseosas, galletería, mecato, entre otros), así podrá satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de fin de año, mejorando las ventas, pues estará en la capacidad de ofrecer más variedad de artículos, dando como resultado un mejoramiento notable en los ingresos que obtiene.
José, con su empuje, dedicación y arduo trabajo quiere seguir fortaleciendo su negocio para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de convertirlo en un minimercado en el que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesiten y así aumentar el nivel de ventas y el margen de utilidades para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a farm worker who has worked all his adult life as a manager on a farm located in his home town, but due to his family he has lived in the city with his wife and son.  He started his own business, a grocery store, in his home, where he works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm and has the advantage that his business is located in a well-known area.

With a desire to grow his business, he is asking for a loan to buy stock in quantity (dairy, grains, liquor, beer, soft drinks, cookies, pastries, and other things), in this way he will be able to satisfy the end of year demand, improving his sales, and be able to offer a greater variety of items.  This will improve his income.

Jose, with his push, dedication, and arduous work wants to continue strengthening his business so that in the future he will be able to convert it into a minimart where his customers will find everything they need, he will increase his sales and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 54 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, and diapers.

Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elcidia Ericelda

texts.es: Elcidia de 45 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 15 años, 9 años y 6 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Para ella lo más importante es que sus hijos cuenten con una buena educación y con mejores condiciones habitacionales a las que ella ha tenido. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una galera para proteger el poso de agua ya que no cuenta con agua potable. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Elcidia is 45 years old, a single mother, and lives in her own home with her three children ages 15, 9, and 6, all of whom study in the public school in their community. For her the most important thing is that her children receive a good education and have better living conditions than she has had. She seeks a loan with FUSAI to build a well cover to protect the water well as right now she doesn't have drinkable water. With the loan she will buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build a well cover.

loans.name: Nol

texts.en:
Nol is 53 years old. She is married and lives with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and raising livestock for more than 10 years. She earns approximately $1 per day. 

Nol's husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $7 per day. Four of their children are employed; they earn about $20 total per day. 

To improve her husband's business, Nol is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase construction tools. This loan will help him obtain enough tools to use for larger construction projects. 

In the future, Nol would like to expand the business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools to use for business.

loans.name: Madrina

texts.en:
Madrin is a twenty-four-year old hardworking woman living in Hoima, Uganda. She owns a stall of fresh foods in town. She has been in this business since 2000 and has managed to look after her aging mother, only to be challenged by the degree at which the fresh foods go bad.  

She wishes to buy a refrigerator or  a deep freezer to reduce on the rate at which her goods go bad. She wishes to expand her business into new markets.

Madrin is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, beans, and Royco products to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: purchase sugar, beans, Royco products, and general merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ediltrudes is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ediltrudes has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a 18000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more materials like shells, wire, and nylon thread for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Ediltrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like shells, wire, and nylon thread for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more snack foods, candies, noodles, vinegar, cooking oil, shampoo, and other items to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, noodles, vinegar, cooking oil, and shampoo.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, candies, noodles, vinegar, cooking oil, shampoo, and other items to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and married with three children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail of gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail of gasoline for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es una señora de 45 años de edad, quien tiene  10 hijos 6 hombres y 4 mujeres  y tiene una relación de unión libre con su pareja,  actualmente viven en Sololá.
Ella y su pareja se dedican  a la agricultura y a la venta de verduras  en el mercado local de su comunidad. Comenta que esta labor la aprendió junto a sus abuelos cuando era pequeña y es por ello que ahora cuentan con 30 años de experiencia en esta actividad,  que ha sido bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Por lo que ahora ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semillas de zanahoria y productos agrícolas que servirán para su cultivo.
 Sus sueños siguen siendo,  remodelar su vivienda y adquirir más terrenos para poder cultivar y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is a 45 years old woman who has 10 children, 6 boys and 4 girls. She is in a common-law relationship and lives in Sololá. She and her partner are farmers and sell vegetables in the local market in her community. She said that she learned this work from her grandparents when she was small, so she has 30 years of experience in the field. She has been fairly productive in generating income and profits that help contribute to the family finances. 

So Raquel is requesting a loan of 4,000 GTQ to buy carrot seeds and agricultural products for her crops. Her dreams remain to renovate her home and buy more land to cultivate, thus improving the quality of life of the family.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and agricultural products.

loans.name: Karla Ivania

texts.es: Karla es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica al negocio de molino., el cual es buen negocio que le ha permitido salir a delante con sus hijos. Esta agradecida con kiva y Micrédito ya que ha podido garantizar un buen servicio a sus clientes y a tener las mejores condiciones en su local. Solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de sus molinos y comprar discos como repuestos, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y brindar un servicio seguro.
texts.en: Karla is originally from Estelí city. She has a grinding mill business, which is a good business that has enabled her to support her children. She is grateful to kiva and Micrédtiro as she has been able to guarantee good service to her customers and to have the best conditions in her area. She seeks a loan to maintain her grinders and buy replacement disks, with the goal of providing better service to her customers. She believes the loan will help her be able to meet her customer's demands and provide safe and steady service.

loans.use: to maintain her grinders and buy replacement disks.

loans.name: Ingrid Claribel

texts.es: Ingrid de 41 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 14 años y 10 años de edad, quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Ingrid se dedica a la venta de tamales (preparación alimenticia típica, elaborada a base de masa de maíz). Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y desea encementarlo. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Ingrid, 41, is a single mother. She lives in her own home along with her children, ages 14 and 10, who are in school. Ingrid works selling tamales (prepared in the typical fashion from corn dough). In order to improve her living conditions, she is asking for this loan from Fusai to improve the floor. Currently, it's made of earth, and she wants to cover it in concrete. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to create a concrete floor for her home.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married with two children and provides for his family from his earnings from the farm. He has been growing and harvesting coconuts and bananas for more than five years, earning well for the family. 

He wants to improve the farm but his income cannot afford it without his GDMPC micro credit loan that he used for the banana farm weeding maintenance costs. He is hopeful to earn more income for he had invested financially and more effort in order to provide his family a better living for their future.

loans.use: for the banana farm weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Genalyn has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.  Genalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gera

texts.en:
Gera is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Gera earns more income from vegetable vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Gera has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 46, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Claudio, a vendor, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Susan operates a vending business. What she basically does is buy different toy products from wholesalers, and then she repacks them and sells them with a little profit. Her products are assorted toys, home supplies, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also sells different delicacies for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of different toys and other products needed in her business.

Susan dreams to be more successful in business and hops that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of different toys and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela, de 29 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos a quienes cría en su casa propia. El trabajo de Pamela consiste en la venta de golosinas y postres elaborados por sus propias manos. Vende todo tipo de galletas, caramelos, dulces, queques, bizcochos, tortas y bebidas refrescantes. Pamela tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de mayor concurrencia de la ciudad, ella atiende desde las 08 de la mañana hasta las 07 de la noche, cualquier persona que llega a su establecimiento termina satisfecho y con ganas de volver pronto porque sus postres son exquisitos, gracias a los 11 años que lleva en esta actividad ha podido acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que caracterizan a sus postres. Trabaja siempre sola, ya que su labor no requiere de mucho esfuerzo en la atención, sin embargo en la preparación de los dulces a veces es necesario contar con la ayuda de su pareja. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará galletas, caramelos, cereales, frutas, maíz morado, gelatina, flan, harina, leche, mantequilla, huevos y todo lo necesario para continuar preparando los postres que pone a la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Pamela is 29 years old and married. She has two children whom she is raising in her own home. 

Pamela sells treats and desserts that she makes by hand. She sells all kinds of cookies, candies, and sweets, as well as cakes, sponge cakes, and soft drinks.

She has a little stall in the busiest market in the city, where she works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. Anyone who goes to her establishment walks away satisfied and wanting to return soon, because her desserts are delicious.  Thanks to the 11 years that she has devoted to this occupation, she has been able to enhance the taste and perfect flavor that characterize her desserts.

She always works alone, as paying attention to her work is not an effort for her, but sometimes she needs her husband’s help with the preparation of the sweets. 

In this opportunity she is seeking a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, and she thanks all the people who are giving her the opportunity to receive the financing that she needs in order to continue working. For her part, she promises to be punctual with her payments.

With the amount that she has requested, she will purchase cookies, candies, cereals, fruit, purple corn, gelatin, flan, flour, milk, butter, eggs, and everything that is necessary to continue making the desserts that she sells in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, candies, eggs, and other similar items.

loans.name: José Elenilson

texts.es:
José,  estudio hasta  noveno  grado de nivel académico,  está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.
