José trabaja como vendedor de hamacas, jugueteras y equipos de sonido cuando le encargan y varios electrodomésticos  para el hogar desde hace 3 años ; este trabajo lo aprendió de un cuñado que antes vendía estos productos y viendo la posibilidad de él de seguir el negocio y sabiendo que esto le generaba ingresos decidió seguirlo y ponerlo en práctica . El trabajo le queda a una distancia de 2 horas, sale a vender por los cantones aledaños , ya invirtió en la primera ocasión con la ayuda de los préstamos y ve que es mejor para poder  ir comprando más  y ayudando le a invertir mejor su dinero en este trabajo,  solamente él sale a vender y la esposa se queda en casa por si buscan cualquier cosita, ella la vende ahí. José sale de su casa a las 7 de la mañana y llega a las 4 de la tarde o cuando le va bien y vende todo llega luego a la casa

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para  comprar 7 hamacas que le han encargado,  una juguetera y una cama que los vecinos se lo han encargado y es así como el invierte el dinero y así obtiene ganancias él también les deja los electrodoméstico al crédito y luego tiene día que pasa recogiendo el dinero por las casas. Las ganancias serán invertidas en más cosas que necesiten, esto mejorara mucho su vida.
texts.en:
José studied until ninth grade in school.  He is in a common-law relationship and his wife performs the household chores.  For three years, José has worked as a salesman of hammocks, toys, sound equipment on order, and various home appliances.  He learned this business from a brother-in-law that used to sell these products. He looked at the possibility of carrying on the business and he knew that it was generating income, so he decided to pursue the idea and put it into practice.  The job is two hours away and he goes out selling in the neighboring cantons.  He made his first investment with the help of the loans and sees that it is better to be able to buy more and it helps to better invest his money in the business.  He goes out on his own to sell, and his wife stays home and if someone is looking for a small thing, she sells it there.  José leaves home at 7:00 in the morning and gets home at 4:00 in the afternoon. When business goes well, he sells everything and then comes home.

He is requesting the loan to purchase seven hammocks that were ordered, a toy, and a bed that the neighbors had ordered.  This is how he will invest the money, and thus earn profits.  He also leaves home appliances on credit and then, on a designated day, he stops by homes collecting the money.  The profits will be invested in more things that he needs, and this will greatly improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase seven hammocks that were ordered, a toy, and a bed that the neighbors had ordered

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita has owned and operated a general store for more than six years, earning well enough to be able to provide for her family's needs. From her returns, Rita was able to repay her previous loans successfully. She used these loans to improve her store. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. Rita wants to improve her business to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna helps her husband growing coconuts and bananas to sell.  She has been doing this for more than seven years and earning well.  She was also able to repay her previous loan successfully.  Johna used her previous loan to obtain fertilizer.  Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit for  weeding maintenance costs of her grain field. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay weeding maintenance costs of her grain field.

loans.name: Jenly

texts.en:
Jenly is 20 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.  Jenly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

She has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.  Jenly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Levy works hard to support her family.  She has a rice vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal vending. Levy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice vending business.

Levy has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Eva Lastenia

texts.es:
Doña Eva es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, el cual es la venta de ropa, sandalias, ropa de varón, elaboración de piñatas, todo esto en su local, desde hace 7 años.
Doña Eva  tiene su negocio en la calle en una  zona comercial de su comunidad. Sus principales clientes, vecinos y personas que viajan de diferentes  comunidades, en la venta de su producto cuentan con el apoyo de su hija, ya que se levantan muy temprano a atenderlo.
Doña Eva  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas,  vestidos, pantalones, faldas, etc. para surtir su negocio y comprar mercadería en esta temporada navideña, para cubrir con la demanda de sus clientes  y también para la compra de producto para elaboración de piñatas,  sueña con ampliar el local y poder vender achinería. 



Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Eva is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business of making piñatas and selling clothes, sandals, and men’s clothing. She has been doing this for seven years.

Eva’s business is in one of the streets in a commercial area of her community. Her main customers are neighbours and people travelling from different communities. She relies on the support of her daughter to sell her products, and they get up very early to sell to customers.

Eva is requesting the loan in order to purchase blouses, dresses, pants, skirts, etc. to stock her business and purchase merchandise for the Christmas season so she can meet the demand of her customers. She will also purchase products for making piñatas. She dreams of expanding her premises and being able to sell bric-a-brac.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, pants, skirts, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica  operates a general store where she sells different kinds of basic grocery products as an aid to her husband's income from working. She has been doing this for more than four years, earning well enough to also be able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used this loan in purchasing items for the store. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. She has a great plan for her future and for the family, and she wants to expand her business, increase her profit, and purchase a transport vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a buy and sell duck egg business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional trays of duck eggs to sell for her business. Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from buying and selling rice grains.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, snack foods, soft drinks, diapers, sanitary napkins, etc. to sell.

Helen has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, shampoo, snack foods, soft drinks, diapers, sanitary napkins, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nelbe

texts.en: Nelbe has operated a swine fattening business for a year to aid her husband's income from working. By selling pigs in the market, Nelbe earns well enough that she was able to support the school needs of her two children. She wants to improve her business and decided to joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase livestock feed. Improving her business is her great dream, for she wants to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 51 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Irma runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, milk, cream, etc. 

She requested a PHP 7, 000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, milk, cream, etc., to sell. In the future, Irma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, milk, cream, etc., to sell

loans.name: Fidel Manuel

texts.es:
Fidel  tiene 48 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los 3 hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Fidel trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz, arroz y maracuya y a la crianza de pollos  y cerdos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, herbicidas y parala balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos y cerdos.

El sueño es tener mayores ingresos para dar lo necesarios a los hijos para la educacion.

En los tiempos libres les gusta hacer deporte y salir de viaje.
texts.en:
Fidel is 48 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and their three children. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the '10 de Septiembre' loan group located in Lechugalito, a precinct that belongs to the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  

Fidel works in agriculture, planting corn, rice and passion fruit, and raising chickens and pigs to increase his family's budget. The crop that excels the most is corn. He sells the products in the market in Ventanas.

Fidel is asking for the loan for agriculture, to buy urea, seeds, herbicides and a balanced diet for fattening and raising chickens and pigs.

His dream is to have greater earnings in order to give his children what they need for their education. In his free time he likes to play sports and to travel.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, herbicides and a balanced diet for fattening and raising chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Dorayda

texts.es: Doña Dorayda tiene 41 años de edad, originaria de  la ciudad de Estelí. Casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos varios (perfumerías, cosméticos etc.). Negocio que inicio hace varios años, por ideas de sus amigas, quienes la incentivaron para vender productos de este tipo, el cual le ha generado excelentes resultados. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio rentable y muy demandado. Su meta próxima es seguir adelante para garantizar un buen futuro a su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar: perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que le generara buenas ganancias e incrementar la demanda. Su plan futuro es comprar vitrinas exhibir sus productos a todos los clientes.
texts.en:
Dorayda is 41 years old and she is from the city of Esteli.  She is married and has a son.  She sells various products (perfumes, cosmetics, etc.).  She started her business many years ago due to the encouragement of her friends who urged her to sell these products, and everything has gone very well.  It is a very profitable business because the products are always in demand.

Her next goal is to get ahead in order to guarantee a good future for her family.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc., with the goal of providing for all of her customer's needs.  She predicts that the loan will be a huge help in generating a higher income and in increasing the demand of her products.  Her plan for the future is to buy display cases to showcase her products to all of her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Niezel

texts.en:
Niezel is operating her swine fattening business to aid her husband's income from employment. She has been raising pigs for more than five years, earning well for a living. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase livestock supplies. Niezel is hopeful to gain more income and plans to save a portion of her profit for the future education of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock supplies

loans.name: Bernaliza

texts.en:
This is Bernaliza, 27, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bryan, an IT specialist, and they have a child. She and her husband are managing their household as they operate the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income to their family.

Bernaiza operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business.

Bernaliza hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro floans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is married with four children and operates a service based business while her husband is farming, their main source of income. She has been providing motor rental and transportation for three years earning good enough to aid her husband's income from farming. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit for motorcycle maintenance costs in order to provide a better services. Nila wants to have  a better living for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Urbanisación Leon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URBANISACIÓN LEON” iniciará el tercero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Benedicta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, tienda de Carnicería, tejido de mantas, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Benedicta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de busos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su madre y sus hijos, volviéndose un negocio familiar, posteriormente con un préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer amplio su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “URBANISACIÓN LEON” communal bank is starting their third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional branch. It is made up of 8 members, led by a board of directors with Benedicta as their President. The businesses of the members are varied: weaving sweaters, a meat store, weaving blankets and selling potatoes. 

The loan will help all these micro-entrepreneurs of which Benedicta is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, on the invitation of an adviser from the institution who came to visit her in her house. Benedicta has a business weaving and selling sweaters. She told us that she learned this activity together with her mother and her children, making this a family business. Later with a loan from Pro Mujer she expanded her business.

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital, buying wool that she'll buy in the markets of the city of La Paz. Later she will make them and sell them in her sales place. This method of work allows her to support her family. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the loans, health care and training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Fabricio Fidel

texts.es:
Fabricio  tiene 19 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos de dos años.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Fabricio trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollo.

El sueño es seguir incrementando el dinero para darle una mejor vida a la familia

En los tiempos libres les gusta hacer deporte con los vecionos del recinto
texts.en:
Fabricio is 19 years old, he is married, and he lives with his wife and their two children who are 2 years old. He lives in a region called Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. He is a member of a rural collective group called Association September 10, which is located in Lechugalito, a district in Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Fabricio works in agriculture.  He plants corn and raises chicken, all in order to improve his family's economic situation. The crop that excels is the corn, and he sells corn products in the marketplace in Ventanas.  He is seeking a loan for his agricultural work - to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and food in order to fatten up and raise the chicken.

His dream is to continue to make money so that he can give his family a better life. In his free time he likes to play sports with his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and food to fatten up and raise chicken.

loans.name: Algira

texts.en:
Algira is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has four children. Her husband is a driver. She is 30 years old. 

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, refrigerator, soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko), and hard drinks (beer), fish, and water. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Algira is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, refrigerator, soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko), and hard drinks (beer), fish, and water

loans.name: Isidory

texts.en:
Isidory is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Isidory is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Isidory has a sewing business in the Philippines. Isidory requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her sewing business.

Isidory has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Isidory would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ivy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Ivy has been in this business for one year now.

Ivy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jesselle

texts.en:
Jesselle works hard to support her family. Jesselle is married and has a coconut juice vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twoyears now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut for her business. In the future, Jesselle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for her business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta has been selling selling grocery items in her village for many years. She took her previous loan from GDMPC micro credit that she used to buy goods to sell and she has successfully repaid it. Currently, she has borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she plans to repair her store and expand her business in order to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: G.s. Dios Me Guia Group

texts.es:
El G.S Dios me Guía, está conformado por cinco integrantes cuatro mujeres y un hombre, padres  y madres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Son originarios de  la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Estas personas son personas que luchan día a  día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Jessica y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, blusas, faldas, short, ropa interior, toallas, juegos de camas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias de forma ambulante. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s Dios me Guia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The loan group "Dios me Guía" (God Guides Me) consists of five members, four women and one man, responsible fathers and mothers with ten children in their care. They are originally from the northern part of the country. They are characterized as hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. They are people who strive day after day to offer a better future to their children.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, the coordinator, Jessica, has a business of selling new clothing such as pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, underwear, towels, and bed linen sets. She works in her business some 10 hours a day as a street vendor. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working  capital and stock her business by buying merchandise so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income. 

The "Dios me Guia" group appreciates the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business of selling clothing such as pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, underwear, towels, and bed linen sets

loans.name: Bernardo Brumo

texts.es:
Bernardo tiene 33 años de edad  de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos .

Es integrante de ventanilla V.R.C.  Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto  Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
 
Bernardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos para luego vender. 

Solicita el crédito para la adquisicion de de semillas de maiz, fertilizantes, abonos y balanceados para crianza y engorde.

Las compras y ventas realizan en ventanas cada 15 dias. Su sueño es seguir cultivando mejor en la produccion. 

El desafío que enfrenta es combatir las plagas y enfermedades como la langosti

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con los hijos y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 33 years old. He lives with his common-law wife and their two children in Ventanas canton, in the province of Los Rios, He is a member of the " Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank which is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in Pueblo Viejo canton. The members work in agriculture. 

Bernardo grows corn and raises chickens to sell. He is requesting a loan to acquire corn seed, fertilizer, manure, and balanced feed. He does his biuying and selling in Ventanas every fortnight. His dream is to continue to improve his production. His challenge is to fight the infestations and diseases such as langosti. In his free time Bernardo enjoy being with his sons and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, manure and balanced feed.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 29 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, etc. 

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like snack foods, biscuits, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, etc., to sell. Jovelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like snack foods, biscuits, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras”  está constituida por 07 socios responsables que pasan a su 6to ciclo. Josefina  se dedica a la venta de papa rellena, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente.  Este negocio surgió  con la idea de mejorar su situación económica, pues de esta manera ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Su mayor deseo es de instalar su tienda de abarrotes. Su último crédito lo destinará para capital de trabajo, la cual comprará aceite, papa, limones y platos. Josefina es separada y tiene 07 hijos,  02 de ellos en etapa escolar. El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” está agradecido con el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Josefina se encuentra de pie es la segunda del lado derecho, viste polo negro y chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Triumphant Women) consists of 7 responsible members who are in their sixth loan cycle. Josefina sells stuffed potatoes as a street vendor. This business arose from the idea of improving her economic situation, since in this way she has been able to support her children in their education. Her greatest wish is to set up a grocery store. This latest loan will be used for working capital, and it will buy oil, potatoes, lemons, and plates. Josefina is separated and has 7 children, 2 of school age. 

The group "Mujeres Triunfadoras" is grateful for the loan offered to them and they promise to continue working hard. Josefina is standing; she is the second one on the right side, and she is wearing a black shirt and a lead-gray vest.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, lemons, and plates

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Danilo José, quien trabajo  como despachador en una ferretería, ahora se dedica a tiempo completo en su negocio de pulpería que ha formado con muchos esfuerzos con su esposa, unen sus esfuerzos para brindarle a su hijo los estudios y sea  prospero en la vida, solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio con productos como granos básicos, lácteos, pollo, cereales, verduras y frutas, así como también un poco de cosméticos y zapatos.
texts.en: Danilo José, who worked as a dispatcher in a hardware store, now works full time in his grocery store that he has set up with his wife with a lot of effort. They combine their efforts so that they may give their son an education and the potential to be successful in life. He requests this loan in order to invest in his business with products such as dry grains, dairy products, chicken, cereals, vegetables and fruits, as well as some cosmetics and shoes.

loans.use: to buy products such as dry grains, dairy products, chicken, cereals, vegetables and fruits, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesús

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre trabajador de 63 años de edad, que vela por el bienestar de su esposa y sus 4 hijos, a quienes h sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Desde hace 18 años tiene su propio negocio, una legumbrería donde ofrece todo tipo de frutas y verduras, su negocio está ubicado en un local del parque central del municipio donde reside, allí trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm y, de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia.
Actualmente tiene como meta fortalecer su negocio, por lo que se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, éste será invertido en la compra de estanterías y surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras), así podrá aumentar su capacidad instalada y ofrecer mayor variedad de alimentos para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de su clientela.
Ramiro con su carisma, empuje y perseverancia desea ampliar y acreditar mejor su negocio, para que este dé una mejor rentabilidad y así podrá dejar un buen legado a sus hijos y tendrá la posibilidad de brindar un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a hard-working 63-year-old man who safeguards the welfare of his wife and his four children, whom he has helped to get ahead with a lot of effort and dedication. He has had his own business for 18 years, a vegetable store where he offers all different types of fruit and vegetables. His business is located in a central park in the municipality he lives in. He works every day from 7:00am to 7:00pm, and in this way he generates sufficient income to settle his family’s basic expenses.

His current goal is to strengthen his business, which is why he is requesting this loan. He will invest it in purchasing shelves and wholesale stock (fruit and vegetables), thereby being able to increase his existing capacity and offer a greater variety of food to satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of his clientele.

Ramiro, with his charisma, effort, and perseverance, wishes to expand and establish his business better so that it will be more profitable, he will be able to leave a good legacy to his children, and he will have the possibility of offering a better life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and wholesale stock (fruit and vegetables)

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Félix es una persona emprendedora de la comunidad y se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años, el cuenta con dos manzanas de tierra actas para la agricultura, el se especializa en la siembra de maíz y algunas hortalizas como ser cebollas y repollos.
Don Félix  cuenta con toda la experiencia en esta actividad ya que desde su niñez con su padre  han sido agricultores, está solicitando el préstamo  nuevamente ya que el año pasado lo invirtió en la siembre de cebolla y le fue bien y este año lo quiere invertir para alquilar una manzana de tierra extra para aumentar su cosecha.
Don Félix sueña con tener un tractor propio y poder arar las tierras en su comunidad y mejorar sus ingresos.

Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Félix is an entrepreneurial person from the community and has made a living from agriculture since he was twelve years old. He has two units of land he uses for agriculture. He specializes in planting corn and a few vegetables like onions and cabbages.

Félix has all of this experience in this business because he has been a farmer with his father since his childhood. He is asking for a loan once more, as last year he invested in planting onions and it went well. This year he wants to invest in renting an extra unit of land to increase his harvest.

Félix dreams of having a tractor of his own, of being able to plow the lands in his community and of improving his earnings.

Danlí, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to rent land for his business

loans.name: Bermet

texts.en:
Bermet is a first-year student of AUCA, department of Business Administration. Here is her story:

“AUCA is the best university in Central Asia. It offers instruction for different professions. Classes are taught only in English, which encourages me to attend AUCA more. I am a winner of a FLEX program and had a great experience during my studies in America. 

According to AUCA students, professors give assignments to them that increase their knowledge of the business world and expand their horizons. When I was an exchange student, I took business administration credits. For the longest time, it was hard to decide whether my future profession is in public speaking or in business. Indeed, business administration includes both of them. Any business will not succeed without public speaking skills. 

AUCA will help me to meet my goals. Kyrgyzstan’s economy is very low compared to other countries. In my opinion, we need to build business not only within the country, but also need to build partnerships with different countries as well. I have a goal – I hope to run a business between three countries: Kyrgyzstan, USA and China. 

Compared to USA, AUCA has similar methods of education. Besides, AUCA does lots of extracurricular activities, such as flash mobs, volunteering projects and orientation weeks. Volunteering is a common thing in the US. However, it is not that developed in our country. In addition, while attending school in the US, I was on the honor roll for the entire year. 

I would also like to mention that AUCA not only educates it students on the top level, but also gives them financial support, so that they could make their dreams come true. I also want to apply for the loan and cover my tuition fees. The loan is given by Kiva.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is single, and she opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $200. 

She is running a business in her house by selling sugar, salt, coffee, cigarettes, noodles, slippers, Fanta, shampoo, milk, eggs and bread. She is making a good income from her selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She is also has animals like goats, buffaloes, cows and horses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, coffee, cigarettes, noodles, slippers, Fanta, shampoo, milk, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Emalin

texts.en: Emalin helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living and has been doing this for many years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for her farm. Now, she takes a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides to boost their farm. She is hopeful she will gain more returns from the farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en: Melchora helps her husband in their farm by planting and harvesting rice to make a living. They have been doing this for more than six years and she earns well for the family. Her previous loan was used for the farm inputs and she has successfully repaid it. Now, she takes a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides in order to improve the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of grocery goods in the village to earn a living. She has been in this business for many years earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to purchase additional products. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC  to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to expand her business to have a better source of income. In the future, Ruby wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is aged 55. She is married with seven children. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past ten years. With this loan, she plans to buy more bananas for making local brew for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for use in making alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Emerita

texts.es: Claudia tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y una hermana de 16 años d edad. Ella se gana la vida trabajando como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad. Con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Desea dar a su familia un mayor apoyo, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de colaborar con algunas mejoras de su vivienda que tanta falta le hacen. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el encementado del corredor de la vivienda y para construir un muro de retención con el fin de dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda y su familia. Con el crédito comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena, grava y hierro.
texts.en: Claudia is 19 years old. She lives in her own house along with her mother and a 16-year-old sister. She earns a living by working as an employee in an institution near her location. With the income that she receives from her work, she helps her family with the household expenses. She wants to give her family more support, and so she has decided to help with some improvements in their residence which are badly needed. She is applying to FUSAI  for this loan to invest in cementing the hallway of the house and to construct a retention wall with the goal of giving better security to her home and to her family. With the loan she will buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, and iron to cement the floor of the hallway and construct a retaining wall

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 43 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella es muy conocida en su comunidad como una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y responsable. Silvia se dedica  a la comercialización de gas propano desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma colabora con la economía del hogar. Desea repara el techo del corredor de su vivienda así como repellar las paredes de vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento y arena para repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo del corredor de la vivienda.
texts.en: Silvia is 43 years old. She lives in her own house along with her husband and their four children. She is very well known in her community as an entrepreneurial, hard-working, and responsible woman. Silvia has been selling propane gas for a long time, and in this way she helps with the household finances. She wants to repair the roof of the hallway of their home as well as plaster the walls of the house. To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of sheets of galvanized metal, cement, and sand to plaster the walls and change the roof of the hallway of the house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of galvanized metal, cement, and sand to plaster the walls and change the roof of the hallway of the house.

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquímedes es un joven de 23 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato, es soltero, vive con el papá y la mamá y dos hermanos. 

Arquímedes  trabaja como vendedor en una tienda del Municipio desde hace 4 años. Este trabajo lo aprendió  solo, ya que al salir de estudiar decidió buscar trabajo y en esa tienda le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar  y el necesitaba el trabajo para tener un empleo,  este trabajo está a una distancia  de 45 minutos de la casa, él viaja en bus y el horario que tiene en la tienda es de  7am a  4pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  una motocicleta  para viajar del trabajo a la casa,  ya que el bus que él viaja ya cuando sale de trabajar no pasa y le toca viajar en otros carros que van para la zona de la casa de él que lo dejan en un desvió y luego le toca caminar y por lo de la delincuencia le da miedo viajar así;  es por eso que quiere comprar una moto ya que teniendo su transporte propio saldrá más tarde de trabajar y así poder tener más comisiones.

Uno de sus sueños es poder estudiar y prepárese y así en un futuro llegar a tener su propia tienda esto le está sirviendo para tener conocimiento de los productos cuando ya pueda tener su propio negocio saber  lo  más se vende, esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y así poder ayudarles a sus padres que con mucho esfuerzo le pusieron a estudiar y desea recompensarles ese esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Arquímedes is a young man, age 23, who has his high school diploma. He is single, and lives with his father, his mother, and two brothers. 

He has worked as a salesman in a store in the city for 4 years.  He learned this work on his own-- he decided to look for a job upon finishing school because he needed employment, and he was given the opportunity to work in this store.  His job is about 45 minutes from his house, and he takes the bus to work.  His schedule at the store is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. 

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle to get from his job to his home because the bus that he takes is no longer running when he leaves work, and he has to travel in other cars that go to the neighborhood where his house is located.  They drop him off on a crossroad, and then he has to walk; but he is afraid to travel this way because of the crime.

This is why he wants to buy a motorcycle--having his own transportation, he will leave work later, and thus he will be able to make more commissions. 
 
One of his dreams is to study and prepare himself so that in the future he can have his own store. This is helping him to be knowledgeable about the products--when he has his own business, the more he knows, the more he will sell. 

He will make a great effort to achieve this, so that he will be able to help his parents. They worked very hard to give him an education, and he wants to repay their efforts.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle in order to travel from work to home.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely was married to a farmer in their village.  She helps him earn money with her business, raising pigs for sale. She has been doing this for more than five years and earns well. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase feed in order to boost her pigs.  She wants to earn more profit from this.  In the future, Fely wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Washington Jacinto

texts.es:
Washington  tiene 60 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los un hijo de 20 años.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Washington trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollo.

El sueño es viajar a Estados Unidos con toda la familia.

En los tiempos libres les gusta caminar por el campo
texts.en:
Washington is 60 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and their 20-year-old son. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the '10 de Septiembre' loan group located in Lechugalito, a precinct belonging to the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  

Washington works in agriculture, planting corn and raising chickens to increase his family's budget. The crop that excels the most is corn. He sells his products in the market in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan for agriculture, to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers and a balanced diet for fattening and raising chickens.

His dream is to travel to the United States with his entire family. In his free time he likes to walk through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers and a balanced diet for fattening and raising chickens.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 48 años de edad  es madre de tres hijos y habita junto a ellos, su suegra y un nieto. Julia se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tortillas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz), este negocio le permite llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su vivienda es muy humilde y desea mejorar el techo del corredor de la misma ya que la lámina se encuentra dañada y el agua se filtra cuando llueve. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines en su vivienda.
texts.en: Julia is 48 years old. She is the mother of three children and she lives with them along with her mother-in-law and a grandson. Julia makes a living by selling tortillas (a corn-based food item). This business allows her to sustain her children on a daily basis and give her family better living conditions. Her home is very small and she wants to improve the roof over the hallway, as the tiles are damaged and water leaks in when it rains. She is therefore asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized roof tiles and beams for her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized roof tiles and beams to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Luz, con 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, a los que sacó adelante sola, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo arduo. Se dedica a vender productos por catálogo de manera ambulante, además vende minutos a celular y productos de aseo; en algunas ocasiones se dirige al centro de la ciudad para realizar ventas en el sector, pero debido a que no posee el permiso de las autoridades de espacio público, esta actividad la realiza en pocas ocasiones. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (suplementos dietarios, productos de aseo personal y para el hogar, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la temporada decembrina, generándole mejores ingresos para el sustento familiar.
Luz, con perseverancia y empuje, desea seguir creciendo su negocio, aun cuando está en un sector de conflicto constante por los enfrentamientos entre bandas criminales, sim embargo, manifiesta que su meta principal es abrir un almacén en el que pueda vender sus artículos con mayor tranquilidad, para que le permita disfrutar una mejor rentabilidad y le dé la oportunidad de tener mejores condiciones de vida para dar a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 47 years old, a single mother of two children, whom she has raised alone, with much effort and difficult work. She works selling catalog products by going door-to-door. She also sells cell phone minutes and personal products. On some occasions she walks to the city center to sell there, but since she does not have permission from the authorities to use public space, she only does this activity on a few occasions. 

Currently she is requesting the support of a loan with which she wishes to buy merchandise in bulk (dietary supplements, toiletry products, home goods, among others). This will allow her to stock up in order to satisfy the demand that increases in the month of December, thereby generating better income for family support. 

Luz, with much perseverance and drive, wishes to continue growing her business, even when she is in a the geographical area of constant conflict due to the confrontations between criminal groups. However, she states that her principal goal is to open a grocery store in which she can sell her products with more tranquility, to enjoy greater profitability, and to have the opportunity to give better life conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (dietary supplements, toiletry products, home goods, among others)

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUENTE DE VIDA” iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, tejido de chompas, venta de zapatos, venta de repuesto para autos, venta de jugos, costura de cubrecamas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al haber visitado la institución y observar que todo lo que le ofrecían era favorable para su familia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar que este negocio era lucrativo, además que contaba con las herramientas para la comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de Frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Fuente de Vida" ("Life Source") will start its twenty-seventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana (Pan-American Focal Point). It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Alejandra is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank take on are varied. Between themselves there are: a grocery store, the knitting of sweaters, shoes sales, the sale of replacement parts for cars, juice sales, the sewing of bedspreads and vegetable sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microenterprises of which Alejandra is a member. She has indicated that she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago, being admitted upon visiting the institution and observing that everything they offered her was favorable for her family. Currently she has a business selling juice. She says that she learned this business from observing that it was profitable. Furthermore, she had the tools to go to market. 

The loan that Alejandra will take out now is for increasing capital (by the purchase of wholesale fruit) that she will acquire from the outdoor markets in the city of El Alto and afterwards will sell in her sales space. This way of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible, because she is married and has three children.

When Alejandra is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en: Nely helps her husband with their own farm, planting different kinds of crops in order to make a living. She has been selling vegetables in the market and she earns well for the family. She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative recently and borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to improve their farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposo en casa propia. María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Tal como se muestra en la fotografía las paredes de la cocina se encuentran deterioradas y desea repararlas con el fin de asegurar sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena  y hierro, además si le alcanza también desea construir un baño.
texts.en: 52-year-old María lives in very humble conditions with her husband in a house they own. María has made a living by providing domestic services for a long time. As the photograph shows, the walls of the kitchen are deteriorating and she wants to repair them in order to safeguard her few belongings. She is therefore asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying brick, cement, sand and iron. If she has enough money, she also wants to build a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand and iron to build walls for the kitchen

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 33 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los un hijo de 1 años.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Manuel trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos y cerdos.

El sueño es viajar a la playa con la familia.

En los tiempos libres les gusta descansar y recostarse en el cesped
texts.en:
Manuel is 33 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 1-year-old son. He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the solidarity group "10th of September," which is located in Lechugalito. It is a district that is part of the Ventanas canton and the Los Rios province.

Manual works in agriculture. He plants corn and raises chickens and pigs to help his family's economy. The most important crop is corn. He sells his products in the market in Ventanas.

He is applying for the loan for his agricultural work to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and balanced feed to raise and fatten chickens and pigs. 

His dream is to travel to the beach with his family. In his free time he likes to rest and lie on the grass.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and balanced feed for raising and fattening chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married to a farmer in her village, and she helps him earn a living by weaving lampakanay leaves and selling on the market. She earns so well from this business that she is able to provide for the needs of her family. She took out a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to buy additional lampakanay leaves. In the future, she wants to become successful in her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional lampakanay leaves

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana es una mujer muy trabajadora; vive en un su casa de su familia en la zona de miraflores ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la costura y confeccion de presndas de vestir para niños y adultos; Susana se separo de su esposo ya hace 10 años atras encargandose de la educacion de sus hijos ella sola. Ella comienza sus actividades desde las 6 de la Mañana y termina a las 22 la zona de miraflores  de la ciudad, La Sra. Susana necesita el credito para poder adquirir una cortadora de tela y asi poder desarrolarse mejor en su actividad ya que su clientela solicita en mayor cantidad trabajos debido a que ella realiza sus trabajos con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño de la Sra. Susana es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking woman who lives in her home with her family in the Miraflores area located in the city of La Paz.  She sews and makes clothing for children and adults.  Susana separated from her husband 10 years ago and was in charge of her children’s education.  She begins working at 6:00 am and finishes at 10:00 pm in the Miraflores area of the city.  Susana needs this loan to buy fabric so that she can better develop her business because her customers have been requesting more work, given that she does quality work.

Susana’s dream is to have a higher income so that she can have a peaceful old age.  She wants to have a salary in her old age that will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo vive en casa de sus padres, el es empleado; su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la cuidad de La Paz.

Aldo requiere el crédito para invertir en comercio ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Aldo comprará relojes al por mayor y los venderá.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO  y la primera con KIVA, que tiene los créditos, y está muy satisfecho con el crédito.
texts.en:
Aldo lives with his parents and is an employee.  His home is located in the Sopocachi area of La Paz.

Aldo needs a loan to invest into his business because he wants to improve his income and quality of life.  Aldo will buy clocks/watches in quantity and will sell them.

This will be his second loan through IMPRO and his first through Kiva.  He is very happy with the loan.

loans.use: to buy clocks/watches for resale.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, tiene 52 años, está divorciada y en la actualidad vive en su casa propia junto a 03 de sus 04 hijos.
Rocío se dedica a la venta de comidas, trabaja en un establecimiento que alquila dentro de una sede estatal y ahí ofrece diversos platos que son del agrado de todos sus clientes, lleva en está actividad un promedio de 5 años y trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite decidir su horario de trabajo, puede manejar su tiempo y dedicarlo a diferentes actividades. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de algunos ingredientes que necesita para preparar la comida que pone a la venta como arroz, papa, carnes, condimentos, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
Rocio is 52 years old, divorced, and lives with three of her four children.  Rocia sells food, works from a rented location within a state headquarters where she offers her dishes that her customers enjoy.  She has been doing this for five years and her children help her.  What she likes most is that her work allows her to decide on her own hours and she can manage her time and dedicate it to other things.

She is asking for a loan of S/1,000 and is grateful for the opportunity and trust to get this loan.  She is also committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the money to buy ingredients that she needs, such as rice, potatoes, meats, condiments, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Don Marco, tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon junto a una hija. Su actividad económica actual, es la sastrería, lleva 16 años confeccionando trajes para toda ocasión, uniformes para escuelas, colegios, e instituciones públicas y privadas. Además  confecciona ropa para vender. 
Ha logrado establecer su negocio de sastrería con mucho esfuerzo, trabajo y además  con el apoyo de su esposa. Actualmente solicito otro préstamo para poder comprar telas para elaborar togas y birretes de graduación, ya que es la temporada de graduaciones en los colegios y escuelas y tiene demanda. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para tener mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 47 years old. He lives with his wife in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon with their daughter. His current work is tailoring; for 16 years, he has made outfits for all occasions and uniforms for schools and public and private institutions. In addition, he makes general clothing to sell.

He has succeeded in establishing a tailoring business with a lot of effort, work, and also with the support of his wife. He is currently requesting another loan in order to purchase fabric for making graduation gowns and caps, as it is the graduation season at the schools and there is a demand. His goal is to help his business to grow in order to have a better standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making graduation gowns and caps that have been ordered from him.

loans.name: Danilo Eduardo

texts.es:
Danilo tiene 40 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 12, 9, 6 y 3 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Danilo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar los abonos, urea, fertilizantes, herbicidas. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.
El sueño es comprar un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Danilo is forty years old and is in a civil union, he lives with his wife and children of 12, 9, 6 and 3 years old in the Ventanas canton [a territorial subdivision, below the level of province] of Los Rios Province.

He is a member of VRC SAN FRANCISCO, which is located in Recinto Pantano, part of the Ventanas canton, the members work in agriculture and livestock farming. Danilo works in agriculture, growing corn. He is asking for a loan to buy manure, urea, fertilizer and herbicide. These will be bought in Ventanas.

His dream is to buy a car. The challenges he faces are illnesses. In his free time he likes to play football.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and manure to grow corn.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho is 46 and an experienced farmer from a rural area of Bakan district, Pursat, a rice producing and trading area of Cambodia. Being a widow and a responsible mother of two children, Pho is very passionate about supporting her family by dedicating herself to her farming business, growing and harvesting rice to sell. Having been in this business for almost 30 years, she is now able to make approximately $13 per day. 

As she would like to improve the living conditions and sanitation of her family, she is asking for a loan of $800 to build a household toilet, which she has not had before. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Pho has been encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household toilet.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. Juanita is married and has a buying and selling of dry goods business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for seven years now.

Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juliana has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Juliana requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Juliana has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Juliana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sreynak

texts.en:
Sreynak is 24 years old and a single woman who currently lives with her father, a dentist in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Sreynak helps her father earn an income by cultivating rice on a few plots of farm land, earning approximately $5 per day. 

Sreynak would like to help her father to provide a better service to clients, so she is asking for a loan to buy some new dentistry tools. This loan will be a great help for Sreynak’s family, as well as their business.

loans.use: to buy some new dentistry tools.

loans.name: Vandy

texts.en:
Vandy, aged 38, is a hard working woman who owns and operates a rice farm in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She receives great support from her husband and children. Having been in this business for nearly 16 years, she is now able to earn approximately 12,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day.

Vandy is aiming to improve her farming business and make it more productive, so she wants to take out a loan to buy a water pump, which will be used to balance the water in her rice paddy. She is very thankful because the loan will be a great help with enabling her to develop her business. Water shortage will not be a challenge for her any more.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for her rice paddy

loans.name: G.s La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
G.S. LA unión hace la Fuerza está conformado por cuatro integrantes tres mujeres y un varón. Son originarios de la zona norte del país, esta zona se caracteriza por ser productores  de lácteos  como queso, cuajada, leche. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajador, ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. 
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Sixta  y tiene por actividad económica una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detérgete, frijoles, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus  productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. G.S. La Unión hace la Fuerza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Unión hace la Fuerza" (Unity Makes Strength) is made up of four members- three women and one man. They are natives of the northern area of the country; this region is known for its production of dairy products like cheese, curd, and milk. They are characterized as being responsible and hardworking with a desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, this member was not able to study for a career and was obligated to work from an early age.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Sixta is the coordinator. As her economic activity, she has a small grocery store in her home. This is a little store that sells grocery products in small quantities like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, beans, oil, juice, sodas, and matches.

She works at her business 12 hours a day offering her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of food products, so that in the not-so-distant future, she can get better earnings.

La Unión hace la Fuerza is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are offering to people with few resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have an honorable form of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock their business through buying and selling grocery products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, oil, juice, sodas, and matches.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
This is Florentina, 54, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Florentina operates a buying and selling business. What she basically does is buy products from Vita Plus, a supplier of different health products. Her products are different juices from different fruits, coffee, tea and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy Vita Plus products to expand her inventory.

Florentina dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more Vita Plus products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito patiently works on his family farm to attain a better quality of life for his family. He is 53 years old and doesn’t want to see his children working so hard in the field just to provide their daily needs, so he decided to request additional working capital amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This amount of loan will be used to pay for the labor cost of his co-farmer, and part of it will be used in the purchase of fertilizers. He hopes to get his requested loan in order to improve his crop production and sales this next harvest season.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of his co-farmer and to purchase fertilizers for his farming business

loans.name: Carmen Dolores

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 21 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Carmen se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes y semillas para la siembra. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
Carmen is 21 years old, she is single and has two children. She lives with her children in the Ventanas canton [a territorial subdivision, below the level of province] of Los Rios Province.

She is a member of VRC SAN FRANCISCO, which is located in Recinto Pantano, part of the Ventanas canton whose members work in agriculture and livestock farming. 

Carmen works in growing corn and rice. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for sowing. With the help of the loan, she can buy what she needs for farming. Her dream is to buy land to build her own house.

The challenges she faces are illnesses. In her free time she likes to knit.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to sow corn.

loans.name: Gladys Emperatriz

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 39 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 18 años vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, urea, fertilizantes, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar básquet.
texts.en:
Gladys is 39 years old, she is single and has two children of 19 and 18 years old. She lives in the Ventanas canton [a territorial subdivision, below the level of province] of Los Rios Province.

She is a member of VRC SAN FRANCISCO, which is located in Recinto Pantano, part of the Ventanas canton, whose members work in agriculture and livestock farming. 

Gladys works in farming, growing corn. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and herbicides.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for farming. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges she faces are illnesses. In her free time she likes to play basketball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and urea to grow corn.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jovencia is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jovencia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Jovencia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Jovencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Junefe

texts.en:
Junefe works hard to support her family. Junefe has a live-in partner and has a business in the direct selling of a collection of personal products in the Philippines.

Junefe requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Junefe has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Junefe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from personal collection to sell

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 45 years old and married with one child.

Juvelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Juvelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from direct selling a collection of personal products.

Juvelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Richard Alex

texts.es: Don Richard es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de dos hijos. Tiene 39 años de edad. Es de oficio agricultor, se dedica al cuido de ganado de ordeño y a la operación de maquinarias. Inicio su negocio hace varios años con la compra de ganado con dinero propio. Su meta próxima es mantener su ganado bien cuidado. Solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos para el ganado. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mantener a sus vacas bien alimentadas en el verano. Su plan futuro es obtener un nuevo crédito y comprar mas vacas.
texts.en:
Don Richard is originally from the city of Boaco, married and father of two children. He is 39 years old. He works in farming, raising dairy cows and in the operation of machinery.

He started his business several years ago with the purchase of dairy cows with his own money.

His next goal is to keep his dairy cows well cared for. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle feed. He estimates the loan will be of great help because it will help him keep his cows well fed in summer.

His future plan is to get a new loan and buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Hermohenes

texts.en:
Hermohenes is 59 years old and married. He grows rice and earned 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) last harvest season. He has been engaged in this activity for over 18 years. According to him, farming is a difficult task, but still, he is very motivated to work because he earns more income in this business. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. With these inputs and hard work, he knows that he can exceed his previous income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 35 years old and has a live-in partner with two children. With two children in school, Lenie works very hard to provide for them.

Lenie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Lenie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, fabric conditioner, etc. 

In the future, Lenie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: 02050302_Phong Mỹ, Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
