Mrs. Đào has a retail business, selling general things. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, sugar, candy and dry food to resell.

Đào is 28 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 02050302_Phong Mỹ, Hoằng Phong solidarity group. 

Đào supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Đào joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Đào has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Đào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Đào hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, candy and dry food to resell.

loans.name: 3.09.610.04.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Huệ is 25 years old, and she is married with two children. Huệ is the group leader of the 3.09.610.04.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2013, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora has a live-in partner and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Leonora has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gladys works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling plasticware. Gladys is borrowing 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Gladys has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: 3.09.608.11.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell.

Huệ is 36 years old, and she is married with two children. Huệ is the group leader of the 3.09.608.11.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором 42-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая в городе Турсунзаде. Она многодетная мать. У нее шестеро детей и все они учатся в школе. Дилором является фермером. Она последние 8 лет занимается растениеводством. У нее приусадебный участок орошаемой земли и она выращивает там огородные культуры. В данный момент Дилором готовится к посеву. К сожалению ее собственного сбережения не хватает, чтобы купить семена картофеля, лука и минеральные удобрения. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она действительно нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Dilorom is a 42 year-old married woman, living in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is a mother of many children.  She has six children, and all of them attend a school.  Dilorom is a farmer.  She has been involved in agriculture for the last 8 years.  She has a plot of irrigated land by her house, where she grows garden crops.  At the present time, Dilorom is getting ready for a sowing.  Unfortunately, her own savings are not enough to buy potato and onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.  This is why she requested a loan.  She really needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.ru: Чонибек житель села района Шахритуса. Ему 38 лет. Чонибек хочет начать новый бизнес животноводства. Но чтобы начать данный бизнес у него не хватает средств и он решил обратиться к Вам за помощью. Чонибек на сумму от финансирования купил необходимое количество скотов. У него имеется собственный коровник и две коровы. Чонибек умеет обращаться со скотами, и он свое мастерство вложит в свой бизнес. Чонибек надеется и верит, что ему помогут, и он начнет свою деятельность. Чонибек считает, начав данный бизнес у него и у его семьи улучшиться жизненные условия.
texts.en: Jonibek is a resident of the Shahrituz district.  He is 38 years old.  Jonibek wants to start a new business in animal husbandry, but he does not have enough money to start the business, so he decided to come to You for help.  Jonibek bought the necessary quantity of livestock with the financed amount. He has his own cowshed and two cows.  Jonibek knows how to deal with livestock and will invest his skills into his own business.  Jonibek hopes and believes that he will be helped and he will start his business.  Jonibek thinks that after starting this business, his and his family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his animal husbandry business

loans.name: Avazjon

texts.en:
Avazjon is a hard-working man. He lives with his family in a rural area. He is married. His wife has been busy, growing agricultural products. He raises three children. 

Avazjon has had his business with animal husbandry more than 12 years. He has great experience. Avazjon feeds sheep. He must, to organize a ceremony of circumstance of his son, but he has not money. He is asking for a loan of TJS 7,000 (somoni) to make a ceremony. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to make a ceremony circumstance of his son.

loans.name: Umry

texts.ru: Умри родилась в 1963 году. Она вдова и имеет одну дочь. Умри является повторной клиенткой ИМОНа и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она очень честный человек. Умри работает уже более 12 лет в центре Психологов. Она имеет высшее образование. Ее коллеги знают ее как добросовестную и интеллигентную женщину. Умри дома не имеет водохранилище. Так как летом в ее районе возникает проблема с питьевой водой, она нуждается в водохранилище. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, песок и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umry was born in 1963.  She is a widow and has one daughter.  Umry is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history.  She is a very honest person.  Umry has been working in the Psychology center for over 12 years.  She has a higher education.  Her colleagues know her as a conscientious and intelligent woman.  Umry does not have a water reservoir at home.  Because her district has drinking water shortages in the summer, she needs a reservoir.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase construction materials like cement, sand, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and sand to build a reservoir

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton de 43 años, esta casado y vive junto a sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Milton se dedica a la venta de comidas. Tiene su establecimiento en su casa propia en donde empieza a atender al caer la tarde. Sus ventas son muy buenas y sus ganancias económicas siempre son rentables y satisfactorias. Tiene este negocio desde hace 05 años, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa, anteriormente tenía una tienda pero no le daba los ingresos económicos necesarios por lo que optó por dedicarse a este negocio. A pesar que le va muy bien siente que no es suficiente, por eso complementa su negocio diario vendiendo gaseosas y cervezas, afortunadamente también le esta yendo bien en esta actividad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, huevos, aceites, verduras y otros ingredientes que usa en la preparación de los alimentos que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Milton is 43 years old, he is married and lives with his three children in his own house.

Milton works selling food. He has an establishment in his own house where he starts serving when evening falls. His sales are very good and his earnings are profitable and satisfactory. He has had this business for five years, and he works with the help of his wife. Previously they had a shop but it didn’t give them the necessary economic returns so they chose to do this business.

Despite everything going very well, it isn’t sufficient, and this is why they supplement their income selling sodas and beer, and luckily they have also done very well in that.

This time, he is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, which he is grateful for the opportunity available for his business plans. With the amount requested, he will buy rice, eggs, oil, vegetables and other ingredients that he will use in the preparation of the foods that he will put on sale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, eggs, oil, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is a 32-year-old married woman with two children who are going to school. She has a retail store where she sells different grocery products to people in the region, earning a net profit of USD 1.50 per day which usually goes for daily food.

As she would like to improve her living status and the sanitation of her family, she is asking for a loan of USD 500 to build a household latrine as she hasn't had one before. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sarim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Leab is a 49-year-old married woman and a loving mother of grown-up children. She is engaged in the agricultural sector farming rice on one hectare farmland in Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. Her parents have transmitted this business to her and she has been working in the business so far. From her current business, she is able to make approximately $3.00 per day.

Leab would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 700 to build a biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and have less smoke from wood or charcoal. Thanks to the green loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Leab’s family can gain access to a clean energy while protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe DJIGUISSEME, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bouwere, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de jarre, condiments, de poissons, des céréales, et de la restauration.                
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME  sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. La cliente SITAN la première assise à gauche est une vendeuse de poisson, elle compte acheter 150 kilo de poisson frais. Le poisson sera vendu au village au comptant en détail et souvent à crédit à une clientèle divers et variée. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000CFA. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité de vente de poisson.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group consists of married women who on average are 38 years of age with two children. All live in  traditional extended families in the village of Bouwere, part of the Konobougou district in the Barouéli prefecture of the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They trade in jars, condiments, fish, cereals, and food preparations. The women in the Djiguisseme group are on their eighth group loan.

The featured member is Sitan, who is the first sitting on the left. She is a fishmonger, and she intends to buy 150 kg of fresh fish.

The fish will be retailed in the village for cash and often on credit to a diverse and varied clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs. The monthly profits are fed back into the business of selling fish.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба живет вместе со своей семьей бедно на северной части Таджикистана. Трудное условие жизни заставила ее быть мотивированной и найти источник своего дохода. Ее муж трудовой мигрант. Насиба имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Насиба живет в доме ее свекрови. Ее муж не отправляет достаточно денег, чтобы она могла обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Насиба организовала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды несколько лет назад. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес и с такой целью обратилась в ИМОН. Насиба запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки детской одежды, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasiba lives together with her family poorly in the northern part of Tajikistan.  Difficult life conditions forced her to be motivated and find a source of income.  Her husband is a migrant worker.  Nasiba has two adolescent children.  Nasiba lives in her mother-in-law's house.  Her husband does not leave enough money for her to provide her children with all of the necessities.  Nasiba organized a new business in reselling children's clothing several years ago.  She wants to develop her business and came to IMON with this goal in mind.  Nasiba is requesting a loan in the amount 7500 somoni to purchase children's clothing in order to increase working capital.  She awaits you kindness.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing in order to increase working capital

loans.name: Victor Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 55 años pero tiene el entusiasmo de un joven de 20 años. Cada día trabaja en una empresa de venta de productos naturistas, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder llevar un sustento para su familia, sobre todo porque tiene 3 hijos.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones debido a las lluvias constantes; de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su vivienda de material noble ya que actualmente es de adobe”.
texts.en:
Pedro is a very hard-working man. He is 55 years old but has the enthusiasm of a 20-year-old. Every day he works at a business which sells natural products and this gives him an income to support his family, especially as he has 3 children. 

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to their support he will be able to buy building materials to carry out improvements to the roof of his home, which is in a poor condition after the constant rain. By doing this he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and keep working towards making his dream a reality: to build his home from good quality materials, as currently it is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Raul Enrique

texts.es: Raúl de 42 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 12 y 7 años y una hija de 3 años de edad. Raúl se dedica a la venta de pan francés, bebidas gaseosas y naturales desde hace mucho tiempo. Dicho negocio es lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su casa y dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de un cuarto de su vivienda ya que la lámina que actualmente posee se encuentra deteriorada. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para dar inicio a la reparación del techo lo antes posible y así dar a sus hijos mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Raúl is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two sons aged 12 and 7 and a 3-year-old daughter. For a long time Raúl has earned a living selling French bread, soft drinks and fizzy drinks. This business enables him to put food on the table every day and give his children what they need.

He wants to improve the condition of the roof on one of the rooms in his house since the galvanised sheeting which is there already has deteriorated. For this reason he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised metal sheets and beams so he can start repairing the roof as soon as possible and make the place more secure for his children.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheeting and beams to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: José de 63 años de edad habita junto a su querida esposa en casa propia. José  trabaja muy dura como mecánico desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el fin de asegurar su vivienda solicita este crédito FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de contención ya que actualmente está cubierto por lámina deteriorada el cual no es muy seguro. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old and lives with his beloved wife in his own house. José has worked very hard as a mechanic for a long time. 

In order to make his home more secure José is asking FUSAI for a loan to build a retaining wall, since currently it is covered with metal sheeting which has deteriorated and is not very safe. He will use the sum requested to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Oroskul

texts.ru: Ороскул 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Дети работают на рынке, помогают родителям материально. У Ороскул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ороскул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ороскул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, а также имеет небольшой земельный надел на котором сажает многолетние травы, подсолнух (семечки). После сбора урожая подсолнуха (семечек), перерабатывает и производит подсолнечное масло для личного использования. Для содержания скота у Ороскул имеются все необходимые условия.  Сено и корма на зимний период заготавливают сами. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ороскул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Ороскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Oroskul is 46 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. The children work at a market and help the parents financially.  Oroskul has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 14 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Oroskul's hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows and also a small land plot, wher she plants perennial herbs and sunflower (seeds).  After picking the sunflower harvest (seeds), she processes it and makes sunflower oil for personal consumption.  Oroskul has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock.  They prepare hay and feed for the winter by themselves.  The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Oroskul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a high price. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra de 30 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad.  Desde hace 10 años, Sandra se dedica a la venta variedad de ropa nueva en el mercado cercano a su localidad. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea mejorarlas poco a poco. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una acera en la salida de su vivienda y para la instalación del servicio de agua potable. Con el monto del crédito solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y pago de mano de obra. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her little 5-year-old son. For the last 10 years Sandra has earned a living selling a variety of new clothing at the market near where she lives. Her living conditions are very basic and she wants to gradually make improvements.

Sandra is asking for this loan from FUSAI to build a pavement outside her property and to install a drinking water supply. She will use the sum requested to buy cement, sand and gravel and pay for labour. She says she is able to meet the necessary loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel and pay for labour to build a pavement and install a drinking water supply

loans.name: Doussousouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DOUSSOUSOUMA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Mamaricissebougou commune de konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de jarre,  des condiments, des céréales,  de la restauration, etc.                
Les femmes du groupe DOUSSOUSOUMA  sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente BINTOU  la   seule assise est la restauratrice du groupe.  Elle compte acheter 1 sac de riz, et beaucoup de condiments. La vente de ses plats alimentaires se fait dans son  restaurant  au village. Sa clientèle est mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12500 FCFA. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité et dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle ambitionne construire un restauration en ciment avec des tôles ondulées.
texts.en:
The Doussousouma group consists of married women who on average are 38 years of age with two children. All live in traditional extended families in the village of Mamaricissebougou, part of the Konobougou district in the Barouéli prefecture of the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They trade in jars, condiments, cereal, food preparations, etc. The women in the Doussousouma group are on their ninth group loan.

The featured member is Bintou, who is the only one kneeling. She prepares food, and intends to buy one bag of rice and many condiments. Her food dishes are sold at her restaurant in the village to a mixed clientele.

She expects to achieve monthly profits of 12,500 CFA francs. The monthly profits will be reinjected into the business and will help deal with family expenses. Her ambition is to build a restaurant using cement blocks and corrugated sheet roofing.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Mangane

texts.fr:
Né en 1984 à Ségou, Monsieur Mangane est marié et réside dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses frères et autres parents à Heremakono Nord, un des  quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mangane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, alors il s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers tels, les  radios, des radios-cassettes, des cassettes, des lunettes, etc il y a environ 10 ans. Son activité est menée à la gare routière de Bougouni avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout de routiers. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après un premier prêt qui fut correctement remboursé, il sollicite son deuxième crédit pour acheter à Bamako,  15 radios, 3 cartons de cassettes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Segou, Mangane is married and lives in a traditional family with his brothers and other parents in Heremakono Nord, one of the neighborhoods in Bougouni (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Mangane, not having the chance to progress through school, started a business about ten years ago buying and selling various types of goods, like radios, tape players, cassette tapes, glasses, etc. He runs this business at the Bougouni bus station and sells to all types of customers, especially drivers. He is highly sought after because he sells quality products.

In order to satisfy his customers, who are growing in number, Mangane decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

After his first loan was repaid correctly, he is now seeking his second loan to buy 15 radios and three boxes of cassette tapes in Bamako.

With this loan he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support his family's expenses and pay the interest on his loan. He will reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José es un hombre trabajador de 38 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar como obrero de construcción en diferentes obras, así se ha ganado la vida y ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo de 12 años; pero, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, desea incursionar en la cría y comercialización de cerdos, para lo cual ya posee el espacio en su vivienda para adecuar las marraneras; por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de lechones,  una marrana para cría y el concentrado para alimentar los animales; esto le permitirá comenzar su producción para satisfacer la demanda que incrementa en la temporada decembrina, en la que el consumo de este tipo de carne aumenta por tradición; lo que le permitirá generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
José, con su empuje, actitud positiva y su perseverancia, desea seguir adelante con su proyecto productivo y espera lograr una buena producción para que esta le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable y poder ofrecer a su hijo una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
38-year-old José is a hard-working man who works in different jobs as a construction worker. This is how he has earned a living and managed to bring up his 12-year-old son. However, in order to improve his income, he wants to start out raising and selling pigs and has a suitable space at his home for the sows.

For this reason he is asking for the support of the loan to buy suckling pigs, a breeding sow and concentrated feed for the animals. This will enable him to start his production to meet the seasonal demand in December, when traditionally people eat more of this type of meat. This will allow him to generate extra income for his family. 

José has a lot of drive, positive attitude and perseverance and wants to make good progress with his pig production project. He hopes to be successful producing pigs as this will improve his financial stability and enable him to provide his son with a better education.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs, a breeding sow and concentrated feed for the animals.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou  est un homme marié de 53 et père de 6 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants chez  lui-même dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de Bougouni.
Il a fréquenté l’école moderne pendant des années puis il l’abandonne en classe de 6eme au profit des activités génératrices de revenus.
Il a tenté plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus mais sans réussite. Alors il décida  d’accompagner son oncle pour apprendre la vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus de 3 années, il maîtrise son activité.
 Pour agrandir son entreprise, il décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 1 tonne  de mais. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants.
Il est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.La vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni  et une partie est vendue dans les différentes villages le jour de marche hebdomadaire.
Avec ce prêt il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices il compte payé les intérêts du prêt, assuré les dépenses de la famille et agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
Seydou is 53 years old, married, and a father of six children. He lives with his wife and children in his own house in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood in Bougouni. 

He attended school for some years, but stopped in the sixth grade to start working. He tried several different jobs including selling shoes and fabric without success. Then he decided to accompany his uncle and learn how to sell cereals. 

With an experience of more than three years, he is now skilled in this area. To expand his business he decided to take out a loan with Soro Yiriwaso to buy one ton of corn. This is his first loan. 

He procures his goods in Bougouni and the surrounding villages. He makes his sales in the large market in Bougouni, and the weekly markets in other villages.

With this loan he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA. With these earnings he plans to pay the interest on his loan, take care of his family, and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Unguruza Group

texts.fr:
Dénise  fait partie du groupe  Unguruza  et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a  35 ans et est mariée  à Claver, un  commerçant.  Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 4 à 9 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de banane. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Denise is a member of the Unguruza group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and is married to Claver, a merchant. Together they have three children, aged from four to nine years old.

Denise sells bananas. She is on her third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell

loans.name: Kokadje Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOKADJE, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bouwere, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments,  des céréales et des articles divers.
 Les femmes du groupe KOKADJE  sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MARIETOU la première personne assise à gauche  est une vendeuse de farine de blé cuite. Elle compte acheter deux sacs de farine et de l’huile. La vente de la farine de blé cuite se fait au village, au comptant et en détail à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000CFA qui sera est réinjectée dans l’activité et aider son conjoint à subvenir aux besoins de la famille..
texts.en:
The Kokadje group consists of married women who on average are 38 years of age with two children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Bouwere, part of the Konobougou district in the Barouéli prefecture of the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell condiments, cereals and various items. The women in the Kokadje group are on their seventh solidarity loan.

The featured member is Marietou, who is the first person kneeling on the left. She is a vendor of cooked wheat flour. She intends to buy two bags of flour and oil. She retails the cooked wheat flour in the village, for cash to a mixed clientele.

She expects to achieve monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs, which will be fed back into the business and will help her spouse provide for the family.

loans.use: buy wheat flour and oil

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Mamaricissebougou commune de konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de fruits, légumes, condiments des céréales, des ustensiles, etc.                                                              
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI  sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises citées. 
La cliente BINTA   1 ère assise à gauche est vendeuse d’igname dans ce groupe.  Elle compte acheter 4 sacs d’igname qui seront vendu au village et aussi le jour de la foire au marché. Sa clientèle est mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité de  vente d’igname.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group consists of married women who on average are 43 years of age with two children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Mamaricissebougou, part of the Konobougou district in the Baroueli Prefecture of the Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) .

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell fruit, vegetables, cereals, condiments, utensils, etc. The women in the Tiessiri group are on their second solidarity loan. These amounts will be used to buy the goods mentioned.

The featured member is Binta who is the first kneeling on the left. She is a seller of yams in this group, and intends to buy four bags of yam to be sold in the village and also on market fair days, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs. Monthly profits will be fed back into the yam-selling business.

loans.use: buy yam tubers

loans.name: Mahmatkhuja

texts.ru: Махматхуджа житель района Шахритус.  Махматхудже 43 года. Он в этом районе живет уже много лет. Здесь у него семья и самые близкие люди. Махматхуджа занимается выращиванием пшеницы.  Сейчас он хочет параллельно заняться животноводством. Но чтобы начать данный бизнес ему потребуется немало средств. У Махматхучы нет достаточной суммы денег, чтобы купить маленьких бычков, которые станут основоположниками в его бизнесе. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. С надеждой на помощь.
texts.en: Mahmatkhuja is 43 years old and is a resident of Shahrituz, where he has been living for many years.  His family and his closest friends live in Shahrituz as well.  Currently, Mahmatkhuja grows crops, but he wants to start a new business of cattle raising, to run in parallel. However, to launch on this endeavor, he needs a lot of money.  At the moment, Mahmatkhuja  does not have enough to purchase the small calves which will become the foundation of this business.  He is asking for a loan to buy calves.  He is hoping for your help.

loans.use: To purchase calves in order to start a cattle raising business

loans.name: Tubandanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Simon  fait partie du groupe  Tubandanye  et habite à  Gitega. Il  a 61 ans et est marié  à Godelieve, une  cultivatrice.  Ensemble ils ont 1 enfants de 19 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de légume(poireaux,poivrons,...)depuis 15 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de légumes( poireaux,poivrons,...)   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Simon is a member of the Tubandanye group and lives in Gitega. He is 61 years old and is married to Godelieve, a farmer. Together they have one child who is 19 years old. 

Simon has been selling vegetables (leeks, peppers, etc.) for 15 years. He is on his third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy a large quantity of vegetables to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of vegetables (leeks, peppers, etc) to resell

loans.name: Tuzanyumwete Group

texts.fr:
Inès  fait partie du groupe  Tuzanyumwete  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée  à Antoine, un fonctionnaire.  Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l’un a 3 ans et l’autre 5 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (habits,…) depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’habits  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  acheter  une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the Tuzanyumwete group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and is married to Antoine, a public official. Together they have two children, aged three and five years old. Both children go to school. Ines also takes care of two orphans, who [also] go to school.

Ines has been in retail (selling clothing) for six years. She is on her fourth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing, which she will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy some land and see her children [continue] to go to school.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Shirimanimbere Group

texts.fr:
Pierre  fait partie du groupe  Shirimanimbere  et habite à  Cibitoke. Il  a 36 ans et est marié  à Adèle, une commerçante.  Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 9 mois à 10 ans  dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, savon, riz,…) depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter    50 kg de riz, 5 cartons de savons, 20 kg de haricot,… à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  accroître son capital jusqu'à 1 000 000 de franc burundais(649$)et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pierre is a member of the Shirimanimbere group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 36 years old and is married to Adele, a merchant. Together they have four children, aged from nine months to 10 years old. Two of the children go to school.

Pierre has been in retail (selling beans, soap, rice, etc.) for six years. He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy 50 kilograms of rice, five boxes of soap, 20 kilograms of beans, etc., which he will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to save up 1,000,000 francs Burundais ($649 USD) and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, beans, etc. to resell

loans.name: Carlos Fonseca Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman tres socias microempresarias exitosas una de ellas es Paula mujer de 53 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y nueva ambulante en  desde hace 16 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de ropa nueva como camisas hollister, camisetas trico textil, capri, blusas, pantalones alicrados, pantalones para niños, pantalones zolo, big time, american rooster, etc. Marisol tiene 33 años su negocio es una pulpería y Isabel mujer de 37 años su negocio es venta de ropa íntima y cosmeticos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful microentrepreneurs. One of them is Paula, who is 53 years old and married. Her business has been selling new and used clothes as a street vendor for the last 16 years. She has been a client of the microfinance institution for 5 years. The loan will be used to buy new clothing, like Hollister t-shirts, Tricotextil t-shirts, Capri pants, blouses, stretch pants, pants for children, Zolo, Big Time, American Rooster pants, etc. 

Marisol is 33 years old and her business is a small grocery store, and Isabel is a 37-year-old woman whose business is selling underwear and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy new clothing like Hollister t-shirts, Tricotextil t-shirts, capri pants, blouses, stretch pants, pants for children, Zolo, Big Time, American Rooster pants, etc.

loans.name: Irafasha Group

texts.fr:
Anicet  fait partie du groupe  Irafasha  et habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 41 ans et est marié  à Jovanie, une femme de ménage.  Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de  1 à 14 ans dont 4 étudient. 
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de  limonade  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup de caisses de limonade(20 caisses)   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter  une  voiture  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Anicet is a member of the Irafasha group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 41 years old and married to Jovanie, a housekeeper. Together they have six children, aged from one to 14 years old. Four of the children go to school. He also takes care of two other children from his extended family. They also go to school.

Anicet has been selling lemonade for six years. He is on his seventh loan from Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy 20 cases of lemonade, which he will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a car and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of lemonade

loans.name: Ziganya Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  fait partie du groupe  Ziganya   et habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 24 ans et est marié  à Virginie, une commerçante.  

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique(piles, bougies,...)et de manioc sec  depuis  1 an et 6 mois.

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   400kg de manioc sec, 2 cartons de piles, un carton de bougies   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être grossiste de manioc sec.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the Ziganya group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 24 years old and is married to Virginie, a merchant. 

Emmanuel has been in retail (selling batteries, candles, dried cassava, etc.) for a year and a half. He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy 400 kilograms of dried cassava, two boxes of batteries, a box of candles, which he will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler of dried cassava.

loans.use: to buy cassava, batteries, candles to resell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye extension qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et au ont moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les Tissus, Produits Cosmétiques, Beurre de Karité, Huiles et autres. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Sanata  est un membre du groupe Danaya deuxième personne assise de droite à gauche  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habits  pour enfants. Elle se procure de ces habits et autres  à Koutiala et les vend au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 00CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sanata compte réaliser  110 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from around Hamdallaye who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are, on average, 32 years old, married, and have at least four children.

This group of women sells various goods, like fabric, cosmetics, shea butter, and oil. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Sanata is a member of the Danaya group and is seated second from the right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy children's clothing. She procures this clothing and other [types] from Koutiala and sells them for cash from her home or at the market to different types of customers.

While the other group members hope to earn an average profit of 90,000 francs CFA during this cycle, Sanata hopes to earn 110,000 francs CFA.  In addition to repaying the loan, she will use a part of the earnings to pay her staff and a part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: El Diamante Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Mercedes tiene la edad de 23 años, casada, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan en Nandaime, Managua y Masaya desde hace 6 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan como es harina, manteca, mantequilla, azúcar, levadura, sal, bolsa, leña, transporte. Claudina mujer de 53 años su negocio es la venta de frijoles y tortillas desde hace 6 años, Dalilla mujer de 37 años su negocio es panadería desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
This group has three small business members. One of these members is Mercedes, who is 23 years old and married. Her business, which she stared six years ago, is the production and sale of bread in Nandaime, Managua and Masaya. She is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials for making the bread, such as flour, lard, butter, sugar, yeast, salt, bags, firewood and transportation. 

Claudina, a 53-year-old woman, has been selling beans and tortillas for six years as her business. 

Dalilla is a 37-year-old woman who has had a bakery for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bread such as flour, lard, butter, sugar, yeast, salt, bags, firewood and transportation.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman tres socias una de ellas es Marling mujer de 40 años, casada, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, distribuye en su comunidad y alrededores los productos. Requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería  pantalones de varón, pantalones de damas, blusas, camisas, camisolas, shores, ropa de niños, sandalias de diferentes estilos. Cira mujer de 50 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una mini pulpería, Sara mujer de  53 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three members, one of which is Marling, a 40-year old married woman with three children under her care. She has been in the clothing sales business for 3 years and distributes the products in her community and the surrounding areas. She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as men's pants, ladies' pants, blouses, shirts, camisoles, shorts, children's clothing, and sandals of different styles. 

Cira, a 50-year-old woman, has made a living in clothing sales and has a mini grocery store. Sara, a 53-year-old woman, sells nacatamales [a Nicaraguan style tamal].

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as men's pants, ladies' pants, blouses, shirts, camisoles, shorts, children's clothing, and sandals of different styles.

loans.name: Blanca Nieve Group

texts.es: Tania es una de la tres integrantes del grupo Blanca nieve tiene la edad de 23 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos en su comunidad y alrededores desde hace 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, pinturas de uñas, shampoo, tratamientos, etc. Maribel mujer de 37 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas, cosméticos, Erlis mujer de 36 años su negocio es la  venta de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Tania is one of the three members of the group Blanca Nieve [Snow White].  She's a 23-year-old woman and has a partner with two children in her care. Her business has been the sale of cosmetics in her community and neighborhood for the last year.  She's requesting a loan to purchase perfumes, deodorants, creams, nail polish, shampoo, treatments, etc.

Maribel is a 37-year-old woman whose business is the sale of tortillas and cosmetics, and Erlis, is a 36-year-old woman whose business is the sale of building materials.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, creams, nail polish, shampoo, treatments, etc.

loans.name: San Juaquin Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios emprendedores microempresarios uno de ellos es Santiago hombre de 39 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y prendas  desde hace 8 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 7 años. Está solicitando nuevamente el crédito para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisas escogidas y prendas como anillos, relojes, cadenas. Damaris mujer de 33 años se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, tortillas, enchiladas, Tania tiene 29 años se dedica a la venta de nacatamales.
texts.en:
The group is formed by three entrepreneurial partners who are micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Santiago a 39-year-old man, who is married with 2 children. His business for the last 8 years has been the sale of used clothing and jewelry. He's been a client of the institution for 7 years. He is requesting another loan to purchase merchandise like pants, select shirts and jewelry items like rings, watches, and necklaces. 

Damaris is female, 33 years old, and sells food items like Nicaraguan tamales, tortillas, and enchiladas. Tania is 29 years old and also sells Nicaraguan tamales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pants, select shirts, and jewelry items like rings, watches, and necklaces.

loans.name: Socorro Group

texts.es: Rosaura es una de las cuatro integrantes del grupo, ella tiene la edad de 37  años, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y zapatos desde hace 8 años. Tiene 2  años de pertenecer como cliente de la institución, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de mercadería  en esta temporada pantalones de damas, de caballero, blusas, camisas, shores, faldas, ropa de niños, otros. Catalina mujer de 47 años su negocio es la venta de naranja, Janeth mujer de 31 años se dedica a la venta de artículos plásticos, Myriam mujer de 47 años su negocio es la venta de hojas de chaguites.
texts.en:
Rosaura is one of the four members of the group. She is 37 years old, married with two kids and for eight years has worked selling new clothes and shoes. For two years she has been a client of the institution and the loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise for this season of women's and men's pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, skirts, children's clothes and other items.

Catalina is a 47-year-old woman who has a business selling oranges; Janeth is a 31-year-old woman makes a living selling plastics; and Myriam is a 47-year-old woman who has a business selling banana leaves.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, which for this season is women's and men's pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, skirts, children's clothes, and other items.

loans.name: Dania Gabriela

texts.es: Dania es una persona comerciante trabajadora y luchadora de 27 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la compra y venta de zapatos de diferentes estilos desde hace 5 años, tiene a un muchacho que se encarga de venderle en el tramo que tiene ubicado en el tramo de su localidad. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de calzado de damas, de niños, niñas, colegiales, cerrado.
texts.en:
Dania is a 27-year-old and hard-working businesswoman. She is married with two children and her business for 5 years has been the resale of shoes in many styles. She employs a young man who is in charge of sales in his area of the neighborhood. 

The loan will be used to buy for women, boys and girls, school shoes and close-toed shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes for women, boys, girls, school shoes and close-toed shoes.

loans.name: Los Pescadores Group

texts.es: Este lo conforman tres socios comerciantes exitosos uno de ellos es Sady tiene 26 años, acompañada, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabones, aces, cloros, gaseosas, papel, café, sopa maggi, leña, queso, otros. Manuel tiene 53 años se dedica a la venta de pescados desde hace 15 años y  Juan tiene 37 años su negocio es la venta de pescados.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three successful merchants. One of them is Sady. She is 26 years old and has a partner with a child under her responsibility. For the last five years her business has been a small grocery store located in her home. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soaps, detergents, bleaches, soft drinks, paper, coffee, Maggi soup, firewood, cheese, and more.

Manuel is 53 years old and he has sold fish for 15 years. Juan, 37, has a fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soaps, detergents, bleaches, soft drinks, paper, coffee, Maggi soup, firewood, cheese, and others.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix hombre emprendedor de 64 años de edad, soltero, su negocio es un taller de zapatería que tiene ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 40 años. El junto a dos trabajadores más fabrica lo que sandalias para niñas. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. Está solicitando nuevamente crédito para la compra de materiales como cuero, fibra, forro, hebillas, hilo, remaches, pega amarilla, pega blanca.
texts.en: Félix is a male entrepreneur who is 64 years old and single. His owns a shoe workshop that has been located in his home for 40 years. Along with two other workers he manufactures children's sandals. He has been a client of the institution for one year. He is requesting another loan to purchase materials such as leather, fiber, lining, buckles, thread, rivets, yellow glue, and white glue.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as leather, fiber, lining, buckles, thread, rivets, and yellow and white glue

loans.name: Donald Antonio

texts.es: Donald es un hombre emprendedor de 42 años de edad, acompañado, con dos hijos que dependen de él, su negocio es la compra y venta de elotes y chilotes, desde hace 11 años se dedica a esta actividad económica. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año, lo que ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de elotes y chilotes al por mayor.
texts.en: Donald is an entrepreneurial 42 year old man, who has a partner and two dependent children. His business is the buying and selling of sweetcorn and green corn, and for eleven years he has been working in this job. He has been a client of the institution for one year, and he has shown that he is very responsible in his payments. He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale sweetcorn and green corn.

loans.use: To buy wholesale sweetcorn and green corn.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene la edad de 32 años, acompañada, con dos hijos  bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de quesillo en su comunidad y alrededores, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad 14 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de quesillo, tortillas, cremas, bolsas, cebolla, vinagre, chile, sal.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 32 years old and married with two children in her care. Her business is selling cheese for her town and the surrounding area. She has been doing this for 14 years. She is asking for a loan to buy cheese, tortillas, cream, bags, onion, vinegar, chile pepper, and salt.

loans.use: to buy cheese, tortillas, cream, bags, onion, vinegar, chile pepper, and salt.

loans.name: Juan Nicolas

texts.es: Juan es un hombre emprendedor y luchador de 34 años de edad, acompañado, con un hijo menor bajo su responsabilidad su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos desde hace 10 años, estos productos los distribuyen en su comunidad y alrededores. Tiene 1 años de ser cliente de la institución.
texts.en: Juan is an entrepreneurial and determined man of 34 years of age. He is in a relationship and has a young son under his care. His business is selling new clothing and cosmetics. For the last 10 years, he has distributed his products in his community and the surrounding area. He has been a client of this institution for one year.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, women's perfume, men's cologne, lotions, bodysuits and others.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer emprendedora de 40 años, acompañada, con dos hijos que dependan de ella, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos desde hace 3 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de perfumes extranjeros, cremas, bodys, delineadores, pinturas para aumentar sus lineas de ventas.
texts.en: Ana is an entrepeneurial 40 year old woman, with a partner and two dependent children. Her 3-year-old business is the sale of cosmetic products. She is asking for a loan to buy imported perfumes, body creams, eye liners and other make-up items in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase imported perfumes, body creams, eye liners and other make-up items in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Vamos En Victoria Group

texts.es:
LA asociación comunal Vamos en Victoria está conformado por nueve integrantes madres solteras con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de la zona norte del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Sandra y tiene por actividad económica es una Pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, aceite, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias  ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener  mejores ingresos.  La asociación Vamos en Victoria agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Vamos en Victoria" is made up of 9 members, single mothers with 15 children among the group. They are originally from the norther region of the country. In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately the group was unable to continue their studies since they were obligated to work from a young age. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to come out head, Sandra is the coordinator of the communal bank. She makes a living running a "pulpería," which is a small store that sells food products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, oil, juice, and soda. She spends more than 12 hours a day selling her products.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with food products so that in the near future she can increase her income.

The communal bank "Vamos en Victoria" is grateful for the assistance provided by Kiva lenders to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua by providing them with a better future.

loans.use: to stock her business by purchasing rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, oil, juice, and soda.

loans.name: Kotognongotala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognongotala est un regroupement de 9 femmes de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans, sont mariées et au ont moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, tissus, Soumbala, Savon, Bois de chauffe, Condiments, Beurre de Karité, Arachide et autres. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Madjè debout au milieu, est une vendeuse de Savons et autres articles divers.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de savon de diverses sortes. Elle se procure de ses articles et divers  à Koutiala en grande quantité et les vend en détail au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognongotala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 106 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Madjè compte réaliser  115 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognongotala is a group of nine women from Koutiala, who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are on average 41 years old, married, and have at least four children. This group of women sells various goods like fabrics, soumbala, soap, firewood, condiments, shea butter, groundnuts, etc.

To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Madje, standing in the middle, sells soap and other goods. She plans to use her loan to buy different types of soap. She buys these goods and other things from Koutiala at wholesale and then sells them at retail for cash from home and at a market to different kinds of customers.

While the other group members hope to earn an average profit of 106,000 francs CFA during each cycle, Madje hopes to earn 115,000 francs CFA.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use a part of her earnings to pay her staff and the other part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Nuevo Amanecer está conformada por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padre responsables de 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de la zona norte del país. Su zona se caracteriza por ser productora de leche, queso, cuajada. Son personas muy trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, pero eso no ha sido impedimento para que ellos puedan vencer los obstáculo  y situación adversar que se le han presentado en la lucha por la vida. 
Gracia a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Reyna y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  La Asociación comunal Nuevo Amanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer communal association is made up of nine members; eight ladies and one gentleman; mothers and fathers with 15 children under their care.  They are from the northern part of the country, known for being an area where milk, cheese, and milk curd is produced.  Its people are very hardworking, responsible, with a desire for personal success.  They were not able to attend school due to lack of resources, but this has not prevented them from overcoming the adverse obstacles and situations that have presented themselves in their life’s struggles.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, Reyna, the coordinator, has a food store where she sells rice, beans, juices, and soft drinks.  She works 12 hours a day and will use the money from this loan to stock her store with food items so that she will have better income in the near future.  The Nuevo Amanecer communal association is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide people of limited resources  from poor countries such as Nicaragua, the opportunity to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal El Esfuerzo está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con unos diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Martha  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, frijoles, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  EL Esfuerzo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "El Esfuerzo" communal bank  is made up of seven women and three men, all of whom are responsible mothers and fathers with around 10 children in their care, in total. Originally from Leon, a place located in the north of the country. The members can be characterised as hard-workers, responsible and with a desire to overcome any obstacles. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, they were not able to study and so were left with the need to work to help with the household bills. Currently, they struggle daily to offer their children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator Martha earns a living with a grocery store. It is a little shop that sells goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juice and soda. She works at her business approximately 12 hours a day selling her products. The aim of the loan is to invest working capital and stock her shop with groceries so that in the near future she will be able to earn a larger income. "El Esfuerzo" is grateful for the help Kiva lenders are providing to people with scarce resources, and who live in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in stock for their grocery store.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Fe y Esperanza está conformada por nueve integrantes, madre solteras con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre les gusta disfrutar de las compañías de sus familiares. En la actualidad luchan para brindarles   a sus hijos mejores oportunidades.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Cándida es la coordinadora y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es un pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, jugos, aceite, gaseosas, huevos.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas dirías ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fe y Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza [Faith and Hope] Communal Bank is made up of nine members, single mothers who have for ten children between them. They are from Malpaisillo, in western Nicaragua. These woman are hardworking, trustworthy, and ambitious to improve their lives. They enjoy spending free time with their families, but are now striving to provide greater opportunities to their children. 

Cándida is the group's coordinator and runs a small convenience store where she sells small amounts of groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk bread, juice, cooking oil, sodas, and eggs. Cándida works 12 hours a day at her store selling these goods. She is applying for a loan so that she can invest in working capital, increase her inventory, and earn higher income in the near future. 

The members of Fe y Esperanza group are grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people of limited means in poor countries such as Nicaragua. This support helps borrowers earn a decent, honest living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and increase her store's inventory of goods, such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, juice, cooking oil, sodas, and eggs.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Las Mariposas está conformada por diez integrantes madres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables  con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudieron estudiar. En la actualidad lucha  para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  María y tienen por actividad económica, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, aceite, fósforos, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, actividad que la realiza con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Las Mariposas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Las Mariposas Communal Bank is made up of 10 members, responsible mothers with 15 children in their care.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country, and are known for being hardworking and responsible and for having a desire for personal growth.  Unfortunately they were unable to attend school because they lacked the resources.  Currently they're striving to give their children a better future.

María's the coordinator thanks to her effort and a desire to get ahead.  Her business is a "pulpería," a small grocery store that sells small quantities of food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, oil, matches, eggs, juice, and soda.  She works about 12 hours a day, and does so with great pleasure.

The goal of María's loan is to invest in working capital and buy and sell food products to stock her store so she can earn more income in the near future.

Las Mariposas Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have the means to decent work.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Ríos de agua viva está conformada por 12 integrantes once mujeres y un hombre, padres familias responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Ayda y tiene por actividad la venta de ropa usada como pantalones, faldas, short, camisas, ropa de cama, ropa de niño. Ella dedica  a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de pacas de ropa de segunda mano, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ríos de agua Viva agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is comprised of 12 members, 11 women and 1 man. They are responsible mothers and fathers who have 15 children in their care. They are from Malpaisillo which is located in the western part of the country.  They are hardworking, responsible people with a desire to succeed. In their spare time, they enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately, they were not able to study and were obliged to work in order to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to their efforts and their desire to get ahead, the coordinator of the community bank, Ayda, works selling second hand clothes such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, bed clothes, pajamas, and kids clothes. She works about 10 hours a day selling her products. The goal of this loan is to gain working capital to supply her store with second hand clothes to sell so that, in the near future, she will have a better income. The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, bed clothes, pajamas, and kids clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Mujeres de Fortaleza está conformada por ocho integrantes mujeres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad luchan día a día para que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Petrona y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como ropa y zapatos pantalones, short, faldas, vestidos, camisas, sandalias deportivos, ropa de niños. Ella dedica a su negocio  unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería en general para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mujeres de Fortaleza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres de Fortaleza" communal bank is made up of eight responsible women, with a total of fifteen children under their responsibility. The members are all from Leon, in the west of the country and are all hard-working, responsible and have a desire to do better than ever before. In their free time, the members of the communal bank like to spend time in the company of their children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, the members were not able to study at university. They are now fighting every day in order to give their children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Petrona is the coordinator of this group. She makes a living selling merchandise - clothes, shoes, trousers, shorts, skirts, dresses, shirts, sandals and children's clothes. She works some ten hours every day selling her products. The aim for this loan is to invest it in working capital and to stock up her business of buying and selling merchandise. With it, in the not-too-distant future, Petrona hopes to earn a higher income. The "Mujeres de Fortaleza" group thanks Kiva investors for the help they are providing to poor countries like Nicaragua and for helping poor people to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business by buying merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, trousers, skirts, dresses, shirts, sandals and children's clothing.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal El buen pastor está conformada por siete mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos.
