Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Catalina y tiene por  actividad económica la una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jugos, huevos, aceite. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El buen pastor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Buen pastor" communal bank is made up of seven women and one man. They are all responsible mothers and fathers with a total of ten children under their responsibility. The members are all from Sauce, in the north of the country and are all hard-working, responsible and have a desire to do better than ever before. In their free time, the members of the communal bank like to spend time in the company of their children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, the members were not able to study at university. They are now fighting every day in order to give their children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Catalina is the coordinator of this group. She makes a living running a grocery store, a small shop where she sells consumable goods, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juices, eggs and oil, in small quantities. Catalina works some twelve hours every day. This loan will be invested in working capital for Catalina's business buying and selling consumable goods so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a better living. The "Buen pastor" group thanks Kiva investors for the help they are providing to poor countries like Nicaragua and for helping poor people to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with consumable goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juices, eggs, and oil.

loans.name: G.s Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Fe y Esperanza está conformado por cinco integrantes, madres solteras con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de León lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser  trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad luchan, día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Rafaela y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de cerdos en pie, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. El g.s. Fe y Esperanza agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Fe y Esperanza is made up of five members, single mothers with ten children under their care. They are originally from Leon, located in the western area of the country. They are characterized as hard workers and responsible, with the desire for self improvement. Nowadays they fight day by day to offer a better future to their children. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to come out ahead, Rafaela is the coordinator and as an economic activity she sells live hogs. The business is located in the western area of the country. She dedicates about 10 hours daily offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital in the purchase and sale of live hogs. 

The solidarity group Fe y Esperanza is grateful for the aid that the investors of Kiva offer to people with few resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business in the purchase and sale of live hogs.

loans.name: Juana Mayela

texts.es:
Juana de 26 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa y mercaderia general como  crema, perfumes, adornos, tintes del cabello. pantalones, vestidos, short, faldas, ropa interior, ropa de cama, toallas, ropa de niño. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Juana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escaso recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana is 26 years old. She is married and has a minor son. She is from León, located in the western part of the country. She is characterized as hardworking, responsible, and wanting to get ahead. Right now, she fights day to day to offer her son a better life. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to go to school due to a lack of resources.

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead, her economic activity is selling clothes and general merchandise such as creams, perfumes, decorations, hair dyes, pants, dresses, shorts, shirts, underwear, towels, and children's clothing. She spends around 12 hours a day at her business, selling her products. The business is located in her home. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that in the not so distant future she can obtain better income. Juana is grateful to for the help the Kiva lenders offer to low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her general merchandise store with products such as pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, linens, towels, children's clothing, creams, perfume, decorations, and hair dyes.

loans.name: Gleysi Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gleysi de 35 años de edad, casada con un hijo con tres hijos menores de edad. Es originaria de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, les prepara platos típicos  como sopa de leche. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo estudiar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, short, faldas, vestidos, blusas, ropa de cama, ropa de nino. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante y por encargo. todos los dias carga un bolso con unos 20 kg ofreciendo su productos. actividad que la desemepena con mucho gusto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa en general, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Gleysi agradece la ayuda que los inversinistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gleysi is 35 years old, married and has three children. Gleysi is originally from León, in the west of the country. She is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to do better than ever before. In her spare time Gleysi likes to enjoy the company of her children and prepare typical, Nicaraguan food for them, such as "sopa de leche" (a soup prepared using milk). Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, Gleysi was not able to study at university. Nowadays Gleysi fights every day in order to give her children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Gleysi has a business selling new clothes, such as a trousers, shorts, skirts, dresses, blouses, pyjamas and children's clothes. She works some ten hour every day, selling her products as a street vendor, as well as taking orders. Every day Gleysi goes out with a 20kg bag to sell her merchandise, and she enjoys her work. The aim of this loan is to invest it in working capital and to stock up her business of buying and selling clothes. With it, in the not-too-distant future, Gleysi will earn a higher income.  Gleysi thanks Kiva investors for the help that they are providing to poor countries such as a Nicaragua and for helping poor people to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy stock for her clothes store

loans.name: Estela Maria

texts.es:
Estela de 48 años de edad, madre soltera con una hija menor de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor  a su hija. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, short, blusas, ropa de cama, piyamas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Estela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Estela, 48, is the single mother of a minor child.  She's from León, located in the western part of the country.  She's known for being hardworking and responsible, and she wants to get ahead.  Currently she strives every day to give her daughter a better future.  Unfortunately she wasn't able to study for a career and she had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, Estela works selling a variety of merchandise such as pants, dresses, skirts, shorts, blouses, and pajamas.  The business is located in her home and she sells her products about 10 hours a day.

The goal of Estela's loan is to invest in working capital by buying and selling merchandise so she can earn a better income in the near future.

She's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to decent work.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: G.s. Los Coquitos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario los Coquitos esta conformado por tres integrantes Paz Catalina, Ery Neftali y Lidia, originaria de uno los municipios del norte de chinandega, zona que se caracteriza por la comercialización de ganado, venta de oro en bruto, comercio, Paz es la coordinadora del grupo la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de grupo y de las cuotas de pago en tiempo y forma, se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, adornos entre otros. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo como: ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros y de esa manera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. El Grupos solidario Los Coquitos agradecen mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos
texts.en:
The “Los Coquitos” group is made up of three members, Paz Catalina, Ery Neftali, and Lidia from one of the northern Chinandega communities, an area known for raising and selling livestock, raw gold, and commerce.  Paz is the group’s coordinator and is in charge of the group and payments.  She is in charge of selling merchandise in general, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, products, plastics, decorations and other things.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other things so she can cover her customer demand.  The :Los Coquitos” group is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support to people with low financial resources.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Corazón de  Jesús está conformada por 10 integrantes ocho mujeres y dos hombres, padres y  madres y padres responsables de veinte hijos. Son originarios de la zona norte del país, lugar que se caracteriza por ser productor de productos lácteos. Son personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron  cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Melida  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que v ende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jugos, fósforos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal  Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Corazon communal association is made up of 10 members, eight ladies and two gentlemen; responsible mothers and fathers with 20 children between them.  They live in the northern area of the country, known for producing dairy, products.  They are responsible, hardworking people with a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately, they were not able to study for careers due to a lack of resources and the need to go to work to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, Melida, the group’s coordinator, has a small store where she sells food items and small quantities of rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juices, matches, and soft drinks.

She works 12 hours a day offering her products.  She will use the money from this loan to invest into her food business so she can have better income in the near future.  The Corazon association is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide people from countries of low resources like Nicaragua, the opportunity to have a dignified source of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sonia Teresa

texts.es:
Sonia de 38 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad de 12,7 años es originaria de  Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como rubor, sombra, base, lápiz de ojos, lápiz labial, desmaquilladora, perfumes, crema de cuerpo, body. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de prendas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Sonia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old, married, and has two children, ages 12 and 7.  She is from Jinotepe, in the northern part of the country.  She is known as being responsible and hardworking with a desire for personal success.  She likes to spend time with her children in her spare time.  Unfortunately she was not able to attend school because she needed to go to work at an early age.  She strives every day to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead she sells cosmetics, such as rouge, shadow, base, eye liner, lipstick, makeup remover, perfumes, and body creams. She works 10 hours a day and will use the money from this loan to invest into her clothing business so that she can have a better income in the near future.  Sonia is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide people from countries of low resources like Nicaragua, the opportunity to have a dignified source of work.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Janett Argentina

texts.es:
Janett de 38 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 17 años el cual estudia en la universidad. Es originaria de  Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal,  en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de su hijo, lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudios y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día  día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijo, y lograr sus más grande sueno como es verlo formado en un profesional, realizado como persona de bien.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Janett agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Janett is 38 years old, marred, and has a 17-year-old son who is studying at university. She is from Jinotepe, a place in the northern part of the country. She can be described as a responsible, hardworking person with a desire for self-improvement. In her free time she likes to enjoy her son's company. Sadly she could not go to school and found herself having to work from an early age, to help with the household expenses. Now, she fights day in and day out to be able to give her son a better future, and to achieve her greatest dream, which is to see him trained in a profession and formed into a good person.

Thanks to her hard work and her drive to get ahead, she has a small grocery business. It is a little store that sells consumable products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, and soft drinks, in small amounts. She works some 12 hours a day offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business for buying and selling foods, so that in the near future she can make more money. Janett is grateful to the Kiva investors for the help they offer to people of few means and in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have some measure of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business for buying and selling consumable products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, matches, tomatoes, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Carolina Andrea

texts.es:
Carolina de 39 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originaria de  la zona central de la región,  y se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta artículos y ropa para bebe, como baberos, toallas húmedas, calcetines, mamelucos, sillas de bebe, toallas, pachas, platos, vasos, cucharas, de bebe, individuales, colchas, cunas, andaribel, carritos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de bebe, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Carolina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Carolina is a 39 year old single mother with two minor children. She's a native of the central part of the country and is known as a hardworking, responsible person who strives for self-improvement. In her free time she enjoys the company of her children. Regrettably, due to a lack of financial means, she was unable to study for a degree and had to work at a young age. Currently she works hard every day to provide her children with a better future. Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead she works in sales of baby items and clothes like bibs, wipes, socks, onesies, high chairs, towels, bottles, plates, glasses, baby spoons, place mats, bedspreads, cribs, and baby walkers. She devotes 12 hours a day to selling her products and placed her business in a specific part of town. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her baby item store so that she can improve her income in the not-too-distant future. Carolina is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a respectable line of work.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and stock her business with baby items like bibs, wipes, socks, onesies, high chairs, towels, bottles, plates, glasses, baby spoons, place mats, bedspreads, cribs, and baby walkers.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 48 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos menores de edad, de 10,8 anos. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta y reparación de bicicletas usadas. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de unos de los mercados de la región. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima para la reparación de la bicicleta como llantas, frenos, neumáticos, rayos, pintura, asientos, llaves, bombas de aire, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francisco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Francisco is 48 years old, married and has two children, aged 10 and 8 years old respectively. Francisco is originally from Leon, in the central part of Nicaragua. He is responsible. hard-working and has a desire to do better than he ever has before. Unfortunately Francisco could not study at university and he was obliged to work from a young age in order to help with household costs. He is currently fighting every day so as to give his children a better future.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, Francisco has a business selling a repairing used bicycles. He works some ten hours per day, with the business located in one of the region's markets. The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up his business with basic materials, such as tyres, brakes, wheels, paint, seats and air pumps, for repairing bicycles. With this, in the not-too-distant future, Francisco will be able to earn a higher living. Francisco is grateful to Kiva investors for helping poor countries like Nicaragua and for helping poor people to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up his business with tyres, wheels, braes, paint, seats, air pumps and chains.

loans.name: Gerald Jose

texts.es:
Gerald de 30  años de edad, soltero sin hijos, es originario de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona  de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser  emprendedor, trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de amigos y divertirse sanamente. El estudio sus estudios básicos, pero no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  diseño grafico. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica La serigrafía es una técnica de impresión empleada en el método de reproducción de documentos e imágenes sobre cualquier material, y consiste en transferir una tinta a través de una malla tensada en un marco, el paso de la tinta se bloquea en las áreas donde no habrá imagen mediante una emulsión. Y esta actividad la aplica en camisetas, tasas, vasos. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias desempeñando su actividad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima como camisetas, tintas, malla, vasos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Gerald agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gerald is 30 years old and single with no children. He is originally from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country. He is entrepreneurial, hardworking, responsible, and has a desire for personal growth. In his free moments he likes to enjoy the company of friends and have fun healthily. He completed his basic education but was unable to complete a university degree due to lack of financial resources. He would have liked to study graphic design.

Thanks to his effort and desire to get ahead, he makes a living screen printing. It is a printing technique used for reproducing documents and images on whatever type of material. It involves transferring ink through stretched mesh in a frame. Passing the ink blocks the areas where there is no image by means of emulsion. This activity can be applied to shirts, mugs, and drinking glasses. He dedicates 10 hours per day to this activity. 

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital to buy raw goods such as shirts, ink, mesh, and drinking glasses, so that in the near future he can increase his income. Gerald is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have the means for a respectable job.

loans.use: to stock his business with items for screen printing such as shirts, ink, mesh, and glasses.

loans.name: Martha  Lorena

texts.es:
Martha de 27 años de edad, madres solteras con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su hijo. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudios, por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de prendas  de oro y plata como aretes, anillo, collares, pulseras, dijes, omegas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. La rutina de trabajo de  Martha es carga un bulto de unos 20 kg de forma ambulante y  por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de prendas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha is 27 years old, a single mother with one son who is underage and she is originally from Sauce, a place situated in the north of the country. She is hard working, responsible and determined to succeed. In her spare time she likes to be with her son.
Sadly she could not finish her studies due to a lack of financias resources. Currently she is fighting to provide a better future for her son.

Thanks to her efforts and determination to get ahead, she has a business selling gold jewelry and silver earrings, ring, necklace, bracelet and charms. She works for 8 hours a day offering her products. Martha's work involves carrying a 20kg package of her products to sell on the move and through custom orders. 

The aim of the loan is to invest as working capital for her business buying and selling jewelry, so that in future she can improve her income. grateful to Kiva lenders who provide a dignified source of work to people with a lack of resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest as working capital in her business buying and sellinggold jewelry and silver earrings, ring, necklace, bracelet and charms

loans.name: Marina Lizbeth

texts.es:
Marina de 25 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha para brindar a sus hijo un futuro mejor.
Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, fósforos, jugos, galletas, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores  ingresos.  Marina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Marina is 25 years old and is married with one school-age child. She is a native of Leon, a place located in the western zone of the country. Marina is hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal growth. Regrettably, because of a lack of economic resources, she was not able to study for a degree and she found herself obligated to work from a young age. Currently, Marina fights to give her son a better future. Thanks to her effort and her wish to succeed she has a convenience store as a business. It is a small store that sells groceries available in small quantities, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, matches, juices, cookies and sodas. Marina dedicates 12 hours daily to her business, offering her products. Her store is located in her house. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business so that in the not-too-distant future she will be able to have better income. Marina is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her convenience store with the purchase and sale of groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, matches, juices, cookies and sodas.

loans.name: Regina De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Regina de 44 años de edad, madres solteras con 4 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del Leon. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera, se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a  día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica de comesticos como lapiz, vanidad, rubor, sombras, labiales, delineador. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Regina is 44 years old and is a single mother with four children in her care. She is from Leon, from a place that is located in the western area of Leon. She is known for being hard-working and responsible and for having the desire to overcome personal challenges. Unfortunately she wasn't able to study for a career; they were obligated to work from an early age to help with the living expenses. Currently she strives on a daily basis to provide her children with a better future.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she has a business selling cosmetics like pencils, compacts, blush, eye shadows, lipsticks and eyeliner. She works about ten hours a day offering her product.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that she may obtain better earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business buying and selling cosmetics like lipsticks, compacts, blush, eyeliner, eye shadows, eye pencil, cream and perfumes.

loans.name: G.s. Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El g.s Gracia a Dios está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras, con seis hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañías de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar, y en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos lácteos como leche, cuajada, queso, crema, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Gracias a Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Gracias a Dios group is made up of three members who are single mothers with a total of 6 children.  They are natives of Nagarote, a city that is located in the western region of the country.  They are known to be hard-working, responsible, eager to grow personally, and they enjoy being with their children in their spare time.  Unfortunately, the women were not able to attend school, but they fight everyday to provide their children with a better future.  

Thanks to her effort and desire to succeed, she has a business selling dairy products out of her home.  She spends about 12 hours a day working in her business.  Her plan for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with dairy products such as: milk, curd, cheese and cream, so that in the near future, she can improve her earnings.  

The Gracias a Dios group is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide people with scare resources in developing countries such as Nicaragua so they may have a dignified line of work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock their business with dairy products such as: milk, curds, cheese and cream.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Mujeres Responsables está conformada por  12 integrantes madres responsables con 20  hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de  Leon lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal.  En su tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus familiares. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar  para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Rosa y   tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan de forma ambulante y por encargo como picos, cachos, semitas, polvorones, maquetas cortadas, empanadas, pan de especies. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de pan, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mujeres Responsable agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Responsables communal bank is made up of 12 members who are mothers with a total of 20 children under their care.  They are natives of Leon, which is situated in the western region of the country.  They are known for being hardworking and responsible with a desire to succeed.  In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their families.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to pursue an education because they needed to work to help with household expenses.  They are now fighting to give their children a better future.  

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Rosa is their coordinator.  She has a business selling baked goods door-to-door, and by custom order.  She sells various pastries such as: picos, cachos, semitas, polvorones, maquetas cortadas, empanadas, and pan de especies.  She works about 10 hours a day selling her products.  

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and to supply her bakery so that in the near future she can increase her earnings.  

Mujeres responsables is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they may have a dignified line of work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock their bakery with various pastries: picos, cachos, semitas, polvorones, maquetas cortadas, empanadas, pan de especies.

loans.name: Estrella Del Apante Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Estrella del Apante está conformada por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un hombre padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Telica lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Paula y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos en pie, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias, ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Estrella del Apante agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Estrella del Apante, is made up of nine members: eight women and one man, mothers and fathers who have a total of 15 children under their care. They are natives of Telica, a place that is located in the western part of the country. They are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to study a profession and felt obligated to work from a young age in order to help with household expenses. 

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Paula is the coordinator. She has a business selling hogs out of her home.  She works eight hours a day selling her hogs. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business, so that in a not-so-distant future, she can increase her earnings. 

The Estrella del Apante community bank is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide them so that they can make a respectable living.

loans.use: invest in working capital and supply their business of buying and selling hogs.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Mujeres de confianza está conformada por ocho integrantes madres solteras, responsables 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar  a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora de la asociación comunal es Reyna y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas, galletas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mujeres de Confianza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Confianza” communal association is made up of eight members, all responsible single mothers with 15 children between them.  They are all from Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country.  They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and with a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to attend school and had to go to work an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, Reyna -the group’s coordinator- has a small convenience store and sells foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, matches, juices, soft drinks, and cookies.  She works 12 hours a day offering her products.  The store is in her home.  She will use the money from this loan to stock her store with food items so that she can have a better income in the near future.  “Mujeres de Confianza” is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to obtain dignified work.

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es: Grupo Formado por tres personas luchadoras una de ellas es María mujer de 50 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio venta de frijoles, tortillas y nacatamales, comercializa sus productos desde hace 16 años en su domicilio. Tiene de ser cliente de  la institución 6 años, está solicitando crédito nuevamente para la compra de materia prima como es maíz, leña, quintal de frijoles, hojas, cerdo, mecate, papa, arroz, achote, naranja agria, etc. Ha sido una persona muy responsable en cada una de sus cuotas. Lilliam mujer de 44 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada,  Ángela mujer de 58 años su negocio es la venta de chatarra.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three determined women, one of whom is María.  She is 50 years old, married and has two children in her care.  She sells beans, tortillas and nacatamales from home where she has been in business for 16 years.  

María has been a client of the institution for six years, and she is requesting a new loan to buy firewood, twine and food ingredients such as corn, beans, leaves, pork, potatoes, rice, annatto seed, sour orange, etc.  She has been very responsible in paying back her loans.

Lilliam, 44, sells cosmetics and second-hand clothing and Ángela, 58, has a scrap metal business.

loans.use: to buy firewood, twine and food ingredients.

loans.name: El Malinche Ii Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios microempresarios de éxitos uno de ellos es Patricia mujer de 40 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es  la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas, ella desde hace 10 años se dedica a esta actividad económica, ha sido cliente de la institución durante 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona muy cumplida en sus abonos. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo, pago de cortador y transporte. Cristoffer tiene la edad de 25 años se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y chequeador de taxi, Fatima mujer de 28 años su negocio es la compra y venta de tamarindo.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three successful entrepreneurs, one of whom is Patricia.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children in her care.  Her business is buying and selling fruit, which she has been doing for ten years.  She has been a client of the institution for three years and has always made her loan payments on time.

The loan she is requesting is to pay for the tamarind harvest, hire a worker and pay for transportation.

Cristoffer, 25, sells nacatamles and works as a taxi verifier.  Fatima, 28, buys and sells tamarind.

loans.use: To pay for tamarind harvest, hire workers and pay for transporation.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria mujer de de 45 años, soltera, su negocio es una pulpería que tiene en su domicilio desde hace 10 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo  está solicitando para la compra de mercadería de ropa para  esta temporada como es pantalones, camisas, blusas, shores, ropa de niño, juguetes, otros.
texts.en: Maria is 45 years old and she is single. Her business is a general store which she has run from her house for the past 10 years. She has been a client with this MFI for a year. She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing merchandise for this season such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shawls, children's clothing, toys, and other items.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise for this season such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shawls, children's clothing, toys, and other items.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg is a farmer from Kornidzor village of Syuniq region. He lives with his mother. Gevorg and his mother work in the government sector. Both of them work hard to be able to earn a living, but unfortunately their salaries are so low that they cannot afford a good living based on those salaries alone. To be able to cover the needs of his family Gevorg is engaged in breeding pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of grass. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of his family's income. His mother assists him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gevorg needs to make some investments in the business. A loan of USD 1500 will help him greatly, enabling him to purchase six new piglets, and to buy some forage for the livestock. Gevorg and his mother rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their help in maintaining and developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase six new piglets, and to buy some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Tevos

texts.en: Tevos is an experienced farmer from Argavand village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife. Tevos is employed in the government sector; he is the advisor of the head of the village local self-governance body. However, his salary alone is not enough to cover the family's daily needs. With the help of his wife, Tevos is engaged in breeding pigs, piglets and turkeys, and cultivating wheat, tomato, onion, eggplant, pepper, alfalfa and grapes. Tevos and his wife sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of family's income. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Tevos needs a loan of USD 1700 to purchase a steer, some forage for the livestock, and fertilizers. Tevos and his wife rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a steer, some forage for the livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda is a private entrepreneur from the city of Kapan in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and son. Her husband and son are employed in the private sector. For more than three years, Seda has run a small local grocery store, where she sells different grocery products in daily demand. The assortment of goods she sells in her store is not that big and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to function in a productive way and be compatible. Seda currently needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase new items to resell in her store. Seda and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain her small business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to resell in her store.

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar is a young agronomist from Ejmiatsin city in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. To take care of the family’s needs, Tsovinar and her family members are extensively engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in the cultivation of potatoes, apricots, peaches, plums, cherries, and grapes. 

Tsovinar’s husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of her family’s income. To continue running her agribusiness sustainably, Tsovinar needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 1500 will be a huge support to this young, hardworking woman and her family. It will enable her to purchase cellophane and pipes to construct a greenhouse, and to buy fertilizer, potato seeds, and harvesting services. 

Tsovinar and her family rely highly on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support in providing the loan amount needed to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane and pipes to construct a greenhouse, and to buy fertilizer, potato seeds, and harvesting services

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: Martha Asunción es una de las tres integrantes del grupo tiene la edad de 36 años, acompañada, su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace 2 años ubicada en su domicilio. Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirle más a su negocio y comprar  inventario arroz, azúcar, aceite, cajas de jabón, papel higiénico, queso, huevo, gaseosa, chiverías, etc.  Martha Patricia mujer de 31 años se dedica a la venta de leche y María mujer de 32  años se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Martha Asunción is one of the members of this group.  She is 36 years old, has a common-law husband and runs a grocery store from home which she has been doing for two years.  She is requesting a loan to buy goods for her business such as rice, sugar, oil, cases of soap, toilet paper, cheese, eggs, sodas, snacks, etc.

Martha Patricia, 31, sells milk and María, 32, sells clothing.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Los Cheles Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman tres socios trabajadores y luchadores. Oscar tiene la edad de 32 años, acompañado, su negocio es la siembra de perecederos, para posteriormente irlos a vender al mercado de su localidad. Quiere invertir en la siembra de pipián, yuca, banano y tomate, compra de abono, pago de mozo, transporte. Otro de los integrantes es Dina mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de perecederos y Soledad mujer de 51 años su negocio es la venta de verduras.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three determined workers.  Oscar, 32, has a common-law wife and he grows crops which he sells at the local market.  He wants to plant  chili peppers, yucca plant, banana and tomato.  He also wants to buy fertilizer, hire a worker and pay for transportation.

The other members of the group are Dina, 29, who sells agricultural produce and Soledad, 51, who sells vegetables.

loans.use: To plant crops, buy fertilizer and hire a worker and transportation.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Johana mujer de 42 años, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzado ambulante desde 6 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisetas, shores, pantalones de niños, calzado de niño, calzado de damas de diferentes estilos. Blanca mujer de 57 años, su negocio es la venta de refrescos y comida, Jamileth mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de  comida.
texts.en:
This group consists of three female members. One of them is Johana, who is 42 years old, married and has two children. She has made a living selling clothes and footwear as a street seller for the past 6 years. She has been a client of this MFI for 5 years. She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing merchandise such as trousers, shirts, shawls, children's trousers, children's shoes and different styles of women's footwear. 

The other members of the group are Blanca, who is 57 years old and makes a living selling food and drinks and Jamileth, who is 37 years old ad sells food for a living.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise such as trousers, shirts, shawls, children's trousers, children's shoes and different styles of women's footwear.

loans.name: Nicaraguita Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios de negocio uno de ellos es Meyling tiene la edad de 21 años, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos desde hace 6 meses en su comunidad, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, pinturas, labiales, maquillaje, shampoo. Alexandra mujer de 36 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Isidro tiene la edad de 46 años su negocio es la venta de molduras y marcos.
texts.en:
This group consists of three members. One of them is Meyling. She is 21 years old, married and has two children. She has made a living selling cosmetics for the last 6 months in her community. She is requesting this loan in order to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, make-up, lip balms and shampoo.

The other members are Alexandra, who is 36 years old and makes a living selling clothes and Isidro, who is 46 years old and makes a living selling moulds and frames.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, make-up, lip balms and shampoo.

loans.name: La Estrella Y El Lucero Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias exitosas una de ellas es Mariela tiene la edad de 24 años, acompañada, con un hijo menor bajo su cargo,  su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y calzado desde hace 3 años y medio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, camisetas, calzado de niños. Tania tiene 27 años su negocio es la venta de sopa y Erika tiene 25 años su negocio es la venta de cosmeticos, ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful entrepreneurial members. One of them is Mariela. She is 24 years old and has a partner and one child under her care. She has made a living selling used clothes and footwear for the past three and a half years. She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing merchandise such as trousers, blouses, children's clothes, shirts and children's footwear.

The other members are Tania, who is 27 years old and makes a living selling soup and Erika, who is 25 years old and makes a living selling cosmetics and both new and used clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise such as trousers, blouses, children's clothes, shirts and children's footwear.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is a young farmer from Norakert village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, 11-year-old daughter, and his parents. He and his father are employed in the government sector and are the main breadwinners of the family. Their salaries, however, are not enough to effectively cover the family's needs. Hovhannes is also engaged in breeding livestock of a cow and pigs, in aviculture, in viniculture and in cultivation of alfalfa. With the help of his family members Hovhannes sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

To be able to continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way Hovhannes needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a cow, to buy some forage for the livestock and to purchase fertilizer. Hovhannes and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, to buy some forage for the livestock and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik is an experienced farmer from Horom village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two sons. To take care of her family, Satenik is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, beekeeping, and cultivation of wheat and potatoes. Her husband and sons assist her greatly in her daily activities related to farming; they sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the family's main source of income. To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Satenik needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds. The loan will help her run her agribusiness in a productive way. Satenik and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the requested loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Araksi

texts.en:
Araksi is an experienced agronomist from Shamb village of the Syunik region. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children (two sons and a daughter). Her husband works in the private sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Araksi is engaged in cattle breeding, breeding a livestock of sheep, and cultivating wheat, cabbage, potatoes, apples, pears, and walnuts. She sells the products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Araksi needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fuel, to buy cellophane for greenhouse construction, and to renovate the greenhouse. She and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, to buy cellophane for greenhouse construction, and to renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Maranata Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socios emprendedores y luchadores uno de ellos es Blanca tiene 28 años, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de frutas en el tiangue  de su comunidad  desde hace 8 años, ella solicita crédito para invertir en un nuevo negocio como es la compra de especies como es achote, canela, clavo de olor, salsa inglesa, algodón, manzanilla, pimienta, anelina, azulillo, romero, otros. Hipólita tiene 57 años su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 15  años, Erick tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de bolsos desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three determined entrepreneurs, one of whom is Blanca.  She is 28 years old, has a common-law husband and sells fruits at the small market in her community.  She has been in business for eight years and is requesting a new loan to buy spices such as annatto, cinnamon, clove, camomille, pepper, rosemary, etc.

Hipólita, 57, has been selling fruits for 15 years.  Erick, 23, has been selling bags for four years.

loans.use: To buy spices such as annatto, cinnamon, clove,camomille, pepper, rosemary, etc.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias exitosas una de ellas es Doña Vilma tiene la edad de 56 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de comida desde hace 6 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 6 años. Lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus cuotas. Requiere nuevamente un crédito para invertir en la compra de cosecha de tamarindo. Isamar tiene 20 años su negocio es la elaboración de sartenes y Silvia tiene 24 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful members. One of them is Vilma. She is 56 years old and she is married. She has made a living selling food for the past 6 years. She has been a client of this MFI for the last 6 years, during which she has shown herself to be very responsible in her monthly payments. She is once more requesting a loan in order to invest in buying tamarind harvest.

The other members of the group are Isamar, who is 20 years old and makes a living making pans and Silvia, who is 24 years old and makes a living selling tortillas.

loans.use: to invest in buying tamarind harvest

loans.name: Katya

texts.en:
Katya is a farmer from Akner village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and 10-year-old son. Katya's husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. 

To take care of her family's needs Katya is engaged in an agribusiness. She breeds cattle, and sells the agricultural products in the local market. As life is getting more expensive day-by-day Katya needs to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to make ends meet. She currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase three cows. 

Katya and her family rely on the good-will of lenders and will be very grateful to them for helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is a farmer from Akner village of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife and four children (two school age daughters – 10 and 9 years old, and two little sons – 6 and 4 years old). For more than seven years, Artem has been extensively engaged in an agribusiness. He is involved in cattle-breeding and sells the agricultural products in the local market. Artem's wife assists him in his daily activities related to farming. The agribusiness is the main source of income for the family. 

To be able to effectively meet the increasing needs of his big family, Artem wants to expand his agribusiness a little bit. He needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase three cows. Artem and his family highly rely on the good-will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg is a young farmer from Gogaran village, in the Lori region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, 8-year-old daughter and 5-year-old son. To take care of his family Gevorg is extensively engaged in agribusiness. He is involved in cattle, sheep and pig breeding, in aviculture, and in the cultivation of wheat, potatoes, and alfalfa. He sells the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Gevorg's wife assists him in his daily activities related to farming. To sustain his agribusiness Gevorg needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase five calves, to buy some forage for the cattle, and to pay for harvesting services. Gevorg and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in fulfilling the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase five calves, to buy some forage for his cattle, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Progresando Juntos Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforma cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla tiene 24 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos que dependen de ella, su negocio es la venta de gallina desde hace 2 año. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de gallinas para posteriormente venderlas. Juana tiene 25 años su negocio es la venta de yoltamales y tortillas, Rosa mujer de 65 años su negocio es la venta de tamales, Lucrecia de 49 años de edad su negocio es la venta de productos varios.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising members, one of whom is Karla, 24. She is single and has two dependent children. She has had a business selling chickens for two years. 

She needs this loan to buy chickens which she will later sell. 

Juana, 25, sells corn tamales and tortillas. Rosa, 65, sells tamales. Lucrecia, 49, sells various products.

loans.use: to buy chickens which she will later sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a devoted mother from Panik village. She lives with her husband and three children (two boys and a girl). Together with her husband, Adelaida is involved in agribusiness. They own a plot of land where wheat, greens, and pear trees are cultivated. Adelaida's farm isn't very big. She also owns a pigs and piglets. Because Adelaida’s farm needs a lot of improvements Adelaida has applied for this loan. She is asking for a loan of $3000 to be able to purchase corn, wheat and barley seeds to allow her to enlarge the cultivation process. The loan is very important for this hardworking woman who does her best to ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for corn, wheat and barley seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: Grupo conformado por tres socias trabajadoras una de ellas es Marisol  mujer de 47 años, acompañada, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de nacatamales  desde hace 6 años, su compañero le ayuda a vender los nacatamales. Tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito  lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, papa, arroz, chile, sal, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, ajo, achote. Lucia mujer de 43 años su negocio es dar a trabajar un taxi, Bertha mujer de  48 años su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three hardworking members. One of them is Marisol, who is 47 years old and in a relationship. She runs a business making and selling nacatamales [a traditional dish similar to tamales]. She has been doing this for six years and her partner helps her to sell them.

Marisol has been a client of this institution for five years. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as corn, firewood, pork, chagüite [banana leaves], potatoes, rice, chili, salt, chiltoma [sweet pepper], onions, tomatoes, garlic and achiote [a distinctly colored and flavored mainstay of Central American food].

Lucia, 43, owns a taxi and pays someone to drive it; and Bertha, 48, owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food, such as corn, pork, potatoes, rice and chili.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Bazum village of Armenia’s Lori region. Anush is a mother of two sons. Her elder son is married and lives together with Anush, and Anush's younger son serves in the army.
Anush has been engaged in agribusiness for seven years. Together with her husband, they keep cows and chickens and cultivate potatoes and grass. The gathered harvest is sold in local open markets and the family is able to cover its daily needs.
Now, by applying for this loan, Anush is asking for financial support. Because of hard financial conditions, Anush and her husband aren't able to purchase forage and feed the livestock.
The loan of $3000 will help Anush to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and also make critical credit repayments.
The help of lenders is very important for Anush and she will be very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and make credit repayments.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is from Jojkan village, in the Lori region. He has been engaged in agriculture for 20 years. Specifically, Garik keeps chickens and cultivates wheat and barley. Garik also owns an orchard where different types of trees are grown (plum, cherry, grape, nut, etc.)
His father is a migrant worker who tries hard to sustain his family financially. Now, because of hard times, Garik needs support. He is asking for this loan to be able to purchase wheat and barley seeds and pay for cultivation work. As his father isn't with him, it is very difficult for Garik to gather the harvest alone and this is the reason he needs help.
The loan of $2,500 will greatly assist Garik and he will be very thankful to lenders for the support.

loans.use: to pay for wheat and barley seeds and pay for cultivation work.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is a farmer from Noyakert village of Ararat region. He lives with his wife, and two school age sons (8 and 6 years old). Vardan is employed in the private sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to provide a living. 

For more than ten years, Vardan has been engaged in an agribusiness to be able to meet his family's needs. With the help of his wife he is involved in cattle breeding, in breeding hens, and in cultivation of wheat and onions. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, and this is the main source of income for the family. 

To sustain his agribusiness, Vardan currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase forage for cattle, and to pay for harvesting services. Vardan and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for cattle, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Meliqset

texts.en: Meliqset is a young farmer from the Nor Vedi village in the Ararat region. He lives with his wife, three little sons, and his elderly pensioner father. To take care of his family he has engaged in cattle breeding, in viniculture, and in cultivation of corn, watermelon, tomatoes, apricots, and apples for the last 13 years. He sells the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of family's income. As their life is getting more expensive day by day Maliqset wants to expand his agribusiness to be able to meet their daily needs. A loan of $2,500 will be a huge support to this young hard-working man and his family and will enable him to purchase two steers and to buy some forage for his cattle. Meliqset and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and to buy some forage for his cattle.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is an agronomist from the Geghakert village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, twin 2-year-old sons, and her 4-year-old daughter. To be able to meet her family's needs Armine is engaged in the cultivation of flowers and strawberries. With the help of her husband she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Armine and her family have a greenhouse, where they grow flowers. As the family's needs are increasing with time Armine wants to expand her agribusiness to be able to meet their ends. She needs a loan of $1,500 to purchase the necessary materials (cellophane and bottles) for building a new greenhouse. Armine and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials (cellophane and bottles) for building a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is a young private entrepreneur from Voskehat village of Armavir region. She lives with her parents and sister. She is the main breadwinner of her family. To take care of her family's daily needs Meri runs a small local clothes boutique. She also has a photocopying machine in her boutique. The assortment of goods she sells is not that large and needs to be expanded and updated periodically in order for her small business to function in an effective and productive way. 

Meri currently needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase new items to resell in her boutique. The loan will make her small business become competitive. Meri and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to develop her small business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to resell in her boutique.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: Flor es una de las tres integrantes del grupo tiene la edad de 24 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como pinol, pinolillo desde hace 10 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo solicita nuevamente para la compra de quintal de maíz, leña, frambuesa, vainilla,canela, cacao  transporte. Ana mujer de 56 años su negocio es la venta de perecederos, María tiene 39 años su negocio es la venta de pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
Flor is one of the three members of this group. She is 24 years old and single. She has had a business selling corn products such as pinol and pinolillo (traditional drinks made of corn and cacao) for ten years. She has been a client of the institution for one year. She has applied for a loan to buy corn, firewood, raspberries, vanilla, cinnamon, and cacao and to pay for transport. 

Ana, 56, has a business selling perishable goods. María, 39, has a business selling pinol and pinolillo.

loans.use: to buy materials such as corn, firewood, raspberries, vanilla, cinnamon, cocoa, etc and to pay for transport costs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 57 años, esta casado y sus hijos ya son independientes. Vive en su casa propia al lado de esposa, su hermana y sus dos sobrinos. El trabajo de Miguel  consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas, cervezas, jugos envasados y agua mineral de distintas marcas. Todos los lunes realiza su pedido a las distribuidoras con las que trabaja, las mismas que le entregan los productos solicitados en su mismo domicilio, además de vender bebidas también vende hielo y chupetes de frutas regionales, trabaja en esta actividad por más de 04 años y con la ayuda de su hermana complementa su labor con la venta de pollo asado los fines de semana ya que ha visto en este negocio la oportunidad perfecta de vender mayor cantidad de bebidas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas tanto gaseosas, cervezas, jugos envasados y agua mineral.
texts.en: Miguel is 57 years old, married and his children are now independent adults. Miguel lives in a house, which he owns, with his wife, sister and two nephews. Miguel's work consists of selling different brands of fizzy drinks, beers, bottled juices and mineral water. Every Monday he orders stock from distributors, who deliver the products direct to his home. In addition to selling drinks, Miguel sells ice and fruit-flavoured ice-lollies. Miguel has been doing this work for over four years and, with the help of his sister, he also sells roast chicken at the weekend. He does this as he noticed it was the perfect way to sell his drinks in higher quantities. On this occasion Miguel is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles. He is grateful and happy to know that he can continue to rely on the financial support that he needs to progress with his business. Miguel will use this loan to buy larger quantities of drinks, including fizzy drinks, beer, bottled juices and mineral water.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Anyuta

texts.en: Anyuta is an experienced farmer from the Araqs village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, 9-year-old daughter and 4-year-old son. To take care of her family Anyuta is engaged in cultivating potatoes, greens, tomatoes and peppers. With the help of her husband Anyuta sells the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. As the family's needs are increasing day by day, and their life is getting even more expensive Anyuta wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the family's needs. A loan of $2,000 will be a huge help to this hard-working woman and her family enabling her to purchase materials (cellophane and pipes) for greenhouse construction and to buy fertilizers. Anyuta and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials (cellophane and pipes) for greenhouse construction and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Arlin Del Socorro

texts.es: Arlin mujer emprendedora y luchadora de 32 años de edad, acompañada, con tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa en su comunidad de Diria y alrededores, desde hace 3 años, lleva siendo cliente de la institución 2 años tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus cuotas. Solicita nuevamente crédito para la compra de mercadería como trajes de niños, pantalones de hombre pantalones de mujer, licras, pantalones para niños, blusas, etc.
texts.en: Arlin is a plucky and enterprising woman. She is 32 year old and has a partner and three children. She has a business selling clothes in her local community - Diria - and in the surrounding area. Arlin has had the business for three years and has been a customer with the communal bank for two years, during which time she proven herself to be very responsible with her repayments. Arlin is applying for a new loan in order to buy merchandise, such as children's clothes, men's and women's trousers, Lycra trousers for children, blouses, and more.
